story:
Short Summary

We've started an indiegogo campaign to help us raise money in order to be better able to help our community. With all of the issues happening in the emergency services, childhood obesity, and adulthood obesity and assaults, we want to help make our community, and the rest of our nation a safe, healthy place.

We've been squeezing by with old barns and school gyms, but we have no room to expand. If we're going to help people on a larger scale, we need a place that will accommodate that goal.

If we can achieve what we've set out to do, we can house our ideas and projects, doing what we can to prevent obesity, help emergency responders reach their full potential in the physical aspects of their jobs, and fight against assault and the battery of women.


Jack Hauprich and Chris Chacon attended the University of Southern Maine, studying Applied Exercise Science and Psychology with the vision of helping those around them. They have a background in self-defense, competitive weight-lifting, and nutritional consulting.

    What We Need & What You Get

    We are looking to obtain a facility in which we can adequately train people in fitness, self-defense, weightlifting, emergency response team fitness classes, and give nutritional advisory to all. In order to do this, we need your help.

    Our perks range anywhere from a month of free access to our brand new website, to free clothing, and even free fitness instructional videos!

    No matter what, the funds will go toward a facility to help the community, because that is our only goal. We will not stop until we make it happen.

    Risks & Challenges

    With large-scale projects like this, there are always challenges to be faced.

    Obtaining the right facility, in an accessible location, may take some time, as well as any renovations that may need to be done. However, these are minor challenges, and we are confident that we can overcome them with relative ease, especially with your help.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      Get the word out: share the videos. Find us on YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, and our newly-designed website, www.cjstrength.com, and tell your friends!

story:
At Grow Calgary, we are passionate leaders of the compassionate food movement. We believe in everyone’s right to access healthy, nutritious food no matter the circumstance.  Grow Calgary is a non-profit, volunteer-run, donation-driven, community urban farm and food access program. All of the produce planted, grown, and harvested by our volunteers is donated to the Calgary Interfaith Food Bank for distribution to in-need families and various community organizations. 

Our efforts are driven entirely by generous donations and the efforts of our beloved volunteers.  That’s where we’re hoping you come in.  

In 2013, we added Calgary's freshest produce to 2,000 food hampers; in 2014 that number grew to 12,000.   We need your help to expand our growing season and to increase our harvest in 2015. Our goal this year is to supplement 36,000 food hampers with fresh, organic vegetables!

What we really need to get to our goal is donations to purchase:

  • More locally-produced seeds
  • Materials to construct greenhouses (greenhouses allow us to extend our growing season significantly)
  • Materials to improve irrigation (did we mention, we have no running water on the farm?)

We also need materials to continue to develop our pollination, seed-saving, and composting programs and to increase our outreach to the community.

There are more ways you can help!

  • Like us on Facebook or follow us on Twitter to keep up to date with planting and harvesting season.  We’re always looking for more volunteers: volunteer@growcalgary.ca
  • Share this fundraiser with your friends and family to help raise awareness for Grow Calgary and to generate interest in similar projects throughout the country. 
  •  Make a material donation (equipment, signage, water storage etc.) or form a partnership.  If you are interested in making a material donation or interested in forming a partnership, please contact: paul@growcalgary.ca  

Nothing is too small.  We appreciate every bit of help!

Together we can make Calgary a healthier and more inclusive community.

story:
In November 2013, in partnership with the non-profit organization "The Lion Heart Initiative", our  Brazilian Jiu Jitsu (BJJ) team traveled from Stafford, VA to Senegal in West Africa to teach a series of BJJ seminars and to introduce the art to athletes there who had never had the opportunity to train in BJJ. We documented our trip in the short documentary "Rollin' In Dakar" which is linked above on this page.

I am requesting your help to fund our return trip this year to continue the growth and development of BJJ in West Africa. Your contributions will go directly towards funding my travel and the team's lodging.

My name is Kelly Grissom and I am a BJJ black belt under Leo Dalla. I will once again lead several of my students from my school (www.StaffordBJJ.com), along with, hopefully, one or two other Leo Dalla black belts, back to Senegal to teach, train, and continue the growth of BJJ in this part of the world. Our dream is to create opportunities in West Africa, starting with Senegal, through the BJJ lifestyle. We envision a future of multiple schools, instructors, practitioners, and a competitive circuit that will connect West African athletes to the global BJJ movement. We are pursuing the goal in partnership with the non-profit organization "The Lion Heart Initiative".

In March this year (2015) we will return to Senegal to continue our efforts. Many of the folks we introduced to BJJ in 2013 have continued to train using YouTube and some other training videos. The Lion Heart Initiative (LHI) also coordinated some other training opportunities for the Senegalese athletes who have decided to pursue the BJJ lifestyle. You can read more about LHI's efforts here: http://www.lionheartmmafrica.com/projects.html.

During this trip we will conduct more introductory seminars and we will also conduct multiple private training sessions with the core folks who started with us in 2013 and who have continued to train regularly. My hope and intent is to be able to promote those deserving athletes to blue belt. We will also host a BJJ tournament at the National Dojo (which can be seen near the end of the Rollin' In Dakar movie) with the intent of giving our Senegalese friends the tools they will need to hold their own tournaments in the future.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Krissy Diggs and I LOVE tea. Probably more than anybody you know. For as long as I can remember I've loved tea.I was born to love tea!

Tea is the most popular drink in the world! Just about every nation has a tea that they're famous for. In places like England and Japan there are many cafes devoted to serving just tea. In America? Not so many. In KC? None! I believe that there exists a tea drink for everyone, even if they don't know it yet. 

I want to show Kansas City just how lovely tea can really be! Loose Leaf's ambition is to introduce new people to the diverse awesomeness of tea. Be it brewed straight with local honey or lovingly crafted as one of our unique tea lattes made with fresh Shatto cream or almond milk, I believe I can find your tea.  

We still plan on serving coffee, but at a much more scaled back level. We're planning on hosting maybe one local coffee blend daily. 

I love this city, and I want to share something that's really important to me with it. But I'm going to need help from the community to get things off the ground. I want to serve up fantastic tea with local ingredients and Kansas City charm. 


What We Need & What You Get

Approximately $18,000 will be all I need to get the ball rolling. This will help with the following things:

  • Rent. One of the most important costs outright will be obtaining a space. Can't run a tea house with no house, right? Someday I'd like to own my own space, but for the time being I'm focusing on finding an affordable location for rent.
  • Construction. I plan on using lots and lots of up-cycled and found material for decorating and construction of the space. Thankfully I have a lot of talented friends and family to help with construction costs, but materials will have to be funded.
  • Equipment. Mainly things like a hot water machine, frothing machine, mini fridge and other small equipment essentials.
  • Product. The initial round of tea and other goods served.
If you help us meet our goal here are some of the perks you can get:
  • A Private Tea Party. You and a group of friends get to have a private tea and baked goods tasting party. Think wine and cheese but tea and cookies! With live music, games and other types general awesome.
  • Free Tea For a Year. A free cup of tea or tea latte every day you choose for a whole entire year!
  • Latte In Your Honor. Have a tea drink named and crafted just for you!
And more! 

The Impact

There are so many subtle and complex components to tea that I feel are often overshadowed by the popularity of coffee. Every country has a unique kind of tea that they're famous for and I want to educate people about these complexities.

I believe in local pride. I want to strive to work with local businesses to source my business needs. Recycling is also important to me and my business will embody that. Where paper and plastic can be avoided, they will be. Glass, paper and plastic will all be recycled.  

I don't come from a lot of money, and I'm one of the few people in my family who actually graduated college. I want to make something fantastic of myself and I want to make an impact in the city that I love. I want to change people's minds about tea, and satiate the desire to have premium local tea in Kansas City for those who've been waiting.

 Even though my mom, the person most responsible for my passion for tea, didn't get to live to see me achieve my goal, I believe she's watching me. I want to make her proud. 


Risks & Challenges

Although tea is the most popular drink worldwide, Americans tend to lean more towards coffee. I believe, however, that leaning stems from the fact that there aren't very many opportunities to enjoy tea with the prevalence that coffee has. My goal is to put tea in a relatable spotlight and show people that tea can be just as, and sometimes even more exciting than coffee. 

I plan on getting the word out as far and as wide as possible. Making our presence known at local events and farmer's markets. I will make people fall in love with tea! 


Other Ways You Can Help

Can't help out financially? Understandable. But you could help out in a lot of other ways.  Please please pleas spread the word about our campaign. Just talk about idea! Share this page, share our webpage! Your recommendation is just as important as your contribution. 

Share us on your Facebook page, your twitter, your whatever! Every bit counts! 

Help me make my dream come true!

story:
#LettuceGrow! 3 Growing Seasons of Creating Teen Jobs and #Kale at our School Garden 

Founded in 2011, Muir Ranch provides direct hands-on job training for our low-income student population as farm hands, irrigation techs, florists, caterers and customer service managers. The ranch in Pasadena at John Muir High School is a living classroom and startup business laboratory that provides our community with direct access to healthy, organic produce through our farm and our network of California farmers from San Diego to Santa Barbara county. Our main social enterprise, our farm box CSA, is poised to grow to 200 subscribers in 2015. Every 10 clients provides one part-time student job. We need your help to fill our year-round, weekly fruit and vegetable box orders with our very own aquaponically grown leafy greens.  


Invest in Muir Ranch

We need your help to install and maintain a fully functioning, year-round aquaponics system. Why? 1. Because it's too hot in Pasadena to grow and harvest lettuce from March to November in the dirt . 2. Drought. Aquaponics systems only use 10% of the water used by traditional, in-ground dirt farming methods. 3. You get fish. Aquaponics systems are closed-loop and fish are used to feed the plants (yep, they go poo). 

We have great technical advisors, space on our 50 acre campus and a built-in customer base, our CSA clients (every restaurant in Pasadena, for starters). 

Muir Ranch is very, very special. It's a working business at a high poverty high school in Northwest Pasadena, a food desert as classified by the USDA. It's not just a business but a farm biz that sits at the insection of food, sustainability, class and education. Our kids learn by doing and while they are boxing CSA they development life-long job skills and kale habits. It's a win/win!

We are offering great perks:

CSA monthly and yearly boxes, pick ups and deliveries
T-shirts and hats
#flowersonyourhead professional 2' x 2' portraits.
complete wedding floral packages
Immortality: We'll name our aquaponic system after the person of your choice

story:
About Jungle Polish

Many mornings when I would awake, I’d find my six-year-old daughter’s nails and toes polished to a tee. They would literally look like she had gone to the nail salon. This didn’t happen once, but dozens of times. She really liked having her nails painted and did not wait for me to do them.

Despite how beautiful they looked, I always wondered if the nail polish was safe for her. Well, it wasn’t.

Now at eight, she wants to go to the salon to have her nails and toes done regularly. In August 2013, I made it my mission to create a safe, toxin-free nail polish line that could be enjoyed by girls all over the world.

Why did I take on this project?

I could not understand why my daughter was showing signs of puberty at such an early age. After doing some research, I found that scientists believe that many of the chemicals found in cosmetics, including nail polish, are contributing factors.

With Jungle Polish, there is no need to worry about these toxins and unpleasant odors. Jungle Polish is made from safe natural ingredients and non-toxic colorants.

Our pledge is to raise awareness about the hidden dangers of traditional nail polish. Girls that use Jungle Polish can have elegant nails while staying away from harmful toxins.

We’re giving $1 from each bottle of Jungle Polish sold to organizations that help children in need.

What We Need

Goal $25,000

The money raised will be used for:

Display setup

2500 units of Product (5 colors)
2500 bottles
2500 labels
2500 packaging units
Product give aways
Promotional products

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? No worries! Help us spread the word by sharing the link to our campaign on social media. Follow us on Instagram @junglepolish 

Please watch our short video at the top of the page.

story:
Our goal is to create a beloved community and this will require a qualitative change in our souls as well as a quantitative change in our lives. ~ Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.


My Story

I’m Charlene Murphy, a professional psychic medium in Long Beach, CA. My joy is helping people realize their inherent, creative brilliance by waking them up to their intuitive gifts. I also help people heal psychic wounds and blockages, so they can clearly receive the benevolence and abundance that the Universe is always providing.
 
 
In the four years of my private practice, run from the comfort of my living room, I have helped hundreds of people make tremendous shifts in their lives to become empowered manifestors of their own realities – living by design and not by default. 

Now, I’m feeling the call to expand my practice, include more people and offer a variety of affordable group classes for adults and children alike, live and online. The time has come for me to move my practice from my apartment into a commercial space. That's where your help comes in.


The Vision

Introducing Purple Buddha: A gathering place for people of all ages who wish to expand their consciousness in a nurturing, healing environment that is open to everyone! With your support, I plan to invite local healers and yogis to join me in offering classes, workshops and private sessions around the clock to audiences both global and local (glocal). 

These are a few of the topics we will explore:
  • Energy Healing 
  • Meditation Practice
  • Life Visioning & Masterminds
  • Psychic Development
  • Group Readings
  • Spirit Business Building
  • Book Study Groups

Your support will allow me to make an even greater impact on our community and our world. One of the biggest additions I’m called to offer are classes for kids. As a mother and former school teacher, I know how greatly our children benefit from understanding their own energy and the energy of others. Imagine if they knew how to ground and heal themselves! I can teach them that.

This will be accomplished by incorporating these classes:
  • Kids Yoga
  • Meditation for Kids
  • Psychic Development for Kids
  • Energy Healing for Kids
 

“If every child in the world would be taught meditation, we would eliminate violence from the world within one generation.” The Dalai Lama


Another addition will include live streaming capabilities, so that we can broadcast many of our classes online, reaching a global audience. I’m on a mission to provide healing and empowerment to people around the world.  Your contributions will help me do just that!


Minimum Funding Goal

My goal is to raise $13,300. It will be used for the following:
  • $7500: Secure commercial space in lovely Bixby Knolls for a few months as we build our community
  • $2500: Furniture and furnishings to provide an inspired, inviting sanctuary
  • $2000: Live streaming equipment to broadcast our live events and classes around the world
  • $1330: Signage and web design to update, inform and invite people to Purple Buddha
If this financial goal is exceeded, a retail shop will be added that offers products to enhance psychic and spiritual growth and development. 

This is the commercial building in Bixby Knolls (right off the 405) I have my sights set on:

   


Rewards

As a heart-felt demonstration of our gratitude, I am offering wonderful perks designed to include you as part of our Purple Buddha family! After all, Purple Buddha would not be possible without you.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute financially, you can still help! Share the love. Tell your friends about Purple Buddha. Like and share us on Facebook. Use the Indiegogo share tools. Help make some noise and make Purple Buddha a reality!


Risks & Challenges

I believe Long Beach is ready for Purple Buddha. However, it might take a minute to educate our community (local and global) about the many benefits that await them. Growth may be slow at first, but I’m certain it will grow as people warm up to practical psychic and spiritual expansion. 

If for some reason, I cannot acquire the Bixby Knolls office space above, I will acquire another, more appropriate site in the same area.  

The rewards of achieving a more centered, peaceful and awakened community outweigh any risks. Together we are making the world a healthier, self-empowered and sustainable place. 

Thank you for your love and support! I will see you soon at Purple Buddha! 


To learn more about me, Charlene Murphy and my current work, feel free to visit these sites:
  • Yelp
  • CharleneMurphy.com
  • PsychicLiving on Facebook
  • Charlene on YouTube
  • PsychicLiving Meetup
story_txt:
Our goal is to create a beloved community and this will require a qualitative change in our souls as well as a quantitative change in our lives. ~ Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.
My Story
I’m Charlene Murphy, a professional psychic medium in Long Beach, CA. My joy is helping people realize their inherent, creative brilliance by waking them up to their intuitive gifts. I also help people heal psychic wounds and blockages, so they can clearly receive the benevolence and abundance that the Universe is always providing.  


In the four years of my private practice, run from the comfort of my living room, I have helped hundreds of people make tremendous shifts in their lives to become empowered manifestors of their own realities – living by design and not by default. 

Now, I’m feeling the call to expand my practice, include more people and offer a variety of affordable group classes for adults and children alike, live and online. The time has come for me to move my practice from my apartment into a commercial space. That's where your help comes in.
The Vision

Introducing Purple Buddha: A gathering place for people of all ages who wish to expand their consciousness in a nurturing, healing environment that is open to everyone!

With your support, I plan to invite local healers and yogis to join me in offering classes, workshops and private sessions around the clock to audiences both global and local (glocal). 

These are a few of the topics we will explore:

Energy Healing 
Meditation Practice

Life Visioning & Masterminds

Psychic Development

Group Readings

Spirit Business Building
Book Study Groups


Your support will allow me to make an even greater impact on our community and our world.

One of the biggest additions I’m called to offer are classes for kids. As a mother and former school teacher, I know how greatly our children benefit from understanding their own energy and the energy of others. Imagine if they knew how to ground and heal themselves! I can teach them that.

This will be accomplished by incorporating these classes:

Kids Yoga
Meditation for Kids
Psychic Development for Kids
Energy Healing for Kids

 



“If every
child in the world would be taught meditation, we would eliminate violence from
the world within one generation.” The Dalai Lama

Another addition will include live streaming capabilities, so that we can broadcast many of our classes online, reaching a global audience. I’m on a mission to provide healing and empowerment to people around the world.  Your contributions will help me do just that!

Minimum Funding Goal
My goal is to raise $13,300. It will be used for the following:

$7500: Secure commercial space in lovely Bixby Knolls for a few months as we build our community
$2500: Furniture and furnishings to provide an inspired, inviting sanctuary
$2000: Live streaming equipment to broadcast our live events and classes around the world
$1330: Signage and web design to update, inform and invite people to Purple Buddha

If this financial goal is exceeded, a retail shop will be added that offers products to enhance psychic and spiritual growth and development. 

This is the commercial building in Bixby Knolls (right off the 405) I have my sights set on:


   




Rewards
As a heart-felt demonstration of our gratitude, I am offering wonderful perks designed to include you as part of our Purple Buddha family! After all, Purple Buddha would not be possible without you.

Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you can’t contribute financially, you can still help! Share the love. Tell your friends about Purple Buddha. Like and share us on Facebook. Use the Indiegogo share tools. Help make some noise and make Purple Buddha a reality!

Risks & Challenges
I believe Long Beach is ready for Purple Buddha. However, it might take a minute to educate our community (local and global) about the many benefits that await them. Growth may be slow at first, but I’m certain it will grow as people warm up to practical psychic and spiritual expansion. 

If for some reason, I cannot acquire the Bixby Knolls office space above, I will acquire another, more appropriate site in the same area.  

The rewards of achieving a more centered, peaceful and awakened community outweigh any risks.

Together we are making the world a healthier, self-empowered and sustainable place. 

Thank you for your love and support! I will see you soon at Purple Buddha! 



To learn more about me, Charlene Murphy and my current work, feel free to visit these sites:

Yelp
CharleneMurphy.com
PsychicLiving on Facebook
Charlene on YouTube
PsychicLiving Meetup

story:
Short Summary

My brother died at an early age (56) from cancer.  One of the greatest things he did was mentor young troubled kids, often with drug problems, and help them turn around their lives.  In honor of his life and deeds, we have started Chicago Charity Raffles to raise funds for small organizations that counsel/treat kids with drug addictions. We want to keep it on a grass roots level, just as my brother did.  Not the "big guys", just the "little guys"!  By the way, that's a picture of Pepper - our Lab/German Short Hair and new mascot! 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $15,000 to start operations and run our first raffle.  We have been a registered 501(C)3 charity for 5 years -- why is that important?  A charity must be registered for 5 years before they are allowed to run a raffle without a larger partner!  Now, in our 6th year, we are ready to begin running raffles!  100% of net proceeds will be donated to grass roots operations helping kids with drug addictions.  Funds raised in this campaign would be used to complete website development (Est~$5,000), first raffle marketing expenses (Est~$10,000), and office setup/rent/legal expenses (Est~$5,000).  Raffles will have a grand prize of $250,000 with 10 additional winners of $15,000.
  • IF we do not reach our goal, funds raised will be donated to A Man in Recovery Foundation. 
  • You can participate in the raffles and maybe win prizes, but more importantly, you can help us help the "little guys" who tend to get overlooked.

The Impact

One "big name" potential partner we spoke with suggested we would be a failure if we didn't sell all our tickets in the first raffle -- we responded that funds/prizes would be prorated based on tickets sold, so any incremental monies used to help a drug addicted child would be worth the effort.  They didn't get it, they were just worried about their image.... These people were from a large drug counseling program -- they were too big to appreciate small donations.  We want to donate to a series of small organizations who would appreciate any donation whatsoever.  Our target is to apply funds to where the "rubber meets the road" in small grass roots operations that really need any support they can get!
Please help us reach out and affect the lives of many in need.  Let's help the high school kid who is starting to get addicted to drugs, and go down the wrong path.  We are ready to go all in, if you are.  Tell all your friends and ask them to donate, no matter how small, it still counts!

Risks & Challenges

As with any venture, there are risks!  We have an executive team of seasoned business people who have launched and completed many projects with great results.  With raffles, it's all about the marketing - reach and frequency.  We plan to sell 25,000 tickets in our first raffle....but what if we only sell 5,000 tickets? We would still raise $250,000 - half of which would go toward prizes, and the other half to charity -- we STILL have funds to disburse to various charities -- funds they didn't have before we donated! Then we learn and make improvements for the next raffle,  Our team has been researching the logistics, legal issues and marketing obstacles for over 5 years.  So now we are in year 6 and we've had plenty of time to plan -- now it's time to execute and run successful raffles to raise funds for charity.  Let's help these kids before they get too far down the road to destruction and in many cases death.  Somebody stepped in and helped my kid and probably saved his life - now let's pay that forward and help other kids too.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Nick George; husband, father, poet, student, photographer, believer, dreamer. Coming to Lynchburg for college for psychology and professional counseling, I always thought that I would leave as soon as I got my degree, but I saw an opportunity to add to this community in a very real way. I've been playing with the idea of doing The Listening for a few years now. And I've done a lot so far, but now is the time to do so much more. I can NOT do it alone.


The Listening exists to create a safe environment that inspires young, passionate artists and creatives through a diverse array of performing arts (dance, music, creative writing, drama) to positively impact the local community towards unity in creative diversity. The Listening challenges artists, as well as the community, to network with different artists and individuals while unlocking the therapeutic and cathartic possibilities of diverse creativity. The vision of The Listening is to expose the youth to the world of performing arts and art appreciation, challenge the culture of apathy and illiteracy, discover a fresh sense of self-worth, and impact the world around them.


My motivation is simply this: Lynchburg is a unique place, with a growing music and creative scene. The downtown area is experiencing a renaissance of sorts, while each of the universities within the city (Randolph College, Liberty University, Lynchburg College, Virginia University of Lynchburg) has been growing in their respective rights. My vantage point presents the city as growing, but fundamentally incongruent when it comes to diversity and the arts. I think there is a capacity for Lynchburg to not only grow in unity, but also grow in diversity and classic/modern artistic expression, now, but for generations to come.

I need your help.


What We Need & What You Get

If my pockets were deep enough, a lot would have been done by now. Before it can be accomplished, The Listening needs to be recognized as an actual entity and become incorporated. To become incorporated, there's a fee. To file for 501 (c)(3) tax-exempt status, there's a fee. To hold quarterly events, featuring local and national talents, there's a fee.


With $2,000, The Listening an established non-profit organization dedicated to inspiring and engaging the community in diverse arts appreciation and mentoring services, while presenting itself as a place to be who you are.

Any funds donated will go directly to:

  • Marketing and Promoting Quarterly "The Listening" events
  • Filing for Non-Profit/Applying for 501 (c)(3) status
  • Booking renowned independant artists


The Impact

Some of you may remember early "The Listening" events, from 2013 and 2014.
  • The First Listening, March 2013
  • The Listening: Confessions - August 2013
  • The Listening: Classic - October 2013
  • The Listening: Voices of The Strivers' Row (feat. Joshua Bennett, Alysia Harris, and Miles Hodges) - November 2013
  • The Listening: Legacy - November 2014
  • The Listening: Renaissance - February/March 2015
Imagine what can be done with your support?
"The Listening lives and breathes through our local community like something I've never seen and I'm so glad that I'm able to be a small part in making it happen." - Anna Woosley, Artist, Student, Intern at TOOLRY

"It's not terribly surprising to see the arts continue to disappear from public schools. Even with great teachers, what's the point? None of your friends care about them, and if they do, you're probably a "nerd", "gay", or the simultaneously ubiquitous and meaningless term, "hipster". Right now, The Listening is an open mic. In a year, The Listening can be the point, both the end and the means for local students to discover and fall in love with performance art; it is a route to make sure everyone has a chance to explain themselves, to be heard. That's the promise The Listening delivers in it's very name: no matter what you have to tell me, I will listen." - Adam Snavely, Poet, Certified Teacher, English Student at Liberty University

"The experience of The Listening is an inspiration to Lynchburg's creative community. It reaches the hearts and minds of all demographics, sharing a platform to explore true freedom of expression. You will be moved, touched, inspired and transformed by The Listening." - Cameo Hoyle, Poet, Executive Director at James River Council for the Arts and Humanities

"In a time when artists are constantly criticized and competing against one another, it is encouraging to know that there is a community in existence whose sole purpose is to LISTEN." - Gabe Hernandez, Poet, Musician, Owner at Gabe Hernandez Photos, Marketing Strategist at Lynchburg Photoworks


Risks & Challenges

Our culture tells us, almost on a daily basis, that we should prefer style to substance. Honestly, I wanted to leave the burden to someone, anyone else. I figured that there has to be someone more qualified with more resources than I have. Maybe someone with more time than I have; with a new baby girl and a full-time job, time is not a commodity to be taken lightly.


Let us not forget the risk as a donor. You are taking a chance on me, someone you may have only met a limited amount of times. The Listening could end up being nothing more than a glorified open mic session.


I decided to make a move, in spite of all that can go wrong. I believe it can work. 

It can help change the world, starting with you.


Other Ways You Can Help

This has been a lot of talk about needing money, a very awkward conversation. But it's not all about the money. The Listening hasn't made it this far without people, and it will not survive without people. Here are some other ways that you support this vision!

  • Help me connect and network! There's a big world out there, full of other non-profits, mentoring resources, art-based communities, and I'm only one person. Together, we can make Lynchburg THAT much more awesome.
  • The very seed of "The Listening" itself is community. Imagine "The Listening" to be recognized as a standard of excellence for the performing arts. Are you an artist? Do you dance? Sing? Play a mean G chord? Write with the fire of a Phoenix? Then come share your passion and talent at one of The Listening events.

So. Are you Listening?

story:
Thanks for checking out our Indiegogo campaign site. It was a great success. The campaign is closed, but all the information here is still valid. If you want to book a trip or have questions, go to http://amazingabruzzotours.com or contact us at amazingabruzzotours@gmail.com.

Amazing Abruzzo Tours

I'm Jake Rupert. My wife Lisa Blais and I are opening a tourism business in Italy called Amazing Abruzzo Tours in May 2016. We're running this Indiegogo campaign to kick-start our business.

We'd love for you to be part of our adventure, so we're offering the great deals on trips to Italy you see on the right.

We're Canadians from Ottawa, Ontario, in our 40s who've grown tired of the rat race. We bought a historic villa in Italy, and we're ditching our careers to give people authentic Italian experiences in the breathtaking Abruzzo region, 90 minutes east of Rome. Get one of our packages, and you'll see exactly what we mean!

Lisa's grandfather came to Canada from Abruzzo. It's an incredibly beautiful yet largely undiscovered place filled with interesting things to do and see. There are great wineries and food, mountains, beaches, quaint villages, festivals, hiking, biking, Roman ruins, castles and fabulous people who love having a good time.

We adore Abruzzo, and we are going to showcase it to the world through boutique, all-inclusive  packages and do-it-yourself tours of the area. Details of these products are below and pictures of the area are in the gallery. With us, you will get an authentic Italian experience.

We're a family and LGBT friendly company. All are welcome at Amazing Abruzzo Tours.

If you have any questions about this campaign, our company or our products, email us at amazingabruzzotours@gmail.com and we'll quickly get back to you.

Project Progress

We've purchased and paid for a five-bedroom, six-bathroom Villa for our company's home base. Villa d'Abruzzo's interior renovations are mostly done - new kitchen, heating, cooling, plumbing, electrical, etc. The place is fantastic. It oozes Italy.

We didn't take proper marketing shots of the Villa the last time we were there, but if you check out the pictures in the gallery, you'll get a great sense of the place.

Our business plan, market research, competitive analysis, operating plan and start-up plan are complete. Our marketing plan is done and will launch in the coming months. Our website is under construction, and all other final tasks are under way.

What We Need

Exterior works including a large terrace, a pool and landscape work are proceeding this summer. We also have start-up and fit-up costs. Through a combination of our savings and some debt, we have these works covered, but we'd love to launch our business with no debt, so we're looking to raise $150,000.

We're confident that we will reach our goal. But, if we don't, all funds from this campaign will still  go to the project. We will then supplement the balance with traditional funding, which we have secured, but not accessed.

What you get by contributing

Contributions will get you updates through various platforms. There's also neat Amazing Abruzzo swag like cheeseboards and key chains and framed pictures of the area.

The best perks are coupons and packages that will see you come to Italy, stay at Villa d'Abruzzo and enjoy food, wine, sights and much fun to be had with Amazing Abruzzo Tours.

If this is your first time to Italy, combine a seven-day package at Villa d'Abruzzo with a tour of Venice, Rome and Florence. A stay with us after a few days in these larger centres is a perfect introduction to "la dolce vita"!

If you are returning to Italy, a week with Amazing Abruzzo Tours will show you an authentic side of the country tourists rarely get to experience.

We can accommodate up to eight people based on double occupancy for tours, and, as you can see further down on the right, our travel discounts are progressive, so the more people you book, the cheaper it is per person.

We can also customize tour options and bookings. If you want to focus on wine and food, we will build you a package. If you want to book for 10 days or rent the whole villa for a month for a family gathering, we can do that too. If you don't see what you need in the perk list, contact us and we'll work something out together.

The Impact

A contribution to the success of this campaign will have several impacts.

We have secured financing to complete our project, but a successful Indiegogo campaign will mean no borrowing. It will also allow us to relocate from Canada to Italy quickly to take care of the final details.

For the town of Torre de'Passeri where Villa d'Abruzzo is located, it will mean economic development because we will be using all local supplies and services including contractors, construction products and labour, wineries, and foods.

For Abruzzo, it means exposure. Italians love vacationing there, but even though it's only slightly off the beaten track, it remains largely undiscovered by foreign tourists.

Challenges

Starting a company in a new country and speaking your third language hasn't been easy, but Lisa and I are up to the challenge. I'm studying Italian, business planning and operations management. Lisa is taking an online marketing course.

We've assembled a great team in Italy and Canada, including a project manager, legal and business agents, a great architect, a dedicated contractor, several trusted advisers, and marketing experts. We're also getting good support from local officials in Torre de'Passeri.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are ways you can help this campaign besides financially.

You can spread the word in your network, like us on Facebook, or best of all forward a link to this campaign to people you think might be interested. Anything you can do to help us reach a bigger audience, including using the Indiegogo share tools, would be much appreciated.

Media

We are getting some love from media in Canada.

This clip is from the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation's Ottawa Morning Show - the number one radio broadcast in the city. Nice.

This story was published in the Ottawa edition of Metro News, a great commuter paper. Ottawa Couple Launches Italian Tour Company.

Products and Samples

All-inclusive package sample

Below is a sample seven-day package. If you book more than four people for a week, you get to customize your trip.

Day 1 – Get there and get settled. Pick up at Pescara or Rome airport, transfer to Villa d'Abruzzo in an air-conditioned passenger van. Welcome drinks and check in. Explore the town, lounge by the pool or take advantage of Villa d’Abruzzo's amenities. Dinner followed by a review and confirmation of your trip plan.

Day 2 – Vistas and Villages. Breakfast followed by a visit to Rocca Calascio, a 10th Century fortress high in the Apennine Mountains. Picnic lunch overlooking the panoramic Tirino Valley followed by a visit to the medieval village of Castel del Monte, voted one of the most beautiful villages in Italy. Back home for a swim. Dinner.

Day 3 – Coast and Castle. Breakfast followed by a trip to the Trabocci Coast to see the  fishing platforms only found in Abruzzo, wander the marine nature reserve at Punta Aderci where we will have a picnic lunch.

After lunch, we will visit Roccascalegna and its castle perched impossibly on a narrow rocky outcrop overlooking the Sangro Valley. Back home for a little rest before a special dinner where you will learn how to make your own pizza in our outdoor wood oven.

Day 4 – Pro Local. Today we stay close to home and indulge in the area's wines, food and culture.

After breakfast, we will head to the Abbey of San Clemente da Casauria where we will learn of the area’s rich history dating back to pre-historic times. For lunch, we will visit a local restaurant and enjoy some traditional Abruzzese cooking. In the afternoon, we will visit two local wineries for guided tours and a tasting of their award winning Montepulciano d’Abruzzo reds, Trebbiano whites and other wines. Following this, enjoy some down time at the Villa and dinner.

Day 5 – Romans and Marsicans. After breakfast today, we head inland to the Roman ruins at Alba Fucens where we will find the remains of a Roman town, a 12th century church built on the foundation of the pagan Temple of Apollo, and a medieval borgo.

After a picnic lunch, we will head to Celano and visit its stunning castle where we will take in the views of the Fucino Valley, examine some well-preserved artifacts and medieval art that rivals collections in Florence or Rome and learn of the proud history of the Marsican people in the museum housed in the castle.

Day 6 – Market and Medieval Times. Following breakfast, we will take a short drive to Sulmona, famous for its candied almonds (confetti) and visit the sites including the local public Market held in the central square of this medieval town where the poet Ovid was born. Lunch will be in a local restaurant and after we will travel up the breathtaking Sagittario Gorge, a World Wildlife Fund reserve, to the village of Scanno, which was voted one of the most beautiful villages in Italy. Following this, it’s back to the Villa for relaxation and our good-bye dinner.

Day 7 – Breakfast followed by transportation to the airport in Rome or Pescara for the flight home.

Details - All transportation, meals at Villa d'Abruzzo or on day trips, local wine, beer, liqueurs and entry fees are included. Airfare, special drinks and special trips to local restaurants are not included.

Day Trip Options
Other options you may wish to explore: days at the beach, cooking classes, spa treatments, day trip to Rome, day trip to Tivoli gardens, mountain hikes, trips to hermitages and churches, war cemeteries, local festivals when possible, river hikes with swimming, caves, shopping in Pescara and more. Just let us know what you like.
DIY and Self-Guided Tours
We offer do-it-yourself tours and variable length room rentals (breakfast included) with guests preparing their own meals in the guest kitchen or dining out at local restaurants.
You tell us the kind of things you'd like to do and see, and we'll provide self-guided tour materials (maps, descriptions, itineraries,) and planning advice for area day trips.
An important aspect of this product is that we will also offer roadside support if needed. If you need advice on something during the day, you can call us.
Self-Guided Tours are the same as DIY Tours, but dinner and local beverages are included.
Cycling

With its low traffic roads and idyllic scenery, Abruzzo is perfect for cycling, and it frequently hosts part of the Giro d’Italia, most recently in 2013 when Stage 7 of this world-class event took place in Abruzzo.  The cycling packages include shuttle service to and from the airport and breakfast and dinner, local drinks, and the amenities of Villa d’Abruzzo.  We'll support cyclists by providing maps of loop trips, a GPS, picnic lunches which the cyclist do not need to carry, and road side assistance.

Room and Villa Rentals

You can also opt for simple room and villa rentals for a single room or for up to 16 people. The villa configuration offers the ability for privacy for varying group sizes. Just let us know your needs, and we can customize an arrangement.

Sample Menus

The menus can be customized if you book packages for more than four.

Breakfast - Italian Style or English Style - made to order. Coffee, juice, pastries, cereals, fruit, eggs, fried meats, toast.

Lunches - These will vary depending on the day trip. There will be picnic lunches of fresh bread, cured meats, local cheeses, olives, marinated vegetables, and beverages. You will visit local restaurants, and we may even stop at an Abruzzese porchetta truck for a tasty roast pork pannino.

Dinners - All Dinners will be at least four courses and include local wine and after dinner liqueurs and coffee.

Appetizers - Cheese and meat plates, melon and prosciutto, bruschetta, fresh mussels, antipasto

Primo - Fresh pasta with seasonal sauces, linguine with clams, pasta primavera, penne arrabiata, seafood pasta, risotto abruzzese with saffron, pasta with beans, and  the list goes on.

Main and sides - All meats and fish will be sourced locally. Arrosticini (a traditional Abruzzese lamb skewer), barbecued chicken, pork chops, lamb, and steaks, grilled vegetables and tofu, traditional lentil, lamb, and chicken stews and seasonal seafood dishes. These will be served with choices of potatoes and fresh vegetables.

Dessert - All desserts will be made at the villa or sourced from local pastry shops. Tiramisu, cannoli, tartufo, fresh fruits, ricotta pie, wine poached pears, gelato and panna cotta.
story_txt:
Thanks for checking out our Indiegogo campaign site. It was a great success. The campaign is closed, but all the information here is still valid. If you want to book a trip or have questions, go to http://amazingabruzzotours.com or contact us at amazingabruzzotours@gmail.com.Amazing Abruzzo ToursI'm Jake Rupert. My wife Lisa Blais and I are opening a tourism business in Italy called Amazing Abruzzo Tours in May 2016. We're running this Indiegogo campaign to kick-start our business.We'd love for you to be part of our adventure, so we're offering the great deals on trips to Italy you see on the right.We're Canadians from Ottawa, Ontario, in our 40s who've grown tired of the rat race. We bought a historic villa in Italy, and we're ditching our careers to give people authentic Italian experiences in the breathtaking Abruzzo region, 90 minutes east of Rome. Get one of our packages, and you'll see exactly what we mean!Lisa's grandfather came to Canada from Abruzzo. It's an incredibly beautiful yet largely undiscovered place filled with interesting things to do and see. There are great wineries and food, mountains, beaches, quaint villages, festivals, hiking, biking, Roman ruins, castles and fabulous people who love having a good time.
We adore Abruzzo, and we are going to showcase it to the world through boutique, all-inclusive  packages and do-it-yourself tours of the area. Details of these products are below and pictures of the area are in the gallery. With us, you will get an authentic Italian experience.We're a family and LGBT friendly company. All are welcome at Amazing Abruzzo Tours.If you have any questions about this campaign, our company or our products, email us at amazingabruzzotours@gmail.com and we'll quickly get back to you.Project ProgressWe've purchased and paid for a five-bedroom, six-bathroom Villa for our company's home base. Villa d'Abruzzo's interior renovations are mostly done - new kitchen, heating, cooling, plumbing, electrical, etc. The place is fantastic. It oozes Italy.

We didn't take proper marketing shots of the Villa the last time we were there, but if you check out the pictures in the gallery, you'll get a great sense of the place.



Our business plan, market research, competitive analysis, operating plan and start-up plan are complete. Our marketing plan is done and will launch in the coming months. Our website is under construction, and all other final tasks are under way.
What We Need
Exterior works including a large terrace, a pool and landscape work are proceeding this summer. We also have start-up and fit-up costs. Through a combination of our savings and some debt, we have these works covered, but we'd love to launch our business with no debt, so we're looking to raise $150,000.


We're confident that we will reach our goal. But, if we don't, all funds from this campaign will still  go to the project. We will then supplement the balance with traditional funding, which we have secured, but not accessed.
What you get by contributing
Contributions will get you updates through various platforms. There's also neat Amazing Abruzzo swag like cheeseboards and key chains and framed pictures of the area.
The best perks are coupons and packages that will see you come to Italy, stay at Villa d'Abruzzo and enjoy food, wine, sights and much fun to be had with Amazing Abruzzo Tours.



If this is your first time to Italy, combine a seven-day package at Villa d'Abruzzo with a tour of Venice, Rome and Florence. A stay with us after a few days in these larger centres is a perfect introduction to "la dolce vita"!
If you are returning to Italy, a week with Amazing Abruzzo Tours will show you an authentic side of the country tourists rarely get to experience.
We can accommodate up to eight people based on double occupancy for tours, and, as you can see further down on the right, our travel discounts are progressive, so the more people you book, the cheaper it is per person.
We can also customize tour options and bookings. If you want to focus on wine and food, we will build you a package. If you want to book for 10 days or rent the whole villa for a month for a family gathering, we can do that too. If you don't see what you need in the perk list, contact us and we'll work something out together.

The Impact
A contribution to the success of this campaign will have several impacts.
We have secured financing to complete our project, but a successful Indiegogo campaign will mean no borrowing. It will also allow us to relocate from Canada to Italy quickly to take care of the final details.
For the town of Torre de'Passeri where Villa d'Abruzzo is located, it will mean economic development because we will be using all local supplies and services including contractors, construction products and labour, wineries, and foods.
For Abruzzo, it means exposure. Italians love vacationing there, but even though it's only slightly off the beaten track, it remains largely undiscovered by foreign tourists.
Challenges
Starting a company in a new country and speaking your third language hasn't been easy, but Lisa and I are up to the challenge. I'm studying Italian, business planning and operations management. Lisa is taking an online marketing course.
We've assembled a great team in Italy and Canada, including a project manager, legal and business agents, a great architect, a dedicated contractor, several trusted advisers, and marketing experts. We're also getting good support from local officials in Torre de'Passeri.


Other Ways You Can Help
There are ways you can help this campaign besides financially.
You can spread the word in your network, like us on Facebook, or best of all forward a link to this campaign to people you think might be interested. Anything you can do to help us reach a bigger audience, including using the Indiegogo share tools, would be much appreciated.
Media
We are getting some love from media in Canada.
This clip is from the Canadian Broadcasting Corporation's Ottawa Morning Show - the number one radio broadcast in the city. Nice.
This story was published in the Ottawa edition of Metro News, a great commuter paper. Ottawa Couple Launches Italian Tour Company.
Products and Samples
All-inclusive package sample
Below is a sample seven-day package. If you book more than four people for a week, you get to customize your trip.

Day 1 – Get there and get settled. Pick up at
Pescara or Rome airport, transfer to Villa d'Abruzzo in an air-conditioned
passenger van. Welcome drinks and check in. Explore the town,
lounge by the pool or take advantage of Villa d’Abruzzo's amenities. Dinner followed
by a review and confirmation of your trip plan.
Day 2 – Vistas and Villages. Breakfast
followed by a visit to Rocca Calascio, a 10th Century fortress high in the
Apennine Mountains. Picnic lunch overlooking the panoramic Tirino Valley
followed by a visit to the medieval village of Castel del Monte, voted one of the
most beautiful villages in Italy. Back home for a swim. Dinner.


Day 3 – Coast and Castle. Breakfast followed
by a trip to the Trabocci Coast to see the 
fishing platforms only found in Abruzzo, wander the marine nature
reserve at Punta Aderci where we will have a picnic lunch.


After lunch, we will
visit Roccascalegna and its castle perched impossibly on a narrow rocky outcrop
overlooking the Sangro Valley. Back home for a little rest before a special
dinner where you will learn how to make your own pizza in our outdoor wood
oven.
Day 4 – Pro Local. Today we stay close to home
and indulge in the area's wines, food and culture.


After breakfast, we will head
to the Abbey of San Clemente da Casauria where we will learn of the area’s rich
history dating back to pre-historic times. For lunch, we will visit a local
restaurant and enjoy some traditional Abruzzese cooking. In the afternoon, we
will visit two local wineries for guided tours and a
tasting of their award winning Montepulciano d’Abruzzo reds, Trebbiano whites
and other wines. Following this, enjoy some down time at the Villa and
dinner.
Day 5 – Romans and Marsicans. After breakfast
today, we head inland to the Roman ruins at Alba Fucens where we will find the
remains of a Roman town, a 12th century church built on the foundation of the
pagan Temple of Apollo, and a medieval borgo.



After a picnic lunch, we will
head to Celano and visit its stunning castle where we will take in the views of
the Fucino Valley, examine some well-preserved artifacts and medieval art that
rivals collections in Florence or Rome and learn of the proud history of the
Marsican people in the museum housed in the castle.
Day 6 – Market and Medieval Times. Following breakfast, we will take a short drive to Sulmona, famous for its candied almonds (confetti) and visit the sites including the local public Market held in the central square of this medieval town where the poet Ovid was born. Lunch will be in a local restaurant and after we will travel up the breathtaking Sagittario Gorge, a World Wildlife Fund reserve, to the village of Scanno, which was voted one of the most beautiful villages in Italy. Following this, it’s back to the Villa for relaxation and our good-bye dinner.



Day 7 – Breakfast followed by transportation
to the airport in Rome or Pescara for the flight home.

Just let us know what you like.

in the guest kitchen or dining out at local restaurants.
You tell us the kind of things you'd like to do and see, and we'll provide self-guided tour materials (maps,
descriptions, itineraries,) and planning advice for area day trips.
An
important aspect of this product is that we will also offer roadside support
if needed. If you need advice on something during the day, you can call us.
Self-Guided Tours are the same as DIY Tours, but dinner and local beverages are included.
Cycling

With its low traffic roads and idyllic

Giro d’Italia, most recently in 2013 when Stage 7 of this world-class event took
place in Abruzzo.  The cycling packages
include shuttle service to and from the airport and breakfast and dinner, local

maps of loop trips, a GPS, picnic lunches which the cyclist do not need to
carry, and road side assistance.

You can also opt for simple room and villa rentals for a single room or for up to 16 people. The villa configuration offers the ability for privacy for varying group sizes. Just let us know your needs, and we can customize an arrangement.

Primo - Fresh pasta with seasonal sauces, linguine with clams, pasta primavera, penne arrabiata, seafood pasta, risotto abruzzese with saffron, pasta with beans, and  the list goes on.

Arrosticini (a traditional Abruzzese lamb skewer), barbecued chicken, pork chops, lamb, and steaks, grilled vegetables and tofu, traditional lentil, lamb, and chicken stews and seasonal seafood dishes. These will be served with choices of potatoes and fresh vegetables.

Dessert - All desserts will be made at the villa or sourced from local pastry shops. Tiramisu, cannoli, tartufo, fresh fruits, ricotta pie, wine poached pears, gelato and panna cotta.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Katherine Duncan.  I have waited and watched many developers attempt to revitalize the Moulin Rouge-The first interracial hotel & casino built in America during a time when it was illegal for blacks and whites to mingle publicly. It was built across the railroad tracks from the booming downtown Las Vegas.

Although the property has suffered through myriad hate crimes, political warfare and failed private developments, it now sits in the heart of Las Vegas on the most valuable piece of land in the world, overlooking the City of Las Vegas.

It is important for all people, regardless of ethnicity, to take ownership of the Moulin Rouge.  Contributions will help to create a Hall of Fame Museum, an international boxers museum & civil rights museum utilizing the rich native talent and providing jobs training for the hardest to employ.


What We Need & What You Get

We have entered into a contract to purchase the property on behalf of the community. We need $100,000 to produce a business plan, to pay legal fees and complete architectural renderings. 

Depending on your level of contribution, you will receive a 55th Anniversary commemorative Moulin Rouge casino chip, your membership into the future planned Moulin Rouge Museum, complimentary VIP admission to the Moulin Rouge Affair and your name engraved in the Moulin Rouge Hall of Fame.


The Impact

You will be acknowledged  as a founding member of the Moulin Rouge Museum and you will be recognized for generations to come by visitors from around the world.  The Moulin Rouge  will become a showplace,  setting the standards for racial justice in America and serving as a flagship for reconciliation and healing.

Risks & Challenges

If we do not raise $100,000 by February 5, 2015, our community could lose the one last opportunity  to gain control of the property for the benefit of the people and keep it out of the hands of private developers who may not be sensitive to needs of the people in the community.  If  1,000 people would contribute $100 each we could easily reach our goal.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about the Moulin Rouge.
  • Use  the Indiegogo share tools!

.

story:
Eyewear Proudly Handmade in the USA ! 

I want to bring an eyeglass manufacturing factory to Philadelphia accompanied by the knowledge and expertise of traditional French craftsmanship. I believe in selling design, quality, service and value over price. I see an opportunity to help others feel proud of what can be made here in the USA. I am convinced that the American Dream is still possible for everyone.  Timing and opportunity are perfectly aligned to rescue the knowledge of hand-made crafting from being lost. I insist on ensuring the control of quality and cost within an industry, which has inflated with style over substance; both of which I can offer without sacrifice. I want others to see what we have to gain by dreaming big here in Philly, but before I tell you about my dream, I want to tell you my story. 

My name is Valerie Vittu. I came to the USA in 1994 from France and became an American citizen in 2003. When I first got my start in the optical industry, I was fortunate enough to work with famed designer, Alain Mikli, whose concept was creating eyewear as both a precise medical device and a fashion accessory. My artistic background in design, eye for quality products, and years of experience in various high-end industries helped me to become an innovator in the fine eyewear field. 

In 2005, I created my first optical retail business named after my two daughters, Margot & Camille. Since then, I have continued to build my reputation and clientele throughout the City of Philadelphia. My business is dependent upon customers that are open-minded and ready to embrace the confidence, joy, and character that wearing a pair of glasses can bring to their everyday lives. Finding the right frames can truly be a transformative experience.

I mark my tenth year as a business owner with many milestones: 

  • My own brand of eyewear and sunglasses (Margot & Camille)
  • A flourishing partnership with a French eyewear manufacturer
  • The opening of a second location in Doylestown, PA
  • New business partners
Our team and ambitions are expanding and we are ready to embrace the changes not just for my business, but for the community that has supported me for an entire decade. 

Making Our Own Waves


The wholesale price of imported lesser-quality eyewear has increased by 1000%, leaving the quality of the product far behind over the last decade. 

What Mass-Manufacturing has led to:

  • Designers and countries being poorly represented 
  • High costs for both small business owners and the customer
  • The loss of consistency in the Eyewear Industry 

Without the immediate establishment of control of manufacturing in the west, costs will continue to rise regardless of quality in the decades to come. Be the power that brings quality and market control to our own backyard. Become the driving force behind influencing the industry in contrast to being at it's mercy.

What's at risk:

  • Knowledge and appreciation of hand-sculpted eyewear
  • Support for manufacturing in Europe 
  • Accessibility to fine eyewear for everyday Americans
  • Our sense of ownership and pride in our own creations
  • The desire to create something worth making in the USA

It is urgent that we transfer the eyewear manufacturing process from France to the USA in order to rebuild our country, in addition to giving future generations pride in what they can produce.  

Every small business owner wants to succeed and grow, but my company has all of the tools: the knowledge and partnerships necessary to bring change to the American manufacturing landscape. We have the plans for opening and running the factory, the machinery is ready to be packed and shipped from France, including plenty of raw materials, for our trainees to learn with and perfect their craftsmanship. We are working closely with the City of Philadelphia and the Chamber of Commerce and their partners at the PIDC to ensure that our business expansion will help as many people as possible. 


Impact

  • New career opportunities 
  • Better cost control within the industry
  • Raise quality and accessibility of eyewear products
  • Strengthen communities within Philadelphia
  • Displays the financial and intrinsic value of creating something in their own neighborhood
The factory will be located close to public transportation centers so that we can provide free transportation for our employees. 

Why Donate?


  • Cover initial costs of training an entire workforce
  • Set up the factory and its machinery
  • Cover pre-production salaries 
  • Donations and Grants will allow us to be immediately competitive 

Training will involve one year of intensive quality control of crafting the material used to create the most comfortable, practical and beautiful eyewear. Luckily, we have the commitment from master "lunetiers" (eyewear craftsmen) to come to Philadelphia for the entirety of the training process to ensure that our production is indisputably world class. 



Long Road Ahead


 
We want to offer a chance to learn the skills that have brought me success, fulfillment, and happiness. I want to see this factory give people the possibility of a brilliant future, but the hard work has only just begun. We need the community's support if we are going to find the funding that is necessary to open the factory's doors.


Our Perks! and Other Ways You Can Help



  • Come see us in person! We want to hear from our community. Margot & Camille Optique has two locations now, one in Old City, Philadelphia and the newest store is located in Doylestown, PA 
  • Visit our Website at www.360squareyes.com to stay up to date with news on our ongoing projects, fundraising efforts, newest eyewear designs and events we have going on 
  • Share our crowdfunding video with your friends and family and check back on our  Facebook page for new media and fun!
  • Follow us on Twitter for updates about upcoming events and our progress!

Share our crowdfunding video with your friends and family and check back on our  Facebook page for new media and fun!
Follow us on Twitter for updates about upcoming events and our progress!

story:
Help us launch a made in America, art-driven, environmentally conscious, textile business that will help thousands of domestic violence survivors and families who are facing hunger.

Mountain Bird Designs, founded in 2014, is a for-purpose, small textile business located in Western North Carolina. Our tag line "Designs That Make a Difference" is centered on our commitment to use our creativity for positive change. Our company is built on the foundation of sustainability and empowerment. Ten percent of every purchase is donated to two organizations with solid track records in supporting domestic violence survivors and families facing hunger in the United States. 

GreenHouse17 is a domestic violence shelter located in Kentucky that has received many awards for their innovative and sustainable approach to nurturing domestic violence survivors and their children. 

Feeding America is a nationwide network of food banks providing food to more than 46 million people through 60,000 food pantries and meal programs.

  

Our mission to contribute to positive change is built into every step of our production process, beginning with the art work that we feature. Supporting the art community is central to our mission. We work with talented artists who share our mission and want to contribute to positive change through their art.

Mountain Bird Designs' manufacturers and distributors have been carefully selected to minimize our carbon footprint while supporting fair paying jobs in Appalachia. 

  • Our beautiful fabrics are woven with fibers made from recycled water bottles at a local North Carolina textile mill. 
  • The artwork is printed locally in North Carolina on recycled fabric using water-based ink with a process that generates minimal waste with no toxic by-products. 
  • Our products are then cut and sewn by a member-owned, fair pay cooperative in Morganton, NC. 
  • We ship from a local North Carolina fulfillment center that trains and employs people who are developmentally or physically disabled, facing employment barriers.

We have been working hard over the past 2 years, using money from our retirement savings, to build the foundation for Mountain Bird Designs. We have done the research, learned how to navigate the textile industry, and connected with partners and vendors who share our mission. Our products have been designed, samples have been made and tested, and all the pieces needed for full production are set in place and ready to go. Now all we need is you to set the wheels of change in motion. Our mission to create positive change in a tangible and substantive way can only happen with your help.

  

To enter production mode, we need to raise $25,000 in capital. Here is how the funds will be used:

Here is what you will receive for your contribution to positive change:

Original artwork created by one of our featured artists (without mat or frame.) Only available during this campaign. Contributions will be shared between supporting domestic violence survivors and contributing to meals for families facing hunger.


For all remaining perks, we will send you a follow-up email to gather the information we need to get things right.

A functional and artistic wallet clutch that keeps you organized in style. Our wallet clutches are 8 inches long, 4 inches high, and 1.5 inches wide. Lots of pockets inside and a place to stash your phone or keys. These clutches coordinate with our business bags. You are contributing to the support of 1 domestic violence survivor or contributing to 4 meals.

Our premier product keeps you organized in style. The business bags are 15 inches long, 11.5 inches high, and 4 inches wide. Lots of room for your phone, wallet, calendar, laptop, and more. There are pockets inside and out for all kinds of stuff. A key fob keeps those pesky keys at hand. These bags are solidly built and sturdy, so load it up with all the stuff you need!  You are contributing to the support of 2 domestic violence survivors or contributing to 12 meals.

$10 off the retail price. The combination of our business bag and wallet clutch keeps you super organized in style with easy access to the things you need. The functional wallet clutch gives you the opportunity to leave your bag behind when you need to dash into the grocery store on the way home. You are contributing to the support of  2 domestic violence survivors or contributing to 16 meals.

$20 off the retail price. You are contributing to the support of 4 domestic violence survivors or contributing to 32 meals. (By the way, you rock!)

 But there is even more you can do to support us by spreading the word and referring your friends. The more friends you send our way, the more women and children you are helping, and the more fair pay you are providing. We have some special gifts to show our gratitude.

Here's how you do it:

To be able to track your referrals, you need to promote our campaign with Indiegogo’s share tools while logged into your Indiegogo account. Your unique ID will be attached to any resulting contributions or visits.

For example, when you are logged into your account and use Indiegogo’s share tools to send a tweet, the link in the tweet includes your unique ID. Let's say your friend reads your tweet and clicks through the link to contribute, you will be recognized as helping bring in the amount contributed by your friend.

In short, simply log into your Indiegogo account, and use Indiegogo’s share tools to track your referrals. You can check your referrals through your Indiegogo profile or on our leaderboard that will be featured on our front page.

Here is what you can get for sharing the word:

If we meet our initial $25,000 goal, we will be able to contribute $2,500 to support domestic violence survivors and families facing hunger AND provide 625 hours of fair pay.

But together we REALLY can do WAY more than that! 

If we reach $87,000 in contributions, we will provide enough work to support another full time member of the sewing cooperative. That includes the costs of materials and approximately 2,175 hours of fair pay. We also will be contributing $8,700 to support domestic violence survivors and families facing hunger. Plus our artists will receive $8,700 for royalties in total. Every little bit adds.                                                       

Whether or not you can contribute to our campaign, you can make a difference by sharing our story. Use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out!


We will keep you up to date on what we have been able to achieve together.

We have successfully addressed the biggest challenges to produce our products in a socially conscious way, with each step contributing to positive change. The remaining challenges relate to the time it takes to weave, print, and sew. While our estimated timeline for delivering your perks takes this into account, things happen that are beyond our control. For example, the more support we get during our campaign means the more products we need to sew. Of course, sewing more products takes more time. But that is a good thing, right?

Because we have established strong relationships with our vendors, because they are 100% behind our mission, and are all about supporting small businesses, we know they won't be wasting time.

We will keep you posted about where things are in the production process, so there will be no surprises.

Now that you know more about Mountain Bird Designs, here is a little more about the Mountain Bird Designs team.

This all started when Michele Lynberg Black was still an epidemiologist at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. She grew frustrated with the limited options in "brief cases" available for professional women who didn't want the "manly" look. So she made her own business bag - Version 1.0. Michele, as a scientist, knew a lot about crunching numbers, developing public health surveys, and all the other stuff that goes with public health research. She was also an experienced quilter and a mixed media artist with 40 years of sewing experience. But she knew very little about all the other things that were needed to make the dream of Mountain Bird Designs turn into a reality. Here's our dream team. 

Mountain Bird Designs is endorsed by the Made in America Movement.
story_txt:
Help us launch a made in America, art-driven, environmentally conscious, textile business that will help thousands of domestic violence survivors and families who are facing hunger.


Mountain Bird Designs, founded in 2014,  is a for-purpose, small textile business located in Western North Carolina. Our tag line "Designs That Make a Difference" is centered  on our commitment to use our creativity for positive change. Our company is built on the foundation of sustainability and empowerment. Ten percent of every purchase is donated to two organizations with solid track records in supporting domestic violence survivors and families facing hunger in the United States. 

GreenHouse17 is a domestic violence shelter located in Kentucky that has received many awards for their innovative and sustainable approach to nurturing domestic violence survivors and their children. 

Feeding America is a nationwide network of food banks providing food to more than 46 million people through 60,000 food pantries and meal programs.  Our mission to contribute to positive change is built into every step of our production process, beginning with the art work that we feature.
