story:
The owner, Betsy Paille, has a passion for cats (obviously). The idea for The Cattery of Baton Rouge came about when she and her husband wanted better boarding for their 4 cats while on vacation. When pet sitters didn’t work out and veterinarian boarding seemed too confining, the idea for The Cattery started brewing.

We also have an awesome Boarding Manager, who sadly doesn't want to be named just yet because she still has a full time job (and we are several months from opening). BUT, she's got over 8 years of experience with cat rescue, has been a foster mom for longer than that, and is a part time pet-sitter. She also believes in what we stand for at The Cattery: better care for your cat, at home and away. We are so excited to have her! 

The Cattery of Baton Rouge is a cage-free, dog-free, cat-only boarding facility. It will feature 20 walk-in style cat rooms in two different sizes (4’X4’ and 4’x6’), kitty play rooms, and all the comfort, style, and chin scratches possible (at no extra charge!) so you know your kitties will be comfortable and relaxed while you are away. Each individual room and playroom will feature multi-level shelving, hammocks, towers, and hideaways. Does your cat have a favorite 6 foot cat tower? Bring it! It’s just one of the perks of your cat having his or her own boarding room. While cats will never encounter stranger cats, our rooms are big enough that your entire cat family can room together for a feeling of security and familiarity.

Not only will The Cattery be the first of its kind in Louisiana, we want to be a full service cat destination. We will offer pet sitting when boarding isn’t the best option, a full store featuring the latest catification products (including some Cattery-created pieces!), and in-home consultation services if you want advice on how to transform your home into a cat-friendly (but still beautiful) place to live.

We also want to give back. The Cattery will partner with a local rescue group, acting as additional space for a few select kitties to live while they wait for furever homes. While they are at The Cattery, they will have free reign to test run our store inventory and receive love from visitors. 

Cats need to run, pounce, jump, and stretch. 
Our unique boarding environment allows them to do just that. 

We understand that traditional facilities don't have the time or resources to focus on the unique needs of cats, and that’s ok. That’s why we're so passionate and excited about bringing cage-free cat-only boarding to Baton Rouge.

The Cattery of Baton Rouge is set to open in May of 2015.

We're still working on that. We promise wherever The Cattery is located, it will be safe, secure, and easily accessible. We are currently working with an agent on finding the perfect place. Have a place you think would be a great fit for The Cattery? Let us know!

Because we believe you should be able to go on vacation and not have to worry whether your cat is hiding under the bed for a week, escaping out the front door, or scared of the strange barking dog down the hallway.  We’ve worried many a vacation away, and we wanted something better for our cats (and for us).

With your help. 

Renovating a commercial space is costly when you need 20 separate boarding rooms, 3-4 play rooms, laundry and cleaning facilities, storage, office space, and a storefront. That’s a lot of sheetrock and cat shelves! Any amount you give will go directly to renovation and catification of an existing building. The more money we can raise, the more cat-awesome we can make The Cattery. We want to be the place to go if you want to see catification in action.

Specifically, we are estimating approximately $60,000 just for renovation costs – that doesn’t include permitting, legal, marketing, or any other start-up costs. We are asking for $15,000 to add to the cash we already have in hand, which will give us enough to apply for a business loan for the remainder.

We aren’t opening The Cattery to make millions; that’s not what this business is about. It’s about changing the way we think about our cats and their well-being, in our home and while we are away. So we are asking for your help to make this dream a reality, and make Baton Rouge the first city in Louisiana to have cage-free cat care.

Can’t donate? Then please share using the social media tools, email, word of mouth - any way you can spread the word. It's just us - no big names or big backers, so however you can spread the word helps! 

We are so excited about bringing The Cattery to Baton Rouge, and we can’t wait to show you what all we have in store. And in the meantime - please join us on social media and keep up to date on our website (www.thecatterybr.com). Email us at gocagefree@thecatterybr.com with any questions or just to talk! We'd absolutely love to hear from you!

**Note: For all perks that have a choice (magnet or decal, or t-shirt style and size) please EMAIL US your choice once you contribute! It will make giving and receiving your perk easier on everyone! 

$10: THANK YOU! We will include you in our list of donors! 

$25: 1 entry into our drawing for 1 week of boarding for 2 of your cats! For $25, you also get a fridge magnet or a car window decal - your choice! 

$50: You get an awesome Cattery t-shirt! The t-shirt includes our logo and is heather grey. Choose between a traditional unisex tee, a v-neck, or a tank top. You also get an entry into the drawing, and a fridge magnet or decal - your choice. This perk is limited to the first 50 people. 





$100: You get all of the above - magnet or decal, t-shirt (tee, tank, or v-neck), and an entry into the drawing. You also get 1 of 15 Mimosa by M.E. necklaces featuring the Cattery's leaping cat. Madeline Ellis of Mimosa by M.E. has been so gracious to create and donate 15 necklaces - get them before they disappear! This perk is limited to the first 15 people. 


$150: For $150 you get a ticket to our Preview Cocktail Party where you can tour our facilities before anyone else sees them! You also get everything else above (minus the necklace) - the magnet or decal, the t-shirt (tee, tank, or v-neck), and an entry into the drawing. Limited to 30 people. 

$500: You get all of the above - magnet or decal, t-shirt (tee, tank, or v-neck), a ticket to the Preview Reception, and an entry into the drawing. You also get an in-home consultation with specific product suggestions on how you can catify your space! Limited to 10 people. 

$1500: At the $1500 mark, you will receive a stay at the Cattery, all inclusive, for 7 nights for up to two of your cats! You will also receive all the perks above: magnet or decal, t-shirt (tee, tank, or v-neck), a ticket to the Preview Cocktail Party, in-home consultation, and an entry into the drawing! Limited to the first 5 people at this price point. 

$5000: For our top givers, we'll give you everything listed above: magnet or decal, t-shirt (tee, tank, or v-neck), a ticket to the Preview Reception, one in-home consultation, and an entry into the drawing. You will also receive 1 full month of boarding for up to two of your cats. Break it up into several weeks or weekends (minimum 3 day stay per visit) - it never expires! Limited to the first 2 people at this price point. 


Thank you for helping us bring the first ever
cage-free cat boarding to Baton Rouge!

story:
We are a group of mothers with children of various ages who want to improve our health and that of our children through increased physical activity and healthy eating.

The Jane Finch Mother's In Motion (MIM) fitness program was started by mothers in the Jane Finch Community. It started in 2012 and currently has over 45 women registered. It runs Tuesdays and Fridays mornings at Oakdale Community Centre. The program is coordinated by the participants with support from Black Creek Community Health Centre (in kind staff support) and City of Toronto Parks and Recreation (space). Initially, The Canadian Association for the Advancement of Women and Sports and Physical Activity provided some funding for childcare and instructors.

According to statistics Canada, Jane Finch has one of the highest rates of diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol. Many of the women who participate in the MIM fitness program get access to dieticians, instructors, free childcare and personal trainers.

Our funding will come to an end and so we are looking for new partners to assist us in sustaining this program. Your donation to the MIM fitness program will provide childcare and instructors for the fitness program.

For more information please contact Ama Amponsah at 647-787-7291 or email at leticia.boahen@yahoo.com
story_txt:
We are a group of mothers with children of various ages who want to improve our health and that of our children through increased physical activity and healthy eating. 
 The Jane Finch Mother's In Motion (MIM) fitness program was started by mothers in 
the Jane Finch Community. It started in 2012 and currently has over 45 
women registered.  It runs Tuesdays and Fridays mornings at Oakdale 
Community Centre.  The program is coordinated by the participants with 
support from Black Creek Community Health Centre (in kind staff support)
 and City of Toronto Parks and Recreation (space). Initially, The 
Canadian Association for the Advancement of Women and Sports and 
Physical Activity provided some funding for childcare and instructors. 
 According to statistics Canada, Jane Finch has one of the highest rates
 of diabetes, high blood pressure and high cholesterol.  Many of the 
women who participate in the MIM fitness program get access to 
dieticians, instructors, free childcare and personal trainers.  
Our funding will come to an end and so we are looking for new partners 
to assist us in sustaining this program. Your donation to the MIM 
fitness program will provide childcare and instructors for the fitness 
program.  For more information please contact Ama Amponsah at 647-787-7291 or email at leticia.boahen@yahoo.com

story:
Day 14: Hear the update from our founder, Elisha.


Enjoyed it? Share the video. Spread the word. Keep the campaign running!

This is how it all began.

Hi, my name is Elisha Chan, the founder of Elisha C. I am 25 years old and recently graduated from University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) with a double major in Business Economics and Communication Studies. When I was 8 years old, my mother, an entrepreneur in China sent me to the United States to receive a better education and a more hopeful future. Since I was 8 years old, I moved across the country away from my whole family to start this new and  promising life. Like a typical Asian family, they expected me to graduate college and get a job in a big corporation and start making big money. But my life took an unexpected turn for a more purposeful and passion-filled life.

Summer of my sophomore year 2009, I went on my first mission trip to Fond Doux Haiti with a student group called Chi Alpha at UCLA. I fell in love with Haiti. But it wasn’t until I came back from my 7th trip in Dec 2011 that I found a passion to dedicate my life to make a lasting difference in places in need. Specifically, I saw that Haiti needed a long-term solution to get out of poverty, something that a two-week trip cannot solve. The root of Haiti’s problem, and for other third world countries is economy instability and lack of job opportunities for the people. I was determined to find the solution to bring much needed sustainability to this country.

In December 2013, I launched Elisha C. with the vision to bring economic stability to places in need by using international business to create jobs, starting with Haiti. Our mission is to put ‘Haiti in the hands of Haitians.’ There was a sense of finding my purpose. I was now able to combine all I have ever learned from family business and my major to help solve a problem that is much bigger than me, bringing sustainability and hope to places of desperation.

We are changing the way we do charity. 

There is an old proverb that says, "Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime." These are wise words we need to take to heart when dealing with the crisis of world poverty. 

The Problem - Why did Bill Clinton apologize? 

"In the wake of Haiti’s devastating 7.0-magnitude earthquake...former U.S. President Bill Clinton issued an unusual and now infamous apology. Calling his subsidies to American rice farmers in the 1990s a mistake because it undercut rice production in Haiti, Clinton said he had struck a 'devil’s bargain' that ultimately resulted in greater poverty and food insecurity in Haiti...'I have to live every day with the consequences of the lost capacity to produce a rice crop in Haiti to feed those people, because of what I did.'" Read more at foreignpolicy.com.

Reconsider the way you are doing charity. Are you becoming the problem or are you becoming the solution? Are you disabling the people with your short-term aid or are you empowering them with a long-term solution?

The Problem - The Old Ways of Charity

  • Hand-outs
  • Only for the rich people
  • Give and walk away/drop and go
  • Giver and receiver are disconnected
  • Results in disabling the people being helped
  • The country/people remain in the pit of poverty/bottom of the social ladder

What if we combine charity with consumerism?

Old consumerism -

Problems:

  • Only way for producers to enter into the market is through competitive pricing, whoever can offer the lowest cost of production gets the deal, resulting in very minimal gain for producers or even taking a loss for their production.
  • No sustainability for the small producers
  • Devalue products/producers
  • Big mark ups for the businesses, while minimal returns for the producers
  • Keeping producing countries/people down & stagnate in the social ladder

New consumerism - 

Solutions:

  • Direct purchase from the producers at fair prices
  • Story telling, share the stories of the producers, giving them a voice
  • Add value to products, producers, and your purchases
  • Sustainability for producers & job creation for people in need
  • A chance for countries to rise out of poverty and climb up the social ladder

The Solution - Elisha C.

Elisha C. is a social enterprise to redefine charity and business. By combining them, we have the power to use your everyday purchases as an act of creating sustainability in another person's life. We can end poverty together by using our first-world consumerism to bring economic stability to third-world countries.
How?
  1. Bridges – We are building bridges to directly connect producers, such as artisans and farmers directly to the global marketplace. We facilitate resources to go back as investments to multiply the opportunities being created.
  2. Platforms - We are building platforms to support sustainable job creation for producers, such as artisans and farmers in the global marketplace.

The Solution - The New Way of Charity
  • Hand-up
  • For everyone through everyday purchases
  • An investment to “plant seeds & help it grow.” See it multiply.
  • Be involved in the process of charity
  • Enable and empower the people
  • A chance to climb out of the ditch of poverty and up the social ladder.

The impact we have made already.

**HAITI EXPO is a worldwide traveling exhibition that we host for all artisans to participate to raise positive Haiti awareness and create a platform for producers to be seen and heard. See Image gallery and our SITE for more.
**5 producers of Haiti includes Atelier Calla [Horn & Bone Jewelry], Apparent Project [Upcycled Artisan Goods], Haitian Production [Handpainted Art], EcoCafe Haiti [Award-winning Haitian Coffee] & Bohiomania [Stone Jewelry]. See Image gallery and our SHOP for more. 

Here are the 26 students, including 6 university students we put into school:

We are breaking the cycle of poverty and putting ‘Haiti in the hands of Haitians.’

But now we need you. Join the movement.

You will be joining a movement to bring countries in need out of poverty. When you support our cause through this campaign, the money goes directly into the business model of changing the way we do charity. We are using IndieGoGo as a jumpstart for the expansion stage of the structure already taking place. Let's empower the local people and create some sustainable job opportunities together!

It's time to expand. 

If we can raise $50,000, Elisha C. can move into a full year’s worth of expansion in its 2nd year! We will have the capacity to hire staff, purchase from more Haitian producers on the waiting list to support sustainable jobs, expand our Haiti product line, connect producers to businesses, and host Haiti EXPOs around the world. 

The potentials of the change we can make together.

Our goals to accomplish in Haiti this year and more:

  • Invest in at least five more producers/artisans/farmers on the waiting list in support of sustainable jobs
  • Bring to the global market new Haiti product lines such as 100% natural oils (cosmetic), variety in Haitian coffee from different areas of Haiti, Haitian cocoa beans for Haitian chocolate, etc.
  • Launch new economic development projects/micro-enterprises for local Haitian people, such as chicken coop and agricultural programs
  • Launch artisan training programs in the rural villages lacking opportunities
  • Sponsor more students to get an education in the rural communities
  • Increase scholarships to fund students in universities – bringing them from the village to the city
  • Continue to break the cycle of poverty

The PERKS.

On top of funding the expansion of Elisha C., we are committed to use a portion of your support to create more sustainable opportunities for the people of Haiti.


The Future is bright.

This is just the beginning. We are just getting started.

Haiti is only the first of many places we will use this model to change the way we do charity. Join our movement and we can end poverty by empowering the people and creating sustainable job opportunities around the world!

Other Ways You Can Help.

  1. Share this campaign with 5-10 of your closest friends. If we all come together, we can make a greater difference.
  2. LIKE US on Facebook @ Elisha C. and FOLLOW US on Instagram @ Elisha C
  3. Sign up on our newsletter at here to stay up to date.
  4. Shop 'made in haiti' products and support Haitian artisans at elishac.com

story:
Short Summary

Hello there!

My name is Jakub Grabowski, I'm 17. I am currently studying at the Peter Jones Enterprise Academy and one of my great passions is business. I have been studying business studies for the past 4 years and my interest for it grows everyday.

Another passion of mine is rugby. I have been playing rugby for over 8 years now and have represented counties, regions and play for a local team. In order to maintain my fitness and strength, I have to have a healthy and balanced diet.

When I was out and about in a shopping centres I always wanted a good quality, tasty smoothie, however I was always unable to find one that suits me. Whether it was because I didn't like the taste of it, it was too thick, too runny etc. Therefore I am creating a business that will allow people to build their smoothie by choosing their own ingredients and making it suit their taste buds. I am also making my business to suit anyone with special dietary needs such as (lactose intolerant, vegan, nut free etc.) just so everyone can enjoy a healthy and delicious smoothie on the go.

What We Need & What You Get

The target for this business is £500 and the money will be used in the following ways:

  • Fruit and other ingredient supplies for a period of 2 weeks
  • Branding (cups, uniform etc.)
  • Promotional and advertising materials (e.g. loyalty cards, posters, leaflets etc.)
  • Cover prices of basic equipment and their running costs (e.g. blender and the electricity needed)
  • Some licences that are needed to run the juice bar (e.g. basic food hygiene)

If the goal, however, is not met, and we have a limited amount of funding. We will focus on getting the most important things from the list above which includes the licences, ingredient supplies and promotional material.

In return, you, as a customer you will recieve the chance to experience the exiting way of drinking to buy and make smoothies. You ask, we do (within reason)!

  

Other Ways You Can Help

If, however, you are unable to help, please share and let everyone know of the idea. I'm sure someone out there that you know, is facing the same problem as me and would like this business to launch. So get the word out there and help me out!

If you have ANY further questions, please don't hesitate to contact me on the following emails-

Jakub.Grabowsk97@gmail.com

SqueezeMeJuiceBar@gmail.com

story:
We Are Wanderers

creators, listeners, students, musicians, poets, artists, dancers, comedians, fashionistas, cinephiles, walk and readers, leavers, featherless bipeds... We are Wanderers, This is our Tavern.

Since 2008 we have been hosting DJs, touring musicians and comedians, local performers, as well as Monday Musical Improv, Tuesday Poetry/Spoken Word, Wednesday Reggae Night, Thursday Open Mic, Friday Live Music, Saturday Club Night, random quarter beer specials, dolla hollas, and all the things. 

Needing more space, we moved to 310 W. Third Street in Moscow, Idaho and are finishing renovations at our new two-story building with an inviting outdoor space. This fundraiser will help us finish construction on the ground floor, the new home of Wanderers' Tavern. This will be immediately followed by reclaiming the parking lot to a social space and outdoor music venue, Contour Sand Bar. Palette of the Inland Northwest (PIN), the gallery upstairs, will complete the project.

Our old location is missed, but it is a small price to pay for the awesomeness that is about to ensue.

live music flowing, beats dropping, and general badassery in the ‘scow

Turn Down for What

Our new venue needs a sprinkler system in the event that the volatile hotness wanderers can’t turn down sets our dwelling aflame, hydration is necessary as we wish not the conflagration consume our party structure. We need a fire sprinkler system to open our doors. The contractor has been contracted and the job is underway, however, we need your help in order to finish our remaining obligations before we reopen.

What We Need

  • A fire sprinkler system

This is the crucial project for the renovation and is an essential for the safety of our customers, and it came with a hefty tag to match.

  • Upgrades to our kitchen for scrumptious culinary options

We are upgrading our food and drink options to present you with healthy, nutritious, and scrumptious local and regional sustenance. 

  • Additional bathroom fixtures for larger crowds

When nature calls, you must answer. The royalty that are wanderers need their thrones.

What We Have

The Palouse is our inspiration. The rolling hills, the four seasons, sometimes all of them on the same day, and the Palouse Falls crashing into the river. 

We've done most of the work ourselves, from the beginning.

Setting The Bar...


And We're Doing it Again!

Our interior design captures the spirit of Wanderers’ Tavern as a place to gather for those who wander to Moscow, Idaho, The Heart of The Arts.

Conceptual sketch of the new bar. And for the grounded LOLz, calculated the longitudinal and latitudinal difference between the Palouse Falls and 310 W. Third; it's not much, check it.

  • Upgraded our PA System: Performers will be able to deliver the sound deserving of their talent. Many bands are waiting to do their thing.
  • More Drink Options: We are excited to expand our choice of quality libations, we will keeping serving the most inspired of concoctions.
  • Custom Furniture: The comfort of a weary wanderer is one not entirely borne of the cushions of the rear end support. The atmosphere that pervades Wanderers' is mapped into the design and factors in the acoustics and needless to say, aesthetics of the entire space.

The Shape of Things to Come...

  


Before and After: VIP Section and stage with acoustics dampening cork on walls

Please Donate and Say Something

Share in old-fashioned, oral tradition... like, you know, talking. Typing and clicking works as well, actually very well, tell the world!


there's more glimpses to be had, check back for updates

story:
Support us in making our first steps on direction to Mars!


Introduction

Mankind has always been drawn to acquire knowledge and explore the surroundings. Today, we are a species that has managed to completely explore and become an advanced civilisation in our home planet, The Earth. Technology allows us to strive for more and push our existence to outer space and beyond. We are in the process of a new step in evolution towards becoming a multi-planetary species. There is an increasing number of people who realise this and have expressed support to aim for a human colony on Mars, our nearest artificially habitable planet. 

These people are brave and have the courage to face the new and unknown and are determined to make the dream of a successful manned mission to Mars, a reality. 

These are the kind of people who will be remembered forever as pioneers and as a generation of ambitious explorers.

We will prove that mankind is capable of achieving the impossible - bringing life to a seemingly cold and lifeless planet like Mars.

MarsPolar is a private international initiative, which aims to research and plan the establishment of a human colony on Mars. We are a group of space enthusiasts, scientists, engineers, designers and dreamers, who plan to work to push the boundaries of space exploration. We are working to establish connections with researchers, scientists, space agencies and private space companies. We then intend to dedicate specialised teams to try and work on specific problems, that help us reach closer to the dream of establishing an artificial habitat on Mars. 

We invite you to become a part of a new society of space enthusiasts, pioneers, facilitators of research and dreamers. Your enthusiasm, support and contribution will help us reach our goal of creating the first settlement on Mars together.

Our first objectives

a. Support the European Rover Challenge organised  by the European Space Foundation

Our current partner - The European Space Foundation is organising an event in September, 2015 called the European Rover Challenge.

The European Rover Challenge is a unique event that brings together students, engineers and technical enthusiasts who are interested in robotics. The event also attracts a wider audience including children, senior citizens and families who are interested in taking part in a technologically enriching phenomenon.

The event consists of three sections. In the first section, a competition on a rugged terrain akin to martian conditions is conducted where rover designs will be tested and competed against each other. Participants are students, graduates and university staff and the task for the teams is to design and build a rover which they use to compete in five competitions. The team with the highest score from the five competitions is declared winner.

By helping us you are also supporting young and talented designers, engineers who constructing Martian rovers!

A part of funds from our Indiegogo campaign will be used to support ERC in Poland. We will also work with the winning team to develop their rover further.


 

European Rover Challenge (photos by Planet PR)

b. Register MarsPolar company in UAE

After reaching the campaign's goal we will register our company in UAE.
License for three years costs about $8-10 k.

c.Establish our headquarters and research center

For the initial setup, we intend to have the following facilities:

• Office for the team
• Experimental labs for research
• Workshop for components fabrication
• Quality and safety testing facilities
• Training area and small lecture rooms

The experimental labs and workshop will contain required material and tools to work on the development of the rover. A clean- room would have to be constructed along with a fabrication lab for the design and creation of micro-components that are required for the rover.
In the long run, we envision a more advanced facility and some ambitious infrastructure. An advanced facility would have launch pads, landing areas, ranges, payload assembly buildings, payload processing facilities, laboratories, facilities and equipment for the construction of payloads, spaceflight hardware, rockets and other launch vehicles and other spaceport facilities and aerospacerelated systems. Besides setting up hardware and required infrastructure, a good maintenance system is also required and will be state-of-the-art. The most important agenda is to build a quality infrastructure at a minimal cost.

Long Term Goals:
1. Expand the facilities of the MPSC
2. Constantly upgrade infrastructure to make MPSC the ideal operations centre for a manned Mars mission
3. Emerge as the leading private space company in the region possibly expanding into areas of Space technology and exploration beyond the Mars missions


The planned future MarsPolar Spacecenter

d.Work on our first rover mission to Mars

One of our first missions to Mars will involve the constructing of two rovers to be sent to two different locations on Mars. 

  • The first one will arrive to a possible future manned mission landing site to investigate the area for the setting up of a habitat.
  • The second rover will most likely to be placed on location favourable for communication and will be tasked to explore the different surface features of Mars. We envision an idea that this location could be the north pole, which could potentially be a site with frozen water. Also, the polar environment is definitely worth studying, however challenges pertaining power will have to be circumvented since the pole will receive negligible sunlight during a part of the year.
  • We plan to construct rovers to with support existing rover projects. For example, projects financed by European Space Foundation. The idea is to take the best ideas and transform them to working projects while maintaining a low cost of development. 
We figured that by supporting the ERC, we are contributing to the development of potential rovers. Our idea is that we some part of donations to support the ERC and some part  for the rover development project. The winning team from the competition will be invited to work with us and we intend to use the best concepts from their design and improve on it using the allocated fund. The idea would be to incorporate instruments required for the First Mission in the basic rover design and present it to NASA and SpaceX. A potential idea is to also present it to ESF itself thereby attracting its partners and sponsors into funding further for the project.


Why UAE?

The United Arab Emirates is an emerging player in the Space sector, and has strived to produce an attractive framework for business. UAE is strategically located in the heart of Middle East and is equidistant from the west and east. 

UAE is a leading business hub; it offers access to connecting with potential investors better than any other location currently. We also believe that UAE offers a favourable environment to set up a business from a legal standpoint, having few complications and an easy registration procedure.

Therefore the key factors to choosing Dubai are:

A growing market - Dubai’s imports have more than doubled since 1989; regional economic growth and liberalisation is set to grow massively
A prosperous market - Strategic location at the heart of one of the world’s richest regions
A diversified market - Wide import requirements and opportunities to partner with suppliers for components
And did you know that UAE has started it's own Mars Exploration Program?


Our Team


Arteum Goncharov

Co-founder/CEO

Bachelor of Science in Information technologies and Networks, IT Specialist, Russia

Gleb Osipov

Co-founder/PR-Manager

Designer and Enterprenuer, United Arab Emirates

Roman Juranek

PR & Communications manager in Eastern Europe

Enterprenuer, Republic of Poland

Ramon Garcia Meano

Helicopter instructor

Director and owner of Top Helicopteros, 1st police officer, Kingdom of Spain

Amrit Krishnan

Instrumentation/Spacecraft engineer

Master of Science in Complex Adaptive Systems, Sweden

Alexander Trunkovsky

Chief Technical Officer

Architect and video producer, Russian Federation

Hristina Panova

Graphic Designer

Artist and designer, Russian Federation

Yu Li

Biology and space researcher

Designer and interdisciplinary researcher, Swiss Confederation


Our Partners


European Space Foundation

The private foundation, that promotes  science education in schools, including sciences relating to Space and Universe promoting public awareness in the academia and among technical professions, education about space and space exploration, supporting space related research initiatives and projects organisation of B2B and S2B meetings, conferences and networking inspiring interdisciplinary co-operation and knowledge transfer between businesses and institutions, promoting scientific projects including space research developing and supporting general interest in space technology, astronomy and cosmology dissemination and communication for EU space and science projects. (e.g. Horizon 2020)
We will cooperate with roverteams, supported by European Space Foundation, and work to develop one of the better rovers that emerge from the competition.

 

Magma 2 and Scorpio rovers (photos by Planet PR)

Top Helicopteros Flight School

It is a Helicopter Flight School, created in 2008 on the island of Gran Canaria and registered in the Commercial Register in Las Palmas, Spain with CID B-35,979,673.
Top Helicopteros has a fleet of 5 aircrafts: three Robinson 22 and two Robinson 44.
We currently are partnered with Top Helicopteros, and hope to jointly establish flight training using parabolic flights.  

 

Top Helicopteros R44 and Ramon Garcia Meano on board

Space Seed Design Project

Design project by Swiss biologist and designer, Yu Li in the area of genetics and space exploration.

Their goal is to create genetically-engineered and radiation-resistant bacteria. These bacteria could be someday sent to Mars or other planet and it is designed to be dormant, waiting for the best conditions for germination and growth into organic life. Yu Li, an interdisciplinary researcher and designer from Switzerland, is the project’s leader.

Yu Li is our teammember and she will help us with solving of biological problems in future.


Perks!

There are some official merchandise that you can receive for your support and contributions:
Our official t-shirts with the logo of MarsPolar project:

Wonderful Mugs with our logo:

Our poster in A3 paper format:

NEW!

Exclusive 3D-printed models of our Mars Transportation Vehicle!


Thanks for your interest!
story_txt:
Support us in making our first steps on direction to Mars!
Introduction
Mankind has always been drawn to acquire knowledge and explore the surroundings. Today, we are a species that has managed to completely explore and become an advanced civilisation in our home planet, The Earth. Technology allows us to strive for more and push our existence to outer space and beyond. We are in the process of a new step in evolution towards becoming a multi-planetary species. There is an increasing number of people who realise this and have expressed support to aim for a human colony on Mars, our nearest artificially habitable planet. These people are brave and have the courage to face the new and unknown and are determined to make the dream of a successful manned mission to Mars, a reality. These are the kind of people who will be remembered forever as pioneers and as a generation of ambitious explorers.
We will prove that mankind is capable of achieving the impossible - bringing life to a seemingly cold and lifeless planet like Mars.MarsPolar is a private international initiative, which aims to research and plan the establishment of a human colony on Mars. We are a group of space enthusiasts, scientists, engineers, designers and dreamers, who plan to work to push the boundaries of space exploration. We are working to establish connections with researchers, scientists, space agencies and private space companies. We then intend to dedicate specialised teams to try and work on specific problems, that help us reach closer to the dream of establishing an artificial habitat on Mars. We invite you to become a part of a new society of space enthusiasts, pioneers, facilitators of research and dreamers. Your enthusiasm, support and contribution will help us reach our goal of creating the first settlement on Mars together.Our first objectives

a. Support the European Rover Challenge organised  by the European Space Foundation
Our current partner - The European Space Foundation is organising an event in September, 2015 called the European Rover Challenge.
The European Rover Challenge is a unique event that brings together students, engineers and technical enthusiasts who are interested in robotics. The event also attracts a wider audience including children, senior citizens and families who are interested in taking part in a technologically enriching phenomenon.
The event consists of three sections. In the first section, a competition on a rugged terrain akin to martian conditions is conducted where rover designs will be tested and competed against each other. Participants are students, graduates and university staff and the task for the teams is to design and build a rover which they use to compete in five competitions. The team with the highest score from the five competitions is declared winner.
By helping us you are also supporting young and talented
designers, engineers who constructing Martian rovers!
A part of funds from our Indiegogo campaign will be used to support ERC in Poland. We will also work with the winning team to develop their rover further.


 


European Rover Challenge (photos by Planet PR)

A clean- room would have to be constructed along with a fabrication lab for the design and creation of micro-components that are required for the rover.In the long run, we envision a more advanced facility and some ambitious infrastructure. An advanced facility would have launch pads, landing areas, ranges, payload assembly buildings, payload processing facilities, laboratories, facilities and equipment for the construction of payloads, spaceflight hardware, rockets and other launch vehicles and other spaceport facilities and aerospacerelated systems. Besides setting up hardware and required infrastructure, a good maintenance system is also required and will be state-of-the-art. The most important agenda is to build a quality infrastructure at a minimal cost.Long Term Goals:1. Expand the facilities of the MPSC2. Constantly upgrade infrastructure to make MPSC the ideal operations centre for a manned Mars mission3. Emerge as the leading private space company in the region possibly expanding into areas of Space technology and exploration beyond the Mars missions



The planned future MarsPolar Spacecenter



d.Work on our first rover mission to Mars

One of our first missions to Mars will involve the constructing of two rovers to be sent to two different locations on Mars. 


The first one will arrive to a possible future manned mission landing site to investigate the area for the setting up of a habitat.
The second rover will most likely to be placed on location favourable for communication and will be tasked to explore the different surface features of Mars. We envision an idea that this location could be the north pole, which could potentially be a site with frozen water. Also, the polar environment is definitely worth studying, however challenges pertaining power will have to be circumvented since the pole will receive negligible sunlight during a part of the year.
We plan to construct rovers to with support existing rover projects. For example, projects financed by European Space Foundation. The idea is to take the best ideas and transform them to working projects while maintaining a low cost of development. 

We figured that by supporting the ERC, we are contributing to the development of potential rovers. Our idea is that we some part of donations to support the ERC and some part  for the rover development project. The winning team from the competition will be invited to work with us and we intend to use the best concepts from their design and improve on it using the allocated fund. UAE is a leading business hub; it offers access to connecting with potential investors better than any other location currently. We also believe that UAE offers a favourable environment to set up a business from a legal standpoint, having few complications and an easy registration procedure.

story:
Lets Fix Our Youth Problem!!!

Get Our Youth There (GOYT) would like to invite you to participate in addressing the pressing issues youth and young adults face in your  communities. Let's do something about the youth being gunned down in the streets, living without the basics of life, experiencing poor success, struggling with drug and alcohol addictions, being incarcerated and failed by school systems, and the many other issues they face! 

We need YOUR support to help us finalize our youth one-stop-shop development and begin to strengthen the youth organizations in your communities. 

Our Solution To Your Community Issues!!!

We are a start-up youth program development firm that specializes in data gathering, data analytics, and custom youth program development. In short, our plan is to strengthen and empower the youth organizations in communities around the world and in-turn they will be better equipped to produce and operate better youth solutions. 

Our model centers on providing holistic services to all youth organizations (start-up to large organizations; Non-Profits or Social Enterprises). Our work is classified into two categories: full-service consulting and a one-stop-shop youth system. 

Full-service Consulting!!!

Our belief is that the key to our youth problems lies in the DATA. For this reason, we:

  • Work with organizations to gather the data, in the organization or community,  needed to perform a sound analysis for a fledgling program or measure an existing program.
  • Work with organizations to analyze data to conceive, develop, or measure youth programs.
  • Work with an organization to create custom-tailored youth programs based the community's needs and their capabilities. 

No issue is too difficult for GOYT to solve! Your youth issues is our business!

One-stop-shop youth system (GOYT System)

We understand that some organizations need more than just consulting services, and that's why we developed a one-stop-shop system that any small to medium sized youth organization can use to power their youth operations. This includes 

  • Youth ministries, 
  • Community Development Corporations, 
  • and any other youth mandated organization. 

In short, the one-stop-shop system operates a system of specific business policies, program development methodologies, and support channels. Our system is designed to help an organization get off the ground or optimize their current operations. Each system is tailorable and functions in accordance to an organization’s size, mission, and vision.  

The whole purpose of the system is to ensure that the organization has a solid business infrastructure, has the capability of producing custom solutions to community issues, and has the necessary resources to make it all possible (including funding).  This is how our GOYT system looks in a organization!

       

GOYT System Internals!!!

Our GOYT system encompasses two parts:

  • A System of Operations
  • A System of Addressing Community Issues

Essentially, we provide all of the business principles (Policies) a youth organization needs to operate a sustainable youth organization and a simple-to-use data gathering, data analytics, and custom program development methodology that accelerates an organization's youth operations. 

organizations will have the capability of operating a sustainable and measurable youth organization at a cost (time, quality, and money) less than any other organization in the industry can offer or you could do on your own.  In addition, the GOYT system does not come attached with a must operate solution; its all based on the community's need and the organization's capabilities. 

  

Why this Campaign?  

We're glad you asked! We need help to develop the support infrastructure behind the GOYT System and strengthen our internal infrastructure. Support plays a major role in the success or failure of an organization. For this reason, our support system is designed as a technology and non-technology hybrid that does three things:

  • Provides consulting, training, and general assistance whenever our organizations need it!
  • Connects our organizations with all members of their community in a new and exciting way! 
  • Provides all of the small business tools our organizations would need to operate successful. 

We will use the funds in the following ways:

  • Develop the GOYT System's digital software (40%), 
  • Hire several key individuals to assist (20%), 
  • Move into better office space and acquire needed office equipment (15%),
  • Handle any remaining legal and administrative requirements (5%), 
  • Briefly assist with post ramp-up operations (20%).
If we fail to reach our goal, we'll allocate the funds raised to areas within the organization that are most needed to accelerate the Company's work.  

GOYT's Vision for the Future!!!  

Overall, we are working to create a global community network of positive youth solutions. To do this we plan to to implement GOYT systems into thousands of organizations around the world and ensure they produce needed solutions within their communities. Provided below is a visual of the GOYT Network:

The Projected Social Impact 

In a nut-shell, social return means "what will my contribution do for society." Well, your contribution to GOYT does a lot for society. We equip organizations to positively impact the lives of the youth in their community. By equipping tens of thousands of organizations ........ well..... you see what we mean. It's a lot; thousands, millions, even billions of youth and young adults impacted.   Now thats social return!!!

For the technical people, we calculate our social returns by aggregating the social return totals of all measurable outcomes that our GOYT system operators produce. We project that our social returns will surpass $1000 per $1 contributed to GOYT as we grow. Provided below is visual representation of the Company's social return model:                    

Outside of our quantitative social return, GOYT solutions will produce verifiable qualitative social returns that you can see, feel, and visit. 

The Give Back (Perks) 

We value every GOYT supporter and would like to Thank You in advance for your contribution, whether financially or not! 

As with all things, we believe that we must give back to those involved in our endeavors. For this reason, we are dedicated to including all of our supporters in the development and growth of GOYT. Please take a look at our awesome perks below:   

Management Challenges

All challenges will be recorded and posted for everyone to see. 

$750k- The Founders will locate two college age young adults and produce a short documentary film on their life journey. 

$500k- The Founders will swim with a high school swim team in a full suit (shirt, tie, shoes, etc.)

$250k- The Founders will sponsor and accompany a group of ten middle school students to a Charlotte Knights baseball game. 

$100k- The Founders will throw a pizza party at a local elementary school (whole school) and let students hit them with pies in the face, just like the 90's show "What would you do?"  

Personalized shout outs on our Social media (Twitter, Facebook, etc):                                                  

                                                     

 

Get a Full-color, vinyl sticker of the GOYT's Three Arrows of Change:

                                             


Receive monthly updates on the Company's progress with GOYT.

                                         


Place a name on our GOYT System priority waitlist: 


Have an impactful conversation with the founders, via Skype:  

                                            


Let GOYT be the voice that calls your community to action. Send us your community youth issues and we will help to raise awareness around those issues using our social media and other platforms. 

                                               


We'll hold a Get Our Youth There Seminar or Speak at your location.  

                                      


Participate in the beta testing of the GOYT's technology. 

                                    


Although we offer some pretty cool perks, the ultimate perk you will receive is impacting youth and/or young adult lives. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people can't contribute financially. For those that don't and those that do, please share and continue to share this campaign with someone who you think either: 

  • Feels passionate about the work we will do;
  • Would benefit from the solutions we create;
  • Would love to read about our GOYT, or; 
  • Would think we are Crazy. 
We really need your help to start making an impact and can only do so by you spreading the word about GOYT and helping us to make this campaign a success. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.

GOYT FAQ's

Are my funds tax-deductible? 

The GOYT Company is considered as a social enterprise and operates as a for-profit organization. This means that your contributions will be considered a social investment and will not be tax-deductible. 

Why a for profit? 

We operate as a for-profit  organization because we value the capability of using the financial channels of the for-profit world to accelerate our social work. Essentially, it makes more sense in the long run! 

What is a social enterprise? 

A social enterprise is an organization that applies commercial strategies to maximize improvements in human and environmental well-being, rather than maximizing profits for external shareholders. This means that the Company is more focused on the social returns rather than the financial returns. 

What is social return? 

Social return is a financial calculation that measures extra financial value by analyzing resources invested in a project and the outcomes produced by that project.  In short, what does my contribution do for society.

What is a one-stop-shop? 

A one-stop-shop means that you do not need to go out side of GOYT for anything youth related. If you need it we have it, or will help you get it. 

How does technology play into GOYT? 

We operate a system of support that uses certain technological tools that help our licensees connect with their communities and streamline their operations.  Essentially, we are working to build a global community network of people, organizations, and solutions. 

What is the current stage of the Company?

The Company is currently in the start-up stage. This means that we are still working through the kinks and honing GOYT. Just so you know, we are striving to make GOYT the pinnacle in the youth services industry and a staple in every youth's life.  

When can I get a GOYT System?

We are currently establishing a waitlist for our GOYT system and will start to implement them into organizations once we finish the first version of our support technology. This could be as early as the last quarter of 2015 or as late as the first quarter of 2016. We are however working with organizations in a consulting capacity.  

How much is a GOYT System?

We are still working on price, but just know we pride ourselves on making our services affordable for the everyday person with a passion for youth. 

How long does it take to get a GOYT System up and running?

This depends on the organization. It could be as little as a couple of weeks or a few months. Each organization will be different and be more or less complex. 
I need help with a youth program; How can I engage GOYT?
Shoot us an email at any time and we'll personally call you to talk through the details.

Management Challenges
All challenges will be recorded and posted for everyone to see. 
$750k- The Founders will locate two college age young adults and produce a short documentary film on their life journey. 
$500k- The Founders will swim with a high school swim team in a full suit (shirt, tie, shoes, etc.)
$250k- The Founders will sponsor and accompany a group of ten middle school students to a Charlotte Knights baseball game. 
$100k- The Founders will throw a pizza party at a local elementary school (whole school) and let students hit them with pies in the face, just like the 90's show "What would you do?"  

Personalized shout outs on our Social media (Twitter, Facebook, etc):                                                  




                                                      

Get a Full-color, vinyl sticker of the GOYT's Three Arrows of Change:
                                             

Receive monthly updates on the Company's progress with GOYT.
                                         

Place a name on our GOYT System priority waitlist: 



Have an impactful conversation with the founders, via Skype:  



                                            


Let GOYT be the voice that calls your community to action. Send us your community youth issues and we will help to raise awareness around those issues using our social media and other platforms. 

                                               


We'll hold a Get Our Youth There Seminar or Speak at your location.  


                                      




Participate in the beta testing of the GOYT's technology. 


                                    

Although we offer some pretty cool perks, the ultimate perk you will receive is impacting youth and/or young adult lives. 






Other Ways You Can Help



We understand that some people can't contribute financially. For those that don't and those that do, please share and continue to share this campaign with someone who you think either: 

Feels passionate about the work we will do;

Would benefit from the solutions we create;

Would love to read about our GOYT, or; 
Would think we are Crazy. 


We really need your help to start making an impact and can only do so by you spreading the word about GOYT and helping us to make this campaign a success. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools. 

GOYT FAQ's
Are my funds tax-deductible? 
The GOYT Company is considered as a social enterprise and operates as a for-profit organization. This means that your contributions will be considered a social investment and will not be tax-deductible. 
Why a for profit? 
We operate as a for-profit  organization because we value the capability of using the financial channels of the for-profit world to accelerate our social work. Essentially, it makes more sense in the long run! 
What is a social enterprise? 
A social enterprise is an organization that applies commercial strategies to maximize improvements in human and environmental well-being, rather than maximizing profits for external shareholders. This means that the Company is more focused on the social returns rather than the financial returns. 
What is social return? 
Social return is a financial calculation that measures extra financial value by analyzing resources invested in a project and the outcomes produced by that project.  In short, what does my contribution do for society.
What is a one-stop-shop? 
A one-stop-shop means that you do not need to go out side of GOYT for anything youth related. If you need it we have it, or will help you get it. 
How does technology play into GOYT? 
We operate a system of support that uses certain technological tools that help our licensees connect with their communities and streamline their operations.  Essentially, we are working to build a global community network of people, organizations, and solutions. 
What is the current stage of the Company?
The Company is currently in the start-up stage. This means that we are still working through the kinks and honing GOYT. Just so you know, we are striving to make GOYT the pinnacle in the youth services industry and a staple in every youth's life.  
When can I get a GOYT System?
We are currently establishing a waitlist for our GOYT system and will start to implement them into organizations once we finish the first version of our support technology. This could be as early as the last quarter of 2015 or as late as the first quarter of 2016. We are however working with organizations in a consulting capacity.  
How much is a GOYT System?
We are still working on price, but just know we pride ourselves on making our services affordable for the everyday person with a passion for youth. 

How long does it take to get a GOYT System up and running?
This depends on the organization. It could be as little as a couple of weeks or a few months. Each organization will be different and be more or less complex. 
I need help with a youth program; How can I engage GOYT?
Shoot us an email at any time and we'll personally call you to talk through the details.

story:
Short Summary

I don't usually share negative feelings, but I could use some encouragement today. I hired a contractor to do a complete remodel on my coffee shop. He gave me a fair quote and showed me a binder of paperwork. He was licensed, bonded and insured. We signed a contract and he gave me a receipt. In December I paid him $3000 to pay for the supplies. The job was to be completed in January. He moved the date forward 3 times. Each time was a different excuse. I told him that I cannot have him reschedule it again or I need my money back. He texted back a link to a multi level marketing scheme and said it would bring my family financial freedom. I called the state and found out he is not licensed, bonded or insured. He stopped answering my calls and texts. He even hand wrote on the contract: "Trust is #1!" I am so sad that I lost this amount of money. 

What We Need & What You Get

$3500 - To hire Go Pro Floors to remodel our shop right now, we need it. They have graciously offered to complete the job and have us pay them when we are able!

$500 - To pursue legal action against the scumbag contractor that scammed us!

The Impact

We love our customers! We also love our employees! Once completed, our customers will get their coffees faster and our employees will have an easier time doing it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell your friends!
  • Come buy yourself (and/or your friends) a coffee. All the profit will be going towards this project until it is completed.

story:
PLEASE NOTE: Due to UK political funding rules, we can only receive your donation if you are on the UK Electoral Register.  If you aren't, we'll have to return your donation.


Summary

Hi! We're Cath Edwards, Peter Hawkins and Tom Keane. Together, we're the Green Party's first ever candidates both for general and local council elections in the constituencies of Telford and The Wrekin.

We believe this is a really exciting time for the Green Party, both at a local and a national level. We want to give the people of Telford and The Wrekin the opportunity to make their voices heard, and to show the main political parties that there's a better way to run the country.

Meet our candidates:

  • Cath is running as MP for The Wrekin and Councillor for Ironbridge Ward.
  • Peter is running as MP for Telford and Councillor for Church Aston and Lilleshall Ward.
  • Tom is running for Councillor for Madeley and Sutton Hill Ward.


What We Need & What You Get

While it's true that we've received a small amount of funding from the Green Party to cover our deposits, we need your help to be able to run a successful election campaign. Like all Green Party candidates, we receive no funding from big business, so we're dependent on donations from people who truly believe in our cause.

We need funding from you to be able to get leaflets printed so that our team of volunteers can deliver them to the wards in which we're standing. This may seem like a simple request but without them, we won't be able to get our message to the people of Telford. 

But what's in it for you? We can't offer any fabulous perks.  What we can offer you, though, is a commitment to changing things for the better. For example:

  • We will fight privatisation of the NHS and oppose further cutbacks to essential healthcare services in the region
  • We will push to renationalise the railways
  • We will address the threat of current levels of carbon emissions to the environment, including opposing fracking both in Telford and nationally
  • We will move to scrap zero-hour contracts and introduce a living wage for every working person
  • We will work to implement tighter regulation of the financial sector, and prevent the harm that austerity measures are having on the region and the nation's poorest people.
If you can identify with any of these points, you're the kind of person we need.

We're under no illusions: we've got a tough fight on our hands against the more established parties.  But, at the very least, we can start a conversation.  We can get the main parties to sit up and take notice of the issues that really matter to people.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to help financially. You can still help us out, though, by telling people about this page and our campaign on Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn.

Alternatively, if you'd like to get involved with volunteering to help with the campaign itself, please e-mail us at telfordgreenparty@hotmail.com


Thanks so much for your support: We really couldn't do it without you!

Cath, Peter and Tom.


PLEASE NOTE: Due to UK political funding rules, we can only receive your donation if you are on the UK Electoral Register.  If you aren't, we'll have to return your donation.

story:
Cyclone Pam struck Vanuatu on Friday, the 13th of March, 2015. It took more than 40 people's lives and destroyed thousands of houses. Leaving 50% of the country homeless. Without roofs over their heads or food in their stomaches.


' The mamas market was obliterated. Desperate shopkeepers went down to try to retrieve what they could from the wreckage.'

' Desperately trying to hold the roof down. He lost the corner of the building during the night, and was desperate not to lose the rest of it.'

' Shell-shocked in Mele village.'

' "We didn't think we were going to make it." '

According to UNICEF, 'around 82,000 children have been affected by Cyclone Pam' and '60% of the population of Shefa and Tafea provinces, Vanuatu, have been affected by the Cyclone and have no access to drinking water.'


' Teouma bridge is gone, blocking access to the most affected areas of Efate. An entire section was undermined by a flash flood.'

' Three year old Rachel helps her father Ken (background) as they clear away the debris. This house was washed away when a municipal water tank ruptured and collapsed, sending thousands of gallons of water down the hillside.'

' 'We used the last of our water today. We can get more from the neighbours, but their tank is almost empty too.'
'So what do you do after that,' I asked.
She just smiled shyly.'

' He put on his father's work gloves and went to work cleaning up.'

The aim of this campaign is to give support to those who desperately need them. 100% of the funds raised will be donated to the charities in the country who have a wider knowledge on those who requires support the most.

Vanuatu, the happiest place on  Earth, is in desperate need of your help. Please share this with your families and friends to help and make a difference. Thank you for your generosity. :)


Campaign Card Image Credit: Humans of Vanuatu Facebook page

Video Credit: BBC News

Photo Credit: Humans of Vanuatu Facebook page

Caption Credit: Humans of Vanuatu Facebook page

Humans of Vanuatu website: http://www.humansofvanuatu.com/

Humans of Vanuatu Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/HumansOfVanuatu?fref=ts

story:
Our Goal:

The purpose of the Rx Wine Bar Lab is to create the most engaging and unique wine experience in the heart of downtown Durham.  The plan is twofold.  First offer incredible wines with fun, knowledgeable service in a dynamic setting featuring as much recycled and reclaimed materials from Durham as possible. Terroir but for design!  The second is to provide an educational component in the form of wine classes taught by Fred Dex www.freddexms.com, the only Master Sommelier in the Carolinas.  These will not be sterile lectures; we have in mind exploratory adventures in the multi-faceted world of wine such as:

  • Rainbow Connection - An Exploration of Colors and Flavors
  • Get into the Groove - Music Pairings
  • The “New” New World
  • Six Wines You Never Heard of That Will Change Your Wine Drinking Forever

And with Fred’s unparalleled access to winemakers and importers there will be plenty of opportunity for guest speakers and exotic tastings.  Whether you’re a business looking to educate staff or a passionate wine lover looking to learn more, we will have classes to suit any experience level.  Let us teach you the secrets of the somms!

Our wine bar experience will be focused on the sale of wine and beer.  We plan to have a basic food menu consisting mostly of local cheese and cured meats.  The simplicity of our food will save us money on kitchen equipment and not put us in direct competition with other great restaurants with outstanding wine programs in the area.  We’re the place to start or end your night with a great drink and yummy snack.  Or heck, spend your whole evening with us if you want!

Our philosophy for the operation of the wine bar will be guided by three ideals: hospitality, excellence of product, and fun.

  • Hospitality: we are three sommeliers with over forty years combined service experience.  Our focus on intelligent hospitality offers a place for those of a distinguishing palate and those who just want to explore more of what the world of wine has to offer at all levels by feeling empowered to taste and learn.
  • Product: every wine, beer, and food item will be tasted and vetted by all three owners to ensure you enjoy the best we can offer.  Partnering with local bakeries and farms will allow us to serve the freshest and tastiest provisions the Triangle has to offer.  The focus of our wine list will be to offer the most comprehensive, affordable opportunities for wine enjoyment and education.
  • Fun: your trip to Rx (pronounced Rocks!) won’t be a stuffy or intimidating visit.  Our goal is to inject as much of our love of music, movies, and pop culture into the experience as possible.  From theme nights like Metal Monday to movie themed wine pairings, we want to bring the joy of wine to the people of Durham.

We will have focused and serious tastings in The Lab spanning nearly every country, region and variety we can get our hands on! 

Driver's seat view of our classes and tastings! 

At the end of the day we believe wine, from the finest Bordeaux to the most humble village offering, is a drink meant to be shared and enjoyed.

Who We Are:

Rx is the Latin reference for “to take” or “recipe,” and wine has been prescribed since the Hippocratic era as a remedy throughout history.  Our take on Rx is a great glass of wine as a prescription for relaxation and a protocol for fun here in the City of Medicine.  The genesis of our project came when we three sommeliers met working in Durham and saw the city’s passion for and enjoyment of wine.  We saw a way to give back to the community by providing the knowledge and experience needed to focus that passion into an elevated wine culture.  Three wine geeks, one singular obsession: to boldly go where Durham has never gone before.  

Fred Dex - One of only 200 Master Sommeliers in World and only MS in the Carolinas

  • Worked on management teams for James Beard Award Winning Restaurateurs Jean Georges Vongerichten, Chris Cannon & Danny Meyer 
  • National Wine Director for BLT Restaurant Group 2004 - 2009
  • Owner of Juiceman Consulting 2009 - Present
  • 2009 - Present Ambassador to Wines of Chile USA & Wines of Southwest France USA 2010 - Present 
  • USA Representative for Best Sommelier in the World 2007 
  • Opened and/or Consulted on more than 25 Restaurant / Bar Projects around the US 
  • 20 Years of Hospitality Management Experience around US 
  • Featured in the Top Media Outlets including NY Times, Wines and Spirits, Food and Wine, Food Arts, People, Cosmopolitan and more...
  • Public Speaker 
  • Cocktail Creator

Kory Lynn - Certified Sommlier 

  • Certified Sommelier through the Court of Master Sommeliers
  • 10 Years in the Hospitality Industry with a Focus on Wine and Beverage Management
  • Created and Collaborated on Multiple Wine Spectator Award Winning Restaurant Lists
  • Opened and Managed Wine Bars and Wine-Focused Restaurants Across the Country
  • Currently Pursuing the Advanced Sommelier Certification, as well as Certified Cicerone
  • Contemporary Seasonal Cocktail Specialist
  • Capital Investor

Tristan Pennell - Intro Sommelier 

  • North Carolina Native & UNC Graduate in English Literature
  • Tasting Room Manager at Benjamin Vineyards & Winery in Saxapahaw, NC for 5 years
  • Passed Court of Master Sommeliers Introductory Course 2014
  • Currently Pursuing Certified Sommelier
  • Capital Investor

What You’re Funding:

We have some seed money for fun pop-up events (follow us on Facebook www.facebook.com/RxWineLab and Twitter www.twitter.com/RxWineLab to learn more!) around the area.  But we need your help to take the next steps:

  • Secure a location!  There are lots of great spaces around the city we are looking at.  Step one is finding a forever home for our future wine adventures.
  • Buildout! Not every space is set up for a bar.  Depending on where we settle we may have to overhaul the plumbing and HVAC.
These photos are from the space we absolutely love! It's on Parrish & Church St. right in downtown Durham! This building was just purchased and being completely remodeled! Help us get THIS SPACE!!!

The frontage of the space. Big windows being put in with an inviting corner entrance!

Wide view of space. Very quaint street with view of church. There is a parking lot right across the street on right with abundant parking spaces! 

Beautiful exposed brick will be the backdrop of our bar!

The wall is being completely restored! 
  • Design! After we knock out the nitty gritty stuff we want to provide a distinctive space in which you can learn and imbibe! We will work with local craftspeople and artisans like Bull City Designs who are going to build our bar from reclaimed wood from a local business currently under renovation. 
  • Purchase necessary equipment including sinks, refrigeration units, keg taps, wine chillers, ice machine, dishwasher, and ice well
  • Construct tables, banquettes, and stools from reclaimed and recycled wood from Durham
  • Commission local artists to decorate our walls with innovative designs like maps of famous wine growing regions
  • Our first wine allocations!!!  We can’t wait to pour you some tasty juice!

Most importantly we see Indiegogo as a way for the citizens of Durham to invest in the project with us.  Your donation will allow us to move forward without the need for heavy outside investment or bank loans.  Such sources of capital will force us to focus more on the bottom line.  Rather than driving profits, we want to drive the unique experience that shapes Durham’s wine scene for years to come.

 Special Thanks to the following who've assisted us on this journey!  

American Underground http://americanunderground.com

Blue Coffee Café http://bluecoffeedurham.com

The Carrack Modern Art Gallery http://thecarrack.org

Magic Marely Marles  http://www.magicmarleymarles.com/home

Haw River Wine Man https://www.facebook.com/pages/Haw-River-Wine-Man

Proof Wine and Spirits http://www.proofwineandspirits.com

Bordeaux Fine and Rare http://www.bfrwine.com

Bull City Designs http://bullcitydesigns.com

Durham Convention & Visitors Bureau http://www.durham-nc.com

Shiftzen https://www.shiftzen.com

Art of Cool Project http://theartofcoolproject.com

Halley Kueffer 

And more to come...!!!

Note - If you are interested in backing this project beyond scope of rewards please contact fred@freddexms.com to discuss.

Thank you! 

Risks & Challenges

Unforeseen problems refitting or renovating plumbing, electrical systems or HVAC

Delays in permitting.  We don’t expect a Kafkaesque bureaucratic nightmare, but the sale and serving of alcohol can bring special challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share on our Facebook and Twitter pages to help us realize of dream of making Durham a better place to drink wine!
story_txt:
Our travels have taken us to exotic places and we've found some incredible wines we'd like to share with you!  Drink Very, Very, Very Old Vine Juice with Us! This vineyard in nearly 200 years old!

2009 - Present Ambassador to Wines of Chile USA & Wines of Southwest France USA 2010 - Present 
USA Representative for Best Sommelier in the World 2007 
Opened and/or Consulted on more than 25 Restaurant / Bar Projects around the US 
20 Years of Hospitality Management Experience around US 
Featured in the Top Media Outlets including NY Times, Wines and Spirits, Food and Wine, Food Arts, People, Cosmopolitan and more...
Public Speaker 
Cocktail Creator

Kory Lynn - Certified Sommlier 

Certified Sommelier through the Court of Master Sommeliers
10 Years in the Hospitality Industry with a Focus on Wine and Beverage Management
Created and Collaborated on Multiple Wine Spectator Award Winning Restaurant Lists
Opened and Managed Wine Bars and Wine-Focused Restaurants Across the Country
Currently Pursuing the Advanced Sommelier Certification, as well as Certified Cicerone
Contemporary Seasonal Cocktail Specialist
Capital Investor

Tristan Pennell - Intro Sommelier 

North Carolina Native & UNC Graduate in English Literature
Tasting Room Manager at Benjamin Vineyards & Winery in Saxapahaw, NC for 5 years
Passed Court of Master Sommeliers Introductory Course 2014
Currently Pursuing Certified Sommelier
Capital Investor


 Serious tasters!
What You’re Funding:
We have some seed money for fun pop-up events (follow us on Facebook www.facebook.com/RxWineLab and Twitter www.twitter.com/RxWineLab to learn more!) around the area.  But we need your help to take the next steps:

Secure a location!  There are lots of great spaces around the city we are looking at.  Step one is finding a forever home for our future wine adventures.
Buildout! Not every space is set up for a bar.  Depending on where we settle we may have to overhaul the plumbing and HVAC.

These photos are from the space we absolutely love! It's on Parrish & Church St. right in downtown Durham! This building was just purchased and being completely remodeled! Help us get THIS SPACE!!!

The frontage of the space. Big windows being put in with an inviting corner entrance!



Wide view of space. Very quaint street with view of church. There is a parking lot right across the street on right with abundant parking spaces! 
Beautiful exposed brick will be the backdrop of our bar!
The wall is being completely restored! 


Design! After we knock out the nitty gritty stuff we want to provide a distinctive space in which you can learn and imbibe! We will work with local craftspeople and artisans like Bull City Designs who are going to build our bar from reclaimed wood from a local business currently under renovation. 
Purchase necessary equipment including sinks, refrigeration units, keg taps, wine chillers, ice machine, dishwasher, and ice well
Construct tables, banquettes, and stools from reclaimed and recycled wood from Durham
Commission local artists to decorate our walls with innovative designs like maps of famous wine growing regions
Our first wine allocations!!!  We can’t wait to pour you some tasty juice!


 
Funding Breakdown
Most importantly we see Indiegogo as a way for the citizens of Durham to invest in the project with us.  Your donation will allow us to move forward without the need for heavy outside investment or bank loans.  Such sources of capital will force us to focus more on the bottom line.  Rather than driving profits, we want to drive the unique experience that shapes Durham’s wine scene for years to come.
 Durham artist L. Jamal Walton's take on the Sommurai!

 Cheers to y'all!
 Special Thanks to the following who've assisted us on this journey!  
American Underground http://americanunderground.com
Blue Coffee Café http://bluecoffeedurham.com
The Carrack Modern Art Gallery http://thecarrack.org
Magic Marely Marles  http://www.magicmarleymarles.com/home
Haw River Wine Man https://www.facebook.com/pages/Haw-River-Wine-Man
Proof Wine and Spirits http://www.proofwineandspirits.com
Bordeaux Fine and Rare http://www.bfrwine.com
Bull City Designs http://bullcitydesigns.com
Durham Convention & Visitors Bureau http://www.durham-nc.com
Shiftzen https://www.shiftzen.com
Art of Cool Project http://theartofcoolproject.com
Halley Kueffer 
And more to come...!!!
Note - If you are interested in backing this project beyond scope of rewards please contact fred@freddexms.com to discuss.
Thank you! 
  Risks & Challenges  
Unforeseen problems refitting or renovating plumbing, electrical systems or HVAC
Delays in permitting.  We don’t expect a Kafkaesque bureaucratic nightmare, but the sale and serving of alcohol can bring special challenges.   Other Ways You Can Help Share on our Facebook and Twitter pages to help us realize of dream of making Durham a better place to drink wine!

story:
We are raising money to help the local businesses in Nagaland, India. With the fast growing market of international companies coming in, the local businesses are starting to disappear off the map. We want to raise awareness through promotion, advertising and conferences to help the small local businesses survive through this extremely hard times and potentially expand internationally. We seek your support to help us with this cause! We will use the money to not only raise awareness but also to help sustain the businesses by offering them various courses teaching them international business strategies as well as ways they can market and promote themselves and their products. Support our cause! Thank you!

Nagaland is famous for their delicious but extremely spice Naga Spices! In the picture above you can see the famous Naga king chilies as well as wood worms for sale at the local market. 

                             

Locally made Nagaland decorations, make beautiful addition to your home!

Traditional Naga jewellery and clothes are all hand made by the local community.
