story:
Our Mission: 

Seattle SPACE holistically empowers single parents to meet, maintain and further enhance their familial goals for safety, support, stability and success by providing a continuum of individualized programs tailored to address their needs as they define them. 

Our Vision:

Seattle SPACE envisions every single parent and their family thriving in the areas of home, interpersonal relationships, community, employment, education, emotional well-being, physical health and spirituality. 

Seattle  SPACE  became officially recognized as a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization  in the summer of 2014. The idea for Seattle SPACE was conceived of and brought to fruition by single parent Founder & CEO, Chericka Ashmann, LICSW, MHP, CMHS, MSW. Through her work with children and families coupled with her own experience as a single parent who was also raised by her solo mom, she was able to identify a need for front-end services geared toward the unique needs of the single parent.  

During the recession Ms. Ashmann encountered a wide range of single parents who were victims of circumstance beyond their control such as a health crisis, loss of a job, death of a spouse/partner, discovery of special needs for their child, relocation, abuse, addiction or simply a lack of support and Ms. Ashmann was no different. Many of these parents began their journey as upper to middle class tax payers unable to access free community service programs due to falling just outside of income guidelines and wait lists. Unable to afford counseling services because they didn't meet sliding fee scale criteria many suffered in silence as their world began to crumble. Many, without previous social system experience, were not aware of public resources available to them which caused them to exhaust personal assets and or become victims of financial lending scams. Soon these parents found themselves in a downward spiral of financial and emotional crisis making it difficult to care for their children. In some cases, the stress these parents endured led to unintentional neglect or abuse and involvement with the state social service system. As the nation began to recover from the recession, single parents continue to struggle and remain at high risk for homelessness and unemployment. While in the trenches of single parenting herself, working with individuals just like herself, Ms. Ashmann saw a need for services unique to the single parent's plight with several preventative components in place as all of these scenarios can be prevented.

Whether parenting single by choice, following separation/divorce, death of a spouse/partner, deployment, or abandonment, no one can be "prepared" for the challenges of single parenting. Seattle SPACE welcomes ALL single parents and their families regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identification, income level, or whether primary custodial parent or not. 

Seattle SPACE founder and CEO, Chericka Ashmann, has a full-time job in addition to her work for Seattle SPACE and has provided free services since beginning work in 2013. Seattle SPACE currently has a wait list and Ms. Ashmann is ready to go FULL-TIME as the need is definitely there. Ms. Ashmann can no longer afford to pay out of pocket expenses for minimal operating costs such as office space, internet, phone, website fees, copy/fax/scanner and other misc. office supplies. She would also like to begin a yearly road running race as they are proven to be successful in growth and return. There are costs associated with this. Seattle SPACE hopes to far exceed our modest goal.  Your gift is supporting a great and much needed cause and is 100% tax deductible! Please share with your friends and challenge yourself to donate $10 or more for each single parent you know or have seen struggling and wanted to help. Thank you so much-please spread the word!

Donations can also be made securely through our webpage @ www.seattlespace.org and at The Seattle Foundation page: http://www.seattlefoundation.org/givingcenter/P...

story:
Our Story

Long Term Care Alternatives, Inc., was created by Nancy, Karen and Noreen in 2013 as they began their second careers as Licensed Masters of Social Work.   LTCA offers alternative solutions for the challenges of aging through education, counseling, research and referrals. We want to help our elders, friends and families construct an engaged, dignified, creative, and joyful third stage of life. Our mission is to serve as a resource and foster the values, principles, and practices of culture change: Dignity, Respect, Self Determination and Purposeful Living, for all who work and live in the continuum of Long Term Care.  Our long term goal is to create alternative housing that reflects these principles and ideals.

What We Need 

The first step to attain our ultimate goal of bringing the Green House Home concept to Long Island is a feasibility study.  The money we raise  will be used to consult with the Green House professionals to help conduct  the necessary studies to determine the facts and  figures needed to achieve our goals.  We will determine the market needs, assess our organization, plan our fundraising campaign and create the relationships that will help us move forward.

Why?

For the next 18 years, boomers will be turning 65 at a rate of about 8,000 a day. As this unique cohort grows older, it will likely transform the institutions of aging — just as it has done to other aspects of American life. Will boomers redefine this life stage, or will it redefine them? -AARP

LTCA wants to be a part of the transformation by providing affordable, alternative, housing that is based on the Green House philosophies of empowerment of  staff and real home for the elderly.

Nancy, Karen and Noreen created LTCA in response to the outrage we felt as we experienced working in the existing models of long term care. We are passionate about bringing the new model of culture change to long term care on Long Island, one that offers person-centered care and provides an environment for purposeful living.  We are committed to bringing Long Term Care Alternatives to the Baby Boom generation  that makes up the “Silver Tsunami” of aging.

This is beginning of an ambitious undertaking for funding our vision and goals.

Other Ways You Can Help...

  • Please share this with those  you know who will age and eventually die (like, everyone).

story:
Brewery Building our Beer Bottler

Black Warrior Brewing Company needs your help!  We need to raise money to build our own bottling line.  That's right, you heard us, we're going to build it ourselves!  Sure, we could just buy one, but where's the fun in that?  We're engineers & engineers build things, right?  Engineers built the pyramids while enjoying a beer, so we figure we can build a bottling line for our beer, right? Not only will be be able to save a lot of money, but we always enjoy a good challenge! 

Bringing Bottles to T-Town

Since starting our brewery in 2013, you've given us the love and support we needed to grow.  Thanks to you, Black Warrior beers are now available on draft all across the State of Alabama, but now we need your help to kick it up a notch & get it into bottles.

Why Bottles?

We want to bring our beers to more people in more places and the best way for us to do that is bottling.  We want to see our bottles on store shelves and in fridges all across the South, and what Gameday tailgate would be complete without a great locally brewed 6-pack!

So are you with us? Of course you are!


What We Need & What You Get

Our Bottler Budget

So here's how we plan to spend the money

  • Components required to build our Black Warrior Bottler
  • Purchase of an automatic labeler
  • Installation costs (plumbing, electrical, etc)
  • Graphic Design for labels, 6-pack carriers, etc
  • Initial order of empty bottles, labels & packaging
  • Marketing & promotion for the new bottles
  • Coffee... lots of coffee!

So thats cool, but whats in it for me?

What a great question, please check out all the amazing offers on the right.  For each level of donation we have picked out a special gift for you as our way of saying THANK YOU! These range from some of our great merchandise to once in a lifetime experiences right here at the brewery!

Beyond the Money

So you're not able to donate, but still want to help us out? You can help in several other ways too!  Spread the work about the Brewery and our bottling project on your favorite social media sites, re-post our progress updates, and of course, stop by for a pint (or three) and get an update on the progress.

 It's our fans' continued support and enthusiasm for Black Warrior that has gotten us this far, and it will be your continued support that gets us to this exciting next level!  We will never take our fans for granted, and couldn't do it without you.  We raise a bottle to you!

story:
Youth 2 Youth Summit 2015

We believe the only way we can understand and solve our world's problems is by coming together and starting a dialogue!

On April 16-19, Opportunities Development, a non-profit organization in Lithuania, will host a Youth to Youth Summit, bringing together 80 international students, youth activists, community leaders, entrepreneurs, professors, and businessmen to dialogue about global challenges of today and tomorrow and create actions on ways to solve those challenges.

The Summit features presentations by world renowned speakers, interactive workshops, and cultural performance. The topics of the Summit include:

  • Social Entrepreneurship as a Tool to Decrease Youth Unemployment
  • Youth as Ambassadors of Peace Education
  • Youth Role in Decision Making Process
  • Development Education/Education for All
  • Empowerment of Female Youth
  • Youth Diplomacy
The Summit is designed to be very practical! Specifically, participants will develop strategies for youth involvement in solving local and global challenges.

-----

Why We Need YOU | #SupportY2Y

Our goal is to raise $25,000 USD. This money will be used to fund travel, lodging, and registration costs for youth (18-35 years of age) who want to attend the Summit but do not have the financial means to do so.

-----

What You Get

All donors who #SupportY2Y and contribute $25 USD or more will be sent a digital thank you photo after the Summit concludes. You will see firsthand the youth you financially supported as well as the global challenges who helped solve. 

-----

Interested in Corporate Sponsorship?

If you are interested in sponsorship at a higher level, please contact us. By sponsoring the Y2Y Summit, your organization or company will enhance its profile and presence within the Lithuanian and world youth community, portray a concern for global challenges, and demonstrate your commitment to empowering youth to contribute to society.

story:
Who we are

Liveloula is an organically growing project with a focus on peaceful, ecological and self sustainable living.  We are connected with the Re-Green Eco Cultural centre in Seliana, planning to become their all bio vegies and fruits provider.

Our hope is to grow into a community of good neighbors, connected by some communal crossroads and bound by the wish to improve our way of living in a sustainable, low impact way.

Our strongest belief is that to change humanity's current crash course it's vital for a critical number of people to gear down, reconnect with our mother earth, rooting back into the matrix of abundance, in simplicity finding ways to support ourselves, and all life surrounding us.  No doubt the wheels of change are already turning as hundreds of alike groups and communities arise around the globe.    


We are located in the northern Peloponnese just outside the village Seliana. The valley where Liveloula is situated is rich in water, diverse in vegetation, it’s so beautiful.  For now, we are cultivating parts of a 1 hectare plot.  Two sides of this plot are bordered by forest and the other sides are (abandoned) orchards. For the community to further develop, Liveloula aims to grow in space to.  This we’d like to achieve by means of purchasing land partly to allow the return of wilderness, partly to restore old orchards, stimulating the biologic fruit production in this valley.

Liveloula is off grid.  Power is generated with photovoltaics and there are plans to build a hydro-electric system powered by a river nearby.  Our drinking water comes from a spring and irrigation water is tapped from a stream higher up in the forest. Last year the first natural building was finished and this year we’ll start building the second one.  
75% of the vegetables we ate last year were organic and grown locally. 



What We Need & What You Get

Many plans for the coming year!   First of all, Liveloula aims to become a non-profit organisation to support it’s activities.

Profits will be spent to support growth, local initiatives focusing on the preservation of nature, the production of low impact, quality foods and the information and sensibilisation of both the local community and visitors on the subject of low impact living, self sustainability, community networking and general health.


To achieve this income , Liveloula aims primarily at becoming the main vegetable supplier for our friends and neighbors at Re-Green.  Re-green hosts beautiful seminars and workshops for groups sometimes over 30 people.   Our dream is to provide quality organically grown food for groups this big and for ourselves.  Our all natural way of farming shuns mechanical devices, therefore farming becomes a fun and dynamic hands on experience for big groups of people.  Did we mention working the soil is healthy for body and mind?

Second, Liveloula will be offering a broad set of quality products ranging from home pharmacy to jewelry to homegrown organic foods.
So far, Liveloula has been privately funded, yet to make a good start, we are hoping for your support.   Small and bigger donations can be made to help us further install a good infrastructure.  With a better infrastructure we hope to be able to host more volunteers for a longer period of time or attract new residents, allowing Liveloula to make a bigger impact.

The first big installation planned is a water station that offers space for dish washing, clothes washing and personal washings.  The building techniques will be the same as the ones we used for our first building, a complete photo gallery of that process can be found at www.liveloula.org

Here's a picture of the floor plan.  The floor surface will be roughly 16 square meters.



We are aiming at a cost of approximately 5000 euros.  A brief summation of what this money will be spend on:

. roughly 400 on the stones for a foundation
. about 400 on construction sand, lime and marble sand
. at least 100 on straw bales
. around 2500 on FSC construction woods
. not more than 400 on roof tiles
. some 400 on windows and a door
. about 500 for a solar/ rocket stove water installation

Would you kindly help us reach our goal?

A big thank you in advance from Team Liveloula!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re interested to live and help at Liveloula, you can contact us by email. We’re always welcoming people to share some quality time and we can use all the hands we can get to make this next building project a great succes.

Please share this campaign via your social networks and help us spread our message.

The valley where Liveloula is situated is rich in water, diverse in vegetation, it’s so beautiful.  For now, we are cultivating parts of a 1 hectare plot.  Two sides of this plot are bordered by forest and the other sides are (abandoned) orchards. For the community to further develop, Liveloula aims to grow in space to.  This we’d like to achieve by means of purchasing land partly to allow the return of wilderness, partly to restore old orchards, stimulating the biologic fruit production in this valley.
Liveloula is off grid.  Power is generated with photovoltaics and there are plans to build a hydro-electric system powered by a river nearby.  Our drinking water comes from a spring and irrigation water is tapped from a stream higher up in the forest. Last year the first natural building was finished and this year we’ll start building the second one.  75% of the vegetables we ate last year were organic and grown locally. 



   What We Need & What You Get 
Many plans for the coming year!   First of all, Liveloula aims to become a non-profit organisation to support it’s activities.
Profits will be spent to support growth, local initiatives focusing on the preservation of nature, the production of low impact, quality foods and the information and sensibilisation of both the local community and visitors on the subject of low impact living, self sustainability, community networking and general health.


To achieve this income , Liveloula aims primarily at becoming the main vegetable supplier for our friends and neighbors at Re-Green.  Re-green hosts beautiful seminars and workshops for groups sometimes over 30 people.   Our dream is to provide quality organically grown food for groups this big and for ourselves.  Our all natural way of farming shuns mechanical devices, therefore farming becomes a fun and dynamic hands on experience for big groups of people.  Did we mention working the soil is healthy for body and mind?Second, Liveloula will be offering a broad set of quality products ranging from home pharmacy to jewelry to homegrown organic foods.So far, Liveloula has been privately funded, yet to make a good start, we are hoping for your support.   Small and bigger donations can be made to help us further install a good infrastructure.  With a better infrastructure we hope to be able to host more volunteers for a longer period of time or attract new residents, allowing Liveloula to make a bigger impact.
The first big installation planned is a water station that offers space for dish washing, clothes washing and personal washings.  The building techniques will be the same as the ones we used for our first building, a complete photo gallery of that process can be found at www.liveloula.org Here's a picture of the floor plan.  The floor surface will be roughly 16 square meters.

We are aiming at a cost of approximately 5000 euros.  A brief summation of what this money will be spend on:. roughly 400 on the stones for a foundation. about 400 on construction sand, lime and marble sand. at least 100 on straw bales. around 2500 on FSC construction woods. not more than 400 on roof tiles. some 400 on windows and a door. about 500 for a solar/ rocket stove water installation
Would you kindly help us reach our goal?A big thank you in advance from Team Liveloula!

    Other Ways You Can Help 
If you’re interested to live and help at Liveloula, you can contact us by email. We’re always welcoming people to share some quality time and we can use all the hands we can get to make this next building project a great succes.Please share this campaign via your social networks and help us spread our message.

story:
I have bought the domain, and hosting for an online dating site, geared toward people who are in recovery from substance abuse. I have over-come active addiction through going to 12 step meetings. At these, I have come to know plenty of great people, who are single, and lonely. It is hard for people with drug/alcohol free lifestyles to find companions who are similar minded. Sober people do not go to bars, and it is suggested to not date within your 12 step group. So with that, the dating field is narrow, and in the event of a co-worker or church friend becoming a potential date, the odds of them being understanding of the lifestyle, and abstinent themselves are even lower.

What I am raising the funds for is the actual website itself and admin fees I will be charged. The amount above, will cover everything I still need. I do have a partner to help with source code and back-end programming.

Thanks for reading, and hopefully contributing to this campaign. I just want all of my friends to be happy and with someone who makes them happy. Let's make this happen! :)

story:
hello!

If you don't know me already, my name is Christi, and Scraps is my new business (yay!). Scraps embodies some key things that define my life:

  • sustainability
  • bicycles
  • scrappiness!

Here's a bit more about where Scraps came from, taken from the new Scraps website:

​"Why can't I compost here?" That's the frustration that started this. I was living in a condominium, and that meant I couldn't do anything with my food scraps but throw them in the trash. That's because Denver's compost collection program doesn't extend to multi-family buildings, meaning that none of the condominiums and apartment buildings in Denver with more than seven units - and they are popping up everywhere - are able to compost. 


Somehow I convinced my boyfriend to let me collect our food scraps under the sink anyhow (in a nice compost pail, of course). Then, every so often, I'd tie the full bucket up tight in a thick plastic bag and gingerly transport it across town (in a nice car that didn't belong to me - you can see how untenable this is) to my friend's house, where he could compost in his backyard. Obviously that wasn't a stellar long-term solution. And maybe I sometimes "waited too long" to transport the food scraps... Let's just say the BF and I are now just friends.

The long-term solution: an "ah-ha" moment in which I decided to solve my own problem, followed by many months of consternation, research, excitement, fear, and finally - Scraps!

Several things you might be interested to know:

  • I love bicycles and all things pedal-powered. My bicycle has a name.
  • I cannot stand waste, or wastefulness, or thoughtless consumerism.
  • I am a minimalist with a tiny house obsession.
  • I've worked in sustainability and sustainable community development throughout my career.
  • I lived nearly seven years in Madagascar, and was inspired by, among other things, the incredible ingenuity (and scrappiness!) of my community.
  • I'm a writer, photographer & filmmaker. I believe in the power of media for social change.
  • I am constantly inspired to do more with less & firmly believe that less is more. 
  • I love Denver. I care deeply about its sustainable urban development, and want to be a (small) part of that.

This is the foundation upon which Scraps rests. I hope you'll join me in keeping more compostables out of our landfill and turning them them back into something useful!

 

how Scraps works.

Scraps is a new company with a new concept for the Mile High City: food scraps pick-up for multi-tenant buildings. On bikes!

Scraps is scrappy. We're a low-carbon, bicycle-based, flexible & local solution, tailored to multi-family housing. We use locally manufactured “bicycle vehicles” to pick up food scraps from multi-tenant building customers and transport the food scraps to collection points - large compost dumpsters - that are already part of existing commercial compost pick-up routes, simply adding to the load that trucks already haul out to the regional compost processing facility. (This is possible thanks to the collaboration of Alpine Waste and some of their commercial compost customers, who understand our passion - THANK YOU!)

We’ll provide everything a building and its tenants need to keep their food scraps & other compostable items out of the landfill: countertop bins, compostable baggies, large bins for on-site collection, large compostable bin liners, and a regularly scheduled bicycle pick-up to haul away the collected food scraps. And we’ll do it with no mess, no trucks & a completely personalized service. (The bags and bins are being provided free of charge by BioBag for the initial phase of this endeavor - THANK YOU!)

We'll even do this for other customers - small restaurants, for example - and we're already gearing up to do some zero-waste events and festivals. But our main focus is to provide a compostables pick-up solution to multi-family buildings. 

We're also creating a "Scraps Rewards" program, in which Scraps customers can use their membership cards for discounts and freebies at local businesses. It's one of the ways we're trying to give folks for whom composting isn't a natural "YES" more and more reasons to sign up - like free beers at the local tap room, discounted tickets to the game, free drip coffee at the local cafe, etc.


the challenges.

There's a reason traditional waste haulers don't service multi-family buildings: it's hard! That's due to a whole host of reasons that Scraps is designed to solve - like where to put compost bins, how to price a service that customers will invest in, how to keep costs low, how to get in and out of tight spaces in big multi-family buildings, how to make the idea and the act of saving compostable material more palatable to more people, etc.

 

how you can help.

To get up and pedaling strong, Scraps needs your support. We'll use it:

  • to purchase two new bicycles - also called "pedal-trikes," "pedal-trucks" or "bicycle-vehicles" - for Scraps
  • to defray the costs of renting a garage/office space for Scraps
  • to purchase 50 new 23-gallon bins, for on-site food scraps storage
  • to purchase several cases of bin liners for the bins
  • to purchase other equipment, such as heavy-duty scales, for each Scraps pedal-truck
  • to defray the cost of online marketing & software needs (e.g., web hosting, pay portal)
  • to purchase marketing materials such as business cards, stickers, decals, flyers & signs

...and more!
 

Scraps will make an impact!

Our bike-powered compost collection model is one of very few in the U.S., and the only one we know of that is focusing on serving multi-family buildings. With your support, and the support of our partners and collaborators, you can help us create a model that works our Mile High City, and that can be shared with other dense urban areas across the country! Plus:

  • You'll help Denver reduce the amount of compostable waste it sends to the landfill - which is more than most other cities in the U.S.
  • You'll help Denver reach its 2020 Sustainability Goal of diverting more waste from the landfill.
  • You'll support low-carbon, bicycle-based businesses in a growing, car-congested city.
  • You'll support a local, woman-owned business working with a local manufacturer and other local partners.
  • You'll help close the loop on food waste, and help turn food back into soil instead of sending it to the landfill forever.
  • You'll support small-scale, cross-sector innovations in response to some of our greatest urban sustainability challenges.

 

    we couldn't do this alone.

    To make Scraps work, we count on support or collaboration from businesses like:

    • Main Street Pedicabs
    • Alpine Waste
    • BioBag

    ...and more!

    And we're also working to grow a business that can provide support to our favorite non-profits (and friends!) here in Denver:

    • Denver Food Rescue
    • BikeDenver
    • Transit Alliance

    We're also grateful for the advice and support of groups  and people like:

    • the Denver Office of Sustainability
    • the Colorado Association for Recycling
    • Denver Recycles
    • EcoCycle
    • CompostNow
    • Compel

    ...and so many others! We hope we can count on your support, too!

     

    other ways you can help.

    There are so many other ways you can help us get up and pedaling, even if you aren't able to contribute financially! Some ways to get involved:

    • Follow us on Instagram!
    • Check us out on Facebook!
    • Use the sharing buttons here on this Indiegogo campaign!
    • Sign up for our mailing list!
    • Tell your friends!

    We can't thank you enough for your support!

story:
OUR STORY

Hive to Hearth started in late fall 2012 when a small group of wild honeybees made their hive in the eaves about the bay window of my home.  They didn't survive and the hive was removed.  After spending the winter doing research on raising bees, and the best type of hive, the apiary was started with the building of a top bar beehive.  The bees were ordered from a local bee farm and released into the new hive.  Since then the apiary has taken off slowly, but it is growing on 12 acres in central Texas.  January 2015 our story changed.  January 14, 2015 my wife had an ultrasound-assisted biopsy preformed on her right breast.  This was just a day before our 11th wedding anniversary.   She was diagnosed with invasive ductal carcinoma on January 19, 2015.  Although we are through with treatment, we have changed what and how we eat.  One thing that we noticed was the lack of quality vegetables in the market at a reasonable price, and the not knowing where or how the fish that we ate was grown.  Because of this I have started an aquaponics system on my patio, and have enjoyed good success with the lettuce and other leafy greens that are growing in it.

OUR Mission

Hive to Hearth is looking to set-up our 12-acre farm to provide organically and sustainably grown fruits and vegetables to offer to the local communities in central Texas. I believe that to be healthy you have to eat healthy.  To do this means to dedicate ourselves in growing organically in greenhouses with aquaponics systems.  Our goal is to get at least one greenhouse setup on the farm to start up the larger aquaponics systems with the hope of having two full time running greenhouses producing fish, vegetables and fruit for the local markets.  A third one will be used to give to the local soup kitchens and food pantries, as everyone should be able to eat healthy.

Why we need you

Your help will allow us to see this dream come true: to be able to help the folks in the communities eat healthy and be healthy.  You donations and support will allow us to purchase the greenhouse and the various materials needed to set up the aquaponics systems and grow the fish, fruits and vegetables.

Breakdown of the funding:

Greenhouse: 50%

Tanks: 15%

Grow beds: 10%

Pumps: 10%

Piping: 5%

Miscellaneous (lumber/building supplies, fish, seeds):  10%

Other ways you can help

Beyond giving, you can help by getting the word out.  Let your friends and family know about our farm and our goals.

Share this page

Follow us on Facebook and Google+

Visit our website www.hivetohearth.com

story:
For close to a decade, Chef Dorisa Jenea has been delighting diners in Los Angeles and Dallas through her prepared meal service, DONE AND DINE and her CRAVE EATS + HAPPENINGS catered events. She continues pursuing her passion of delivering unparalleled culinary experiences to the public with a new concept in cuisine, THE TABLE five22.  Whether it be the Dallas Cowboys Coaching Staff, the individuals who receive her delicious creations at their doorstep, or those who have experienced her creative and expert approach to their events, wherever there is exceptional, high quality and creative dishes, there is a wide customer base and opportunity.  With THE TABLE five22 , Chef Dorisa Jenea’s popularity will only increase and now is your chance to be a part of it. Donate today to receive one of our unique and one-of-kind perks and help to bring the vision of THE TABLE five22 to life.  

THE TABLE five22, located in Carrollton, Texas’ revitalized downtown area will serve as a storefront for DONE & DINE and CRAVE EVENTS + HAPPENINGS and also as a unique and intimate dining destination for pop-up dinner parties, corporate and entertainment events.  Donate today to bring the truly original, high quality, fresh and fantastic personal gourmet experiences of Chef Dorisa Jenea to an ever expanding variety of diners. Your contribution will aid in the finish out of the storefront and get the door open of this chic, boutique destination centered of course around good food.

story:
Who are we:

Bycatch Brewery is operated by Bradley Craig and Dano Ferons. Now you are probably wondering, “What is Bycatch?” Bycatch is a term used in commercial fishing that refers to the unwanted fish and other marine organism accidentally captured by fishermen targeting other species. Brad and Dano both received their master’s degrees in Coastal Marine and Wetland Studies from Coastal Carolina University. While studying at CCU Brad and Dano began brewing beer together.

 Brad is a mountain man from Tennessee. He and his wife Miranda moved to the Grand Strand so that Brad could get his master’s degree in marine geology. However, the rugged mountain lifestyle never left him. It is made evident by his groomed facial hair and quiet demeanor.

Dano is from California and moved to the Grand Strand to study mercury in fish. He surfs, dives, fishes, and can talk for hours on end. With an easy laugh and hard work ethic he never stops moving and working but if you pull up for a pint he will be there with a smile.

This campaign has been set up to help fund the brewery as well as garner interest in local brewing within South Carolina. By donating to this brewery you will help to establish the first brewery in Conway, South Carolina. Conway is a historic town built along the Waccamaw River inland of Myrtle Beach and the Grand Strand. The addition of a brewery to this town will help to establish a center to gather the community.

What we need:

We need your help to begin purchasing our equipment. We will use the funds to purchase a 3.5 BBL brewhouse from Systech Stainless Works. This brewhouse will include our mash/lauter tun, boil kettle, hot lauter tun, cold liquor tank, pumps, and hoses. Additionally, we will be using the funds to purchase our fermenters, bright tanks, and kegs. Everything we need to brew delicious beer and serve it to you.

If we do not reach our funding goal we will be using the funds to purchase as much of our brewing equipment as possible.

What you get:

Help Us and then Rep Us - $15 #:Infinite

Since you are helping us start our brewery we think you deserve two stickers. These stickers can be placed anywhere and are made from durable material. You can put it on your car, bike, trike, skateboard, backpack, canoe, tackle box, fishing rod, refrigerator, friend’s car, or even on someone’s hair, although we do not recommend the last one. Additionally, your name will be placed on our wall

Your Name on OUR Wall - $20 #:Infinite

We have a building. The building has walls. Walls need art. Therefore, why not decorate our walls with artwork that uses your name as part of the design. This way your name will be forever ingrained as part of our brewery and when people come to the taproom they will see you.

Drink one here, Drink one there - $30 #:Infinite

You like beer and we like beer. Why not put some beer in one of your very own Bycatch Brewery pint glass. Along with the pint glass you will get two of our place anywhere stickers as well as have your name helping to decorate our wall.

T-Shirt for one - $40 #:Infinite

This is our custom, screen-printed shirt. These shirts are a cotton and polyester blend that are beyond comfortable. Perfect for fishing on the water, playing wiffle ball in the yard, or cruising around town. Besides the shirt you will be receiving your name written on our wall.

Two is better than One - $60 #:Infinite

Getting two is better than one but what if the two was actually five. Show everyone that you helped to build Bycatch Brewery. Here you will receive a t-shirt, pint glass, two stickers, your name on our wall, and a one of a kind handwritten thank you note in our terrible handwriting.

Dawn Patrol - $50 #:Infinite – Only available for the first week

We want to thank you for being earlier to throw your support behind Bycatch Brewery. Therefore, we believe you deserve something extra. This is the same package as “Two is better than One” but for a reduced price to show how much we appreciate your contribution. You will receive a t-shirt, pint glass, two stickers, your name on our wall, and a one of a kind handwritten thank you note.

Sweatshirt - $100 #:Infinite

As surprising as it sounds it does get cold outside. Depending on where you live “cold” could be below freezing or close to 75 ˚F. Luckily we have you covered. What could be better than supporting a Bycatch Brewery and receiving a nice warm sweatshirt for your effort?

Catch and Keep - $150 #:Infinite

 Want a sweatshirt? It’s YOURS. Want a t-shirt? It’s YOURS. How about a pint glass? YOURS TOO. Two stickers? Why not, they’re YOURS. We will even place your name on our wall as well as send you a thank you note showing our appreciation.

Tackle Box - $200 #:Infinite

Everything you need for a day’s trip fishing you keep in your trusted tackle box. Just like everything you need comes in this Tackle Box. You will receive a __ oz growler, sweatshirt, t-shirt, pint glass, two stickers, your name on our wall, and a thank you in nearly legible handwriting.

Not so secret spot - $500 #:___ - Depends on number of bar stools

All fishers have a secret spot that only they know about. You know the one I am talking about. It’s next to the tenth pier piling on the south side of that one pier. Well unlike that secret spot this one is not so secret because your name is going to be emblazoned on one of our bar stools. Additionally, you will have your own “Tackle Box” to go with it.

 Conodont Club - $1,000 #: 20

By donating to the Conodont Club you will receive your own, custom made, ceramic mug. This will be hung on the wall of our taproom and only taken down when you walk in for a pint. Additionally, you will have early access to all our seasonal and special beers as well as your own Tackle Box to go with it.

Captain for a Day - $5,000 #: 5

Everyone wants to run a ship for a day. Just imagine sailing the sea with no care in the world because after today the ship belongs to someone else. Here you get to come in and brew your own seasonal beer that we will sell in house. Not only that but you will be joining the Conodont Club as well as your very own Tackle Box. Contact us for more information

King Fisher - $50,000 #: 1

You are a king catching everything you see. This package hangs your name and a stoic picture of you over the bar.  Also, you receive membership to Conodont Club, design and brew three batches of beer that are sold as seasonals as well as the Tackle Box. Lastly, you will be able to name Dano’s brew dog. That’s right, you get to name his brew dog that will spend everyday at the brewery. Contact us for more information

Risks & Challenges

We here at Bycatch know that any endeavor comes with risks and challenges, just like every time you go out in to marsh.  Planning ahead may keep you out of the pluff mud and double checking that your equipment is in working order is a must. As scientists, we have learned that Murphy’s Law rarely overcomes good planning. Years of research experience have taught us that when we do something wrong, we can look at what we did and make adjustments without being too headstrong. Thanks to years our professional backgrounds in the field, classroom, and lab, we know how to stop, breathe, and then attack the issue head on with a well thought-out plan to fix what ever comes our way.  Some of the risks we face here in coastal South Carolina are competing with larger beer companies and other regional brewers. We hope to make a name for ourselves in this competitive market by having a unique branding and loyal customer base who value delicious craft beer, as well as our coastal environment. Using great marketing and even better beer, we will provide the beer that our locals and tourist want to drink while enjoying the wonderful beaches, fishing, surfing, and any of the numerous activities that are available near Conway, SC. 

Other Ways To Help

There are many ways you can help our campaign grow besides contributions.

You can:

·  Tell friends and family

·  Share our posts on social media

·  Share your enthusiasm with us as we go through this process
story_txt:
Who are we:

Bycatch Brewery is
operated by Bradley Craig and Dano Ferons. Now you are probably wondering,
“What is Bycatch?” Bycatch is a term used in commercial fishing that refers to
the unwanted fish and other marine organism accidentally captured by fishermen
targeting other species. Brad and Dano both received their master’s degrees in
Coastal Marine and Wetland Studies from Coastal Carolina University. While
studying at CCU Brad and Dano began brewing beer together. 
 Brad is a mountain man from Tennessee. He and
his wife Miranda moved to the Grand Strand so that Brad could get his master’s
degree in marine geology. However, the rugged mountain lifestyle never left
him. It is made evident by his groomed facial hair and quiet demeanor.
Dano is from
California and moved to the Grand Strand to study mercury in fish. He surfs,
dives, fishes, and can talk for hours on end. With an easy laugh and hard work
ethic he never stops moving and working but if you pull up for a pint he will
be there with a smile.
This campaign
has been set up to help fund the brewery as well as garner interest in local
brewing within South Carolina. By donating to this brewery you will help to establish
the first brewery in Conway, South Carolina. Conway is a historic town built
along the Waccamaw River inland of Myrtle Beach and the Grand Strand. The
addition of a brewery to this town will help to establish a center to gather
the community. 

What we need:
We need your
help to begin purchasing our equipment. We will use the funds to purchase a 3.5
BBL brewhouse from Systech Stainless Works. This brewhouse will include our
mash/lauter tun, boil kettle, hot lauter tun, cold liquor tank, pumps, and hoses.
Additionally, we will be using the funds to purchase our fermenters, bright
tanks, and kegs. Everything we need to brew delicious beer and serve it to you.
If we do not
reach our funding goal we will be using the funds to purchase as much of our
brewing equipment as possible. 
What you get:
Help Us and then
Rep Us - $15 #:Infinite
Since you are
helping us start our brewery we think you deserve two stickers. These stickers
can be placed anywhere and are made from durable material. You can put it on
your car, bike, trike, skateboard, backpack, canoe, tackle box, fishing rod,
refrigerator, friend’s car, or even on someone’s hair, although we do not
recommend the last one. Additionally, your name will be placed on our wall
Your Name on OUR
Wall - $20 #:Infinite
We have a
building. The building has walls. Walls need art. Therefore, why not decorate
our walls with artwork that uses your name as part of the design. This way your
name will be forever ingrained as part of our brewery and when people come to
the taproom they will see you.
Drink one here,
Drink one there - $30 #:Infinite
You like beer
and we like beer. Why not put some beer in one of your very own Bycatch Brewery
pint glass. Along with the pint glass you will get two of our place anywhere stickers
as well as have your name helping to decorate our wall.
T-Shirt for one
- $40 #:Infinite
This is our
custom, screen-printed shirt. These shirts are a cotton and polyester blend
that are beyond comfortable. Perfect for fishing on the water, playing wiffle
ball in the yard, or cruising around town. Besides the shirt you will be
receiving your name written on our wall.
Two is better
than One - $60 #:Infinite
Getting two is
better than one but what if the two was actually five. Show everyone that you
helped to build Bycatch Brewery. Here you will receive a t-shirt, pint glass,
two stickers, your name on our wall, and a one of a kind handwritten thank you
note in our terrible handwriting. 
Dawn Patrol -
$50 #:Infinite – Only available for the first week
We want to thank
you for being earlier to throw your support behind Bycatch Brewery. Therefore,
we believe you deserve something extra. This is the same package as “Two is
better than One” but for a reduced price to show how much we appreciate your contribution.
You will receive a t-shirt, pint glass, two stickers, your name on our wall,
and a one of a kind handwritten thank you note.

it sounds it does get cold outside. Depending on where you live “cold” could be
below freezing or close to 75 ˚F. Luckily we have you covered. What could be
better than supporting a Bycatch Brewery and receiving a nice warm sweatshirt
for your effort?

YOURS. We will even place your name on our wall as well as send you a thank you
note showing our appreciation.
Tackle Box -

story:
The Problem

There is no readily accessible repository for inventions and other products that can directly improve the well-being and standard of living for inhabitants in poverty, disaster or emergency stricken locations, whether in developing or developed nations. 

 

Our Goal

InventionsForHumanity.org (IFH) currently connects individual donors and non-profit organizations to a database of inventions and other products which is curated solely for their practical social benefits.

These products may be ordered and shipped to individuals and communities in need via IFH website links.

Below are some examples of the products on the site, which are also perks for this campaign:

Products are selected based upon the five criteria below: 

  1. Beneficial to individuals and communities 
  2. Suitable for use in developing and developed nations 
  3. Low relative cost 
  4. Ease of setup and use and 
  5. Low maintenance

 

How does the IFH site work?

Below is an infographic showing how the site works.

The products are organized by categories, for example; food and nutrition, shelter, sanitation, etc., with direct links to product vendors that fulfill donor orders.

With your contributions, we will be able to take further steps towards helping individuals and communities.  We are developing a system which will also allow donors to have these products sent directly to specific geographic areas that are in need.

 

Example of our Potential Impact

Inventions like the LifeStraw water filter can help individuals in communities that lack access to clean drinking water.

Who are the recipients of the products?

Recipients are individuals and communities who receive the inventions and other IFH products purchased by individual donors and non-profit organizations. Non-profit organizations may include NGOs (non-governmental organizations), and social entrepreneurs and other nonprofit intermediaries. 

 

Who are we?

The idea for IFH originated from an individual’s initial involvement in non-profit volunteerism and his interest in unique inventions and practical products. An entrepreneur at heart, he realized the potential of using internet exposure to provide universal knowledge of, and access to, inventions and other products which could benefit large numbers of individuals and communities.

 

Where do IFH's funds go?

Donations, contributions, and revenue received are used to pay for operational costs listed below. Any excess after paying expenses is considered 'surplus' which is reallocated to support our mission.

 

IFH Operational Costs

These are the cost centers which we hope to fund during our first full year of operation after this campaign. 

  • Outreach and Partner development
  • Organizational Marketing, Web and Public Relations
  • Product sourcing
  • General & Administration 

 

To what locations do we ship Products?

Currently, to any location which is serviced locally by Amazon, and the product suppliers and manufacturers listed on IFH.

Long Term Vision

We want to connect all the stakeholders in the supply chain to get  products to individuals and communities in areas of need.

Below is a pictorial view of our vision of a possible seamless connection across all stakeholders:

We want to make the "giving and receiving" process transparent….to connect donors directly to practical inventions and other products that they can “safely and securely” send to individuals and communities in specific geographical areas, first in the US, and then around the world.

We are reaching out to the crowdfunding community for help, ideas and fundraising,… whether a perk, a direct donation, a good idea, or a strategic partnership.

Thank you for your support!

story:
Hi everyone, 
My Name is Tom & I'm a small business owner that's been Selling for a good few years now. I've built up a stable customer fan base, selling an array of products from jewellery, keepsake cake toppers, Notebooks; art prints just to name a few things. 


The business is run by just me myself and I in my Essex based studio.

What's happened 

I recently Have become aware of a massive issue with my existing laser machine, 
Which is the "The Heart of my work" its failing it's coming to the end of its life and I'm simply being strangled and limited to the amount of work I can do,

before long with Festive season to think about "I know but as a small business you have to think ahead" But (without it I can't run my beloved business and to continue to make an income or generate new custom or make new products.

The machine is basically on its last legs & its what provides my wonderful customers with the work they Send my way.

Along with this i have Huge restrictions with bed size; I literally have to turn away work because I only have enough room to make not so bigger projects. 

In return for all your help and going forward 

I'm offering perks for all of you in return for your generosity; I wouldn't ever expect anyone to give something without getting at least something back in return no matter how small it maybe.

So you see without my machine, I basically have nothing and no income at all. 
without your help and support, 
From friends, customers & family your contributions will enable me to put a deposit on a newer better machine,
better software more room for more design ideas & the ability to generate an income without the worry of it coming to an abrupt halt. 

The cost for my new or ex demo machine is between £8000-10000 so any help will enable me to put a deposit down on another or sort out some form of monthly payment plan. I've already raised a bit of money myself but it's no where near what I will need.

 

if I don't make my goal: 

If my goal isn't reached then what ever money is raised, shall go towards much needed expenses to help towards refurbishing my existing machine.


I understand how tough times are for many and that you mightn't be able to help, but what I will be eternally thankful for is if you could help share this donation page to help spread the word.

So without my customers and the work they bring to me I wouldn't be here today, it's because of all of you my friends, family and my customers that I am able to do what I love and enjoy for all of you every day.

Thank you & I hope you can help in any way you can. 

Many thanks 

Tom

story:
Our goal is to build a successful commercial cultivation facility and create a recognizable brand in a rapidly growing industry. High Tides is a new company with a goal of bringing seed to sale quality into the cannabis cultivation market, starting with one greenhouse in California. This is where you come in.

First you may ask, what is seed to sale. That means from the first sprout until finished product there is an unbroken chain of care. Everything is grown by us, harvested, cured, produced and sold in such a way that we can guarantee you are getting the best possible product. By maintaining  high standards through each of our steps we can promise that every dose is the highest consistent quality. 

Many large groups are buying up land for mass production.  When this happens quality and attention to detail get sacrificed in pursuit of quantity.  This also means that the resulting crop is inconsistent which in turn means an inferior product

Our passion is to create potent, consistent product. To do this we will open a greenhouse and grow in  controlled hydroponic and organic conditions.

The passage of initiatives in California, Nevada, Massachusetts, Maine, Florida, Arkansas, Montana, and North Dakota will add $7.4 billion to the 2020 market forecast bringing the overall market projection for legal adult-use and medical sales in the U.S. to $22.8 billion by 2020. 

We believe that the people spending that money into our industry should never receive substandard product, in whatever form they choose to use it. Which is why what we are doing is so important. By starting at seed, growing, producing and selling ourselves we can guarantee every aspect of the product's quality.

 

What We Need & What You Get

So where will your money go? We are asking for $20,000 to begin our grow. Our goal is to launch our operation in January of 2018 and to be providing product in the early spring of 2018.

We have grow land and an experienced grower with a specialty in in organic hydroponics. We have a production space and a certified pastry chef to whip up amazing edibles.

What we need: Water tanks, greenhouse materials, plants, licensing, solar kit, water and a humble homestead (travel trailer) for our grower.

In return for your support we offer awesome and unique swag as well as coupons for those in state for free product!

 

The Impact

The Impact Our hope is to provide people with quality product while setting a standard within the industry that proves that seed to sale is viable and better for customers.

Risks & Challenges

Given the federal view on cannabis, working in this field comes with inherent risks. However, we are following state and local guidelines to the letter. We are open and honest about our growing processes with the intent to sell the product as opposed to executing a co-op grow. All of our products will be grown, produced and sold according to state and local cannabis guidelines. Thank you so much for reading through the details of our business and for considering an investment in making High Tides a reality! We hope you will agree that we have a clear vision that's complimented by a sound business plan that's worthy of your support.

 

 

Given the federal view on cannabis it is a risky field to be in. However we are following state and local guidelines to the letter. We are open and honest about our growing processes with the intent to sell the product as opposed to a co-op grow.

All of our products will be grown , produced and sold according to state and local cannabis guidelines.

Thank you so much for reading through and considering helping us make High Tides a reality! 

We hope you will agree that we have a clear vision that's complimented by a sound business plan that's worthy of your support.

We fully understand that time are hard and we don't always have the money we wish we could to fund people's dreams. 

We encourage you to share, talk to your friends or send this along to anyone else who may be interested. Everything helps and we are grateful to you for helping us get the word out!

story:
Why a worker-owned brewery?

Did you know worker-owned businesses are more productive than normal businesses?

  • Create good jobs with livable wages where employees are making the decisions about what affects them most.
  • As neighborhoods and businesses in Boston become increasingly taken over by corporate landowners and businesses, we need more small businesses that will counter the effects of gentrification.
  • Beer brings people together!  By providing a community space and worker-center, Democracy Brewing is honoring the age-old tradition of building movements over beer.
  • Quality beer (need we say more?).

Become a part of history and help make Democracy Brewing a reality.

Join the Fermentation Rebellion

We currently are working with several mission-based investors and lenders that will help fulfill the capital to launch this project, but to do it right, this process takes time. To continue building on this exciting momentum, we need $30,000 to take the next necessary steps to making Democracy Brewing happen:

  • Ensuring we find the perfect location for both brewing and building community
  • Legal fees associated with opening a brewery in Massachusetts

  • Keep the momentum going as we build up our funding portfolio

As an early supporter, we are excited to offer a variety of perks:

  • Awesome Democracy Brewing schwag to spread the word and to show off to your friends

  • Opportunities to hang out with the Democracy Brewing team

  • Beer. Really good beer.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? We bet you know people who can! Please help us by spreading the word and using the Indiegogo share tools!

Learn more about Worker Owned Cooperatives

Below you'll find more information about Worker Owned Cooperatives, as borrowed from the United States Federation of Worker Cooperatives:

Worker cooperatives are business entities that are owned and controlled by their members, the people who work in them.

Benefits
Cooperatives are the only form of business centered around membership, and member and community benefit is at the core of the cooperative model. Worker cooperative businesses are owned and run by their members, the people who work in them, and they operate for the benefit of these members.

The member benefits are multiple. A cooperative can be a way for people to start and own a small business together when they may lack the means or expertise to do so alone. Worker cooperative members can build assets in their cooperative business by retaining surplus every year in individual capital accounts. In a worker cooperative, workers own their jobs, so they decide how they are treated and how they want to operate the business. Worker-owners also get a lot of practice making decisions, building their skills in a variety of areas, and participating democratically in a process to benefit the larger group. These are the skills and habits of engaged community members, and they don’t stop at the workplace: you will often find worker-owners involved in the community in other ways.

Community benefits are clear too. Successful worker cooperatives tend to create long-term stable jobs, enact sustainable business practices, and develop linkages among different parts of the social economy. Worker-owned businesses have not only a direct stake in the local environment but the power to decide to do business in a way that is sustainable for us all. The worker cooperative movement is increasingly recognized as part of the larger movement for sustainability and a new economy based on people’s needs.

Cooperatives have a long history as a way for working people to create good, dignified jobs that they control, particularly for people who lack access to business ownership or even stable work options.  Organizations undertaking economic development to build wealth in poor communities and communities of color have used worker cooperatives as a powerful vehicle for addressing economic inequality. Worker cooperatives have been shown to provide better working conditions and wages for typically low-wage work, and to increase household wealth for low-income workers. Worker cooperatives can also play an important role in building movements for economic justice and social change. As institutions where real democracy is practiced on a day to day basis, they are a model for the empowerment we will need to create the change we envision. As economic engines, they meet material needs, anchoring capital and jobs in communities.

Values
Co-operatives are based on the values of self-help, self-responsibility, democracy, equality, equity and solidarity. In the tradition of their founders, co-operative members believe in the ethical values of honesty, openness, social responsibility and caring for others.

Read more about co-operatives and our principles here and here.
story_txt:
Why a worker-owned brewery?
Did you know worker-owned businesses are more productive than normal businesses?

Create good jobs with livable wages where employees are making the decisions about what affects them most.
As neighborhoods and businesses in Boston become increasingly taken over by corporate landowners and businesses, we need more small businesses that will counter the effects of gentrification.
Beer brings people together!  By providing a community space and worker-center, Democracy Brewing is honoring the age-old tradition of building movements over beer.
Quality beer (need we say more?).

Become a part of history and help make Democracy Brewing a reality.

Join the Fermentation Rebellion
We currently are working with several mission-based investors and lenders that will help fulfill the capital to launch this project, but to do it right, this process takes time. To continue building on this exciting momentum, we need $30,000 to take the next necessary steps to making Democracy Brewing happen:

Ensuring we find the perfect location for both brewing and building community
Legal fees associated with opening a brewery in Massachusetts
Keep the momentum going as we build up our funding portfolio

As an early supporter, we are excited to offer a variety of perks:

Awesome Democracy Brewing schwag to spread the word and to show off to your friends
Opportunities to hang out with the Democracy Brewing team
Beer. Really good beer.

Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute right now? We bet you know people who can! Please help us by spreading the word and using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
WHY ARE WE RAISING MONEY?

- Since 1996 Seven Seeds Farm (www.sevenseedsfarm.com) has been busy farming and building our seed bank for decades, and now Siskiyou Seeds (www.siskiyouseeds.com)is growing our business to better support gardeners and farmers with high quality, organic, open-pollinated, non-GMO seeds adapted to organic conditions and the stresses of climate change.  We are also expanding our ability at training new farmers, seed stewards and plant breeders - a task we have been deeply engaged in here at Siskiyou Seeds. Your contributions directly support organic seed growers, family farms, open source plant breeders and aspiring young farmers.

 OUR STORY: Seeds are a gift from nature – they help facilitate the continuance of life.  Most of our food crops come from seed and we believe that it is a resource that should be stewarded, open source within the commons, rather than privatized or controlled.  Siskiyou Seeds is our family farm’s humble effort to contribute to a positive solution. We grow high quality, certified organic seed that we have distributed nationwide.  In 2009 we initiated our own retail seed packet business.

  Today we steward a collection of nearly 600 open pollinated vegetables, flowers and herbs grown on 5 acres here and from the support of 15 organic growers in the Pacific Northwest.  We are fortunate to have many wonderful heirlooms and unique cultivars.  We continue to breed new varieties and select old favorites to perform well amidst a changing climate.  We believe that well selected and adapted seeds are likely one of the best tools that we have to foster resilient agriculture now and in coming times.

  The task of growing a wide diversity of seed on scale is immense – from maintaining the appropriate isolation distances, to protecting seed crops from pests, to harvesting it in a timely way, to cleaning and storing the seed, to germination testing. There are many steps that result in quality seeds to share.  We are passionate about growing good seed to foster the Agrarian Renaissance among those who wish to reclaim our food systems for the health of ourselves, our families and the larger circle of life.   The biennial Seed Academy at Seven Seeds Farm is an intensive 5-day, on-farm training that aims to educate, empower and inspire a new generation of seed stewards. 

We are asking for support to bring our small family farm Seed Company to a new level of production, consistency, reliability and community involvement.  Currently we are the primary seed company within the Southern Oregon / Northern California region.  We aim to invest in the people, plants and infrastructure to foster healthy businesses that bridge biology and culture through seed.

We are implementing the following stages that will accelerated  through the success of this funding campaign

• Upgrade our seed germination testing equipment to accurately test seed

• Research and development for quality control and new products

• Offer regular public field days at the farm and in the region to showcase the seed to table attributes of current and new seeds

•. We are upgrading our seed inventory management systems.

• Create a backup power system for our climate controlled seed storage room.

• Provide scholarships to our Seed education trainings.

Thank you for making the effort to support growing a world of good and a positive future.

Pictured Below is our seed packets and the Organic cotton hoodie with the Siskiyou Seeds Logo on the front and a beautiful Seven Seeds Farm image on the back (both available as a perks)

Partners in our effort include:
