What We NEED from YOU ...
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help :

Contribute.  Every little bit helps!  For your part, one of our rewards is all yours!
Can't spare a little cash?  Hey, we totally understand.  Times get tough, and with everyone wanting a little help, it can get overwhelming ... so instead, we would be forever grateful if you could SPREAD THE WORD!  Use the options at the top of the page to share on Facebook and Twitter.  Shout it loud and proud.  Please invite your friends and family.  We can't do it without your help.  ( Well, we can, but it will be a lot more work! )

story:
Every village needs a baker, and this baker needs her village.

I'm Sarah, owner and baker at Bread from the Earth. I've been baking for four years in Southern Vermont, and found my community in West Townshend in the summer of 2014. Since that fateful evening when I stumbled upon a weekly pizza night there, I have been baking naturally-leavened artisan breads from organic ingredients in the community-built outdoor cob oven at the West Townshend Country Store. Now I need your help to build a bigger and better oven so that I can bake more bread, support myself, and continue to feed my community!

                              

The Story of Bread from the Earth

I have always loved to bake. My relationship with bread began with my Grandma and our Friday ritual of baking challah in her cabin on the lake in Maine. She taught me all those years ago that fresh bread is worthy of the labor it requires, and that it tastes like the love that goes into it. Since I discovered artisan baking almost five years ago at a small farm in southern Vermont, my mission has been to feed my community wholesome and delicious bread while supporting local organic farmers and producers.

For these reasons, all of the flour in my bread is organic and sourced as locally as possible. Most of the flour I use is grown right here in Vermont, or as close to home as I can get it. I burn slab wood from local saw mills to heat my oven, which supports our local fuel economy and utilizes our community's rich resources.

I am also passionate about the culture of sourdough. Natural leavening (sourdough culture, wild yeasts, mixed culture leaven) is a symbiotic community of bacteria and yeasts that work together to make bread rise, while simultaneously enhancing its flavor and nutritional value. The flavors, textures,  and digestability of sourdough are critical to the quality of the bread I bake, and are appreciated by the mouths and bellies of my customers. 

                       

Thanks to every kind of support from this beautiful community, I was able to begin operating as my own small business in June of 2015. Bread from the Earth, LLC (what some might call a “micro-bakery”) was born with the help of many loyal CSB (Community Supported Bread) members. These devoted friends and customers continue to buy shares of bread just like CSA members buy farm shares to support their local food producers.

The West River Community Project's fledgling incubator kitchen allowed me to try out running a bakery and to build a customer base in West Townshend before having to invest in commercial infrastructure. Selling sandwich bread to the cafe at the West Townshend Country Store and all kinds of loaves at the Townshend Farmer's Market got Bread from the Earth on its feet, and over the last year I've begun selling to other local stores and several high-end restaurants.

Now that Bread from the Earth is one year old and growing and steadily, it's time to take the next step. I am no longer able to meet the growing local demand for delicious and nutritious wood-fired breads using the community's outdoor pizza oven. The incubator kitchen has succeeded at it's mission, and my tiny business is ready for some infrastructure of its own.

So here's why I need your help!

I am so excited to announce that this fall we plan to build a dreamy wood-fired brick oven on my family's land, less than two miles up the hill from the West Townshend Country Store. This oven will have a much bigger capacity than the oven I am currently using, and will store heat longer and more evenly allowing me to increase both the quantity and the consistency of the bread I bake.              

The Oven

It can be hard to understand the difference between a pizza oven and a bread oven - until you try to bake a lot of good bread in a pizza oven. 

Here are some of the ways the new oven will differ from the cob pizza oven I use now (and benefit me, my bread, and the folks who eat it):

  • The new bread oven will have much more thermal mass than the cob oven. This means that it will require more wood to get to temperature, but it will store much more heat as well, allowing me to bake batch after batch of bread without stopping for several hours to fire the oven again.
  • Lots of insulation in the new oven will minimize heat loss and fuel-wood consumption, maximizing efficiency and allowing me to use as much of the heat as possible for baking.
  • This oven will also have a lower chamber (meaning the height of ceiling of the oven will be lower). This feature allows steam to collect more quickly in the oven chamber, and steam is what gives artisan breads their shiny chewy crust.
  • And of course, the new oven will be much bigger, which means I will be able to bake a lot more bread relative to the amount of time I spend baking. This kind of capacity will allow my business to grow enough to support me and meet the demand of my community.

To learn more about what makes a masonry bread oven so great, I recommend these awesome books: From the Wood-Fired Oven by Richard Miscovich and The Bread Builders by Alan Scott and Daniel Wing.

Bread from the Earth's oven will be built with the help of Matt Edmunds, a skilled mason and the former apprentice of Peter Moore, the locally famous oven-builder. While my friends and I will be helping with much of the labor, the project will not be cheap.

The Cost

We expect the cost of the materials and professional labor for the oven to be around $33,000 dollars.

This amount will cover the fire brick, cement, insulation and other materials required as well as Matt's expert assistance in constructing this large and intricate piece of masonry.

There's a lot of infrastructure that goes into a bakery, but the oven is its foundation. My goal is to raise at least half of the total cost of the oven so that the amount I will have to borrow will be manageable. It is my vision that the work and resources I am investing in this project will rest on a foundation of community support.

On top of this strong groundwork, I will be borrowing money for a mixer, coolers, freezers, work tables, and the numerous other items that a commercial bakery needs. The more help I can get in building the oven the less I will have to borrow for these critical expenses.

We hope to build this oven in September and October and to be doing test bakes by November. By the beginning of 2017 I hope that Bread from the Earth will be operating fully out of its new home!

The Challenges

My next task, once I have a larger baking capacity, will be to continue to find new accounts for my bread. While this can be challenging in a small town in a rural area, I am confident that there is a larger market in this area than I am currently able to produce for. As my capacity grows I hope to supply more local stores and restaurants as well as vend at more farmers markets. Both the locals and the tourists who visit this area have shown that they value really good bread and are willing to pay for it. Recently I've had to turn down potential accounts that have been interested in my bread, so while I know it will take a lot of hard work, I also know there is lots of room in the area for my business to grow.

With your help, we can build an oven that will feed many people, support me (and someday my family), and last for hundreds of years.

And here's what you'll get in return!

I have lots of thank-you gifts I'm excited to share. Every contribution of $15 or more comes with a coupon for one of Bread from the Earth's artisan wood-fired loaves. Larger donations will receive hand-screened T-shirts showing the beautiful Bread from the Earth logo, or a CSB share (8 weeks of good bread!).

But the gift I'm the most excited about is this one:

Everyone who donates $30 or more will have the opportunity to make (or have made) a personalized ceramic tile. The larger the donation the larger the tile, which can say or show anything you want: your name, a blessing, something nice to look at, your hand print, anything that will remind me of your participation in helping me achieve this dream. Locals are invited to make them together with me at the community ceramics studio, or we can make one for you (your design or ours) if you're busy or far away. We will use these tiles to cover the outside of the oven when it is complete, so the oven can be a constant reminder of the love and support that I have received from friends, family, strangers, and community members.

We'll invite any locals who are interested to come help us put the tiles on the oven before the grand opening. Whenever you come to the bakery for a pizza party, an all-you-can-eat french toast brunch (!), or to pick up your bread you'll see your tile and remember that the bakery is yours too.

There are so many ways you can help!

Even if you don't have money to donate, there are lots of ways you can show your support for Bread from the Earth. First of all, please share this campaign with your family and friends, or anyone you know who might be interested. Getting the word out is half the battle and I can't do it without you.

I will also need lots of hands-on assistance during the oven build, so if you're local and have working hands, a strong back, and a few spare hours I would love to have your help!                                                                                                                    

               

This is not just a business, it's my life. It would be my pleasure to talk to you about what I'm doing and answer all of your questions. Please be in touch – feeling your loving support is just as important to me as raising money.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for helping me build the foundation for the next phase of Bread from the Earth!

story:
Why are we on Indiegogo?

The general public is realizing that fresh, clean, organic foods are great contributors to our overall health and the environment.  We want to do our part in helping our community stay healthy, not only in the present time but for years to come.

After several years of work and research, we now have a small prototype shrimp farm in which we are raising clean, healthy shrimp from our farm to your table. With your help we can move our prototype farm into a warehouse where we can house 8 large tanks which will be enough to support our community and farmer's markets on a continual basis.

Who are we and what made us do what we're doing?

We, Cecil and Kathy Brookins, are the founders of Brookins Shrimp Farm and we both love to cook. As a matter of fact, cooking is the whole reason why we started our shrimp farm. Like most chefs, we only like to use fresh, clean ingredients and we always like to know that the places we get our ingredients from are clean and traceable, safe for the environment, and sustainable for future generations.

What is our background?

In addition to cooking as a hobby for both of us, the following lists our professional background:

Cecil Brookins - has over 25 years in operations/production management working with lean processes and six sigma for efficiency, project management, planning, tracking, and analyzing information and integrating people processes, systems, and technologies. 

Kathleen Brookins - has over 20 years in the engineering and construction industry to include over 10 years in project management of green buildings. sustainability, LEED compliance, and energy alternatives. 

Dr. Jose T. Nededog - served as the President of the University of Guam where we were able to work together in obtaining valuable information and education on the sustainable farming of Pacific White Shrimp. He also served 7 years as a Professor for Financial Investing, has over 20 years experience as a financial consultant and is a Doctor of Business Administration.

We put our combined knowledge together and worked with several professionals in the shrimp farming industry as well as the State of California Fish and Wildlife and the University of Arizona laboratories where the shrimp are tested for disease and pathogens. We received our aquaculture license and began raising pacific white shrimp indoors in a clean and controlled environment. Right now we are running 4 medium tanks and 1 nursery tank in our 200 square foot garage. With your help, we will be able to run 8 large tanks in a larger space, a warehouse, where the environment will still be controlled and clean. We will be able to  offer our community, on a regular monthly basis, the healthy choice of marine shrimp that are non-gmo, disease and pathogen-free and not tainted with any chemicals or antibiotics. All this from our farm to your table.

So what do we need exactly?

The funds we receive will go to the following tanks and equipment:

(8) 12 foot diameter round tanks with complete aquaculture heater system  = $27,652

Salt for 8 tanks   = $6,192

Natural filtration system for 8 tanks    = $12,559

Substrate and hiding places for 8 tanks   = $1,248

TOTAL   =   $47,651

Our savings is going toward the rental of the warehouse, our continued licensing, payroll, insurance, and supplies.

Our desire is to reach our entire goal but should this not happen, the funds will still be used to complete as many shrimp tanks as possible with the funds we receive.

In Conclusion

Raising shrimp in a clean controlled environment is not an easy task. Like any other farm, the work is labor intensive and there are challenges everyday, especially with keeping the shrimps' water balanced and clean. But our knowledge combined with our experience in successfully raising delicious clean shrimp has brought us to a place where we are confident that we can continue to do this successfully with positive results to share with our community. It's always a joy to watch people, young and old alike, eating healthy and caring for our environment. Now we are able to provide a protein that is much loved by many and they will know that what they're eating is safe for their family. Ultimately we would love to start an annual community festival with cook-offs using fresh produce and clean proteins from local farmers and showcasing local talent for all to enjoy.

Please share this site everywhere and use the Indiegogo tools!

Thank you in advance for your support!

With your help we can move our prototype farm into a warehouse where we can house 8 large tanks which will be enough to support our community and farmer's markets on a continual basis.Who are we and what made us do what we're doing?We, Cecil and Kathy Brookins, are the founders of Brookins Shrimp Farm and we both love to cook. story:
UPDATE:

What makes Zainab Rights different than any other show or news community out there?

Zainab Rights is the first of it's kind that combines storytelling and journalism to give our subscribers a holistic view of justice. 

Upon navigation of our website, you will notice there are many categories under stories and those categories also have sub categories. These stories are responsible for breaking down the bigger picture, literally everything that affects global justice from business, to economics, to foreign and domestic politics to even social issues and philosophy. 

Through storytelling, we will be able to tackle difficult concepts and bring them down to a level that makes sense to most of us in our efforts to spread awareness and empower our readers with the knowledge they require to make informed choices. 

Coupled with the talk show that is never scripted, we will have in depth analysis into a specific issue (rather than gleaning over headlines as most news channels do), we aim to answer  the question "what do you want me to do with this information?". In a world where we continuously feel small in the grand scheme of things, we want to empower our community to feel a little bit bigger and realize the potential to attain justice lies in our hands. 

Most importantly, our project does not label itself as progressive, conservative, liberal etc. Although this would be beneficial for ratings and attracting certain type of viewers, we are striving for a niche that is steps ahead of all these labels, a community that solely seeks justice and peace no matter what form that ends up taking, no matter whom it ends up offending. 

Additionally, most of our team is a student and we are all volunteering our time to provide this service to humanity. The premise of Zainab Rights is founded on humility and accepting the fact that we too are growing along with our family of readers, viewers and subscribers. 

Lastly, the Zainab Rights team believes staunchly in the concept of justice and holds unwavering hope in a time where justice will prevail over all lands, peoples, and tribes, a time when peace and tranquility will be enjoyed by all. Until then, we will continue to strive. 

We know that we have many odds stacked against us, but we know we can grow successfully with your support and contributions. 


Short Summary


Zainab Rights calls for each and everyone of us to stand steadfast against the face of injustice, oppression and violence wherever it may be. Neutrality, now more than ever, is not an option. 

We invite you to support us, believe in us, invest in us and more importantly join our journey as we fearlessly pursue a dream; a world filled with love, justice and peace. Who’s to say a dream can’t be a reality?


What We Need 

The industry of news, media, video production and journalism isn't easy on the wallet and as many of the Zainab Rights team include students, we wouldn't be able to grow at the pace we need without the means to do so. We hope to circumvent the investor route so that we can maintain full influence of our operations, vision and goals. 

This is our breakdown:

  • $1000 for website
  • $7200 for studio space
  • $1200 for web/social media marketing
  • $2000 for equipment, audio, video, mics, technical support, media
  • $600 licensing/mail box
  • $1000 show hosting/guest travel expenses
  • $2000 marketing, tabling, vendorship, promotional material

The Impact

In the current climate of fear, hate, violence and war, Zainab Rights cannot afford to take steps towards growth, it must take strides. Your contributions will enable our team to have the funds we need to develop, grow and sustain ourselves in the long run. Your contributions will ensure that truth, justice and peace always have a voice, no matter what the costs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate, you may know someone who can. Please share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, and other social media networks. Most importantly, support our vision by participating in our conversations. We care about EVERY voice, EVERY story, EVERY perspective. Be part of our family. 

Also support us on Amazon as you shop. Just copy this link in your browser and bookmark it for your future purchases. https://www.amazon.com/?ie=UTF8&tag=zainabrights-20

story:
The Purrfect Cup is on the prowl!

Few things are better than a cup of coffee, warm saucer of milk, and cuddles from a furry friend.

  • We are here to bring the very first cat cafe to Edmonton!
  • Our goal is to help cats from local rescues and shelters be adopted.
  • Your generous donation will be going toward our new furever home as well as decking out the location in the coziest cat swag Edmonton has ever seen!
  • Before we open shop, we are aiming to raise at least $40,000 to get our paws off of the ground!
  • We have some great purrks (get it?! GET IT?!) for you - check them out on the right-hand side!

But wait... How is MY money going to help?

How will your contribution make a difference?

  • We are more than just your average coffee shop! Not only will we serve you steamy hot catpuccinos, but you can spend quality time with cats seeking a new home.
  • We give you the opportunity to bond with cats that are up for adoption in a friendly, intimate environment.
  • A large focus of ours is the well-being of the animals that pass through our cafe. We will work hard to ensure that they find the right purrents.

    Lend us a paw!

    If you are not able to fund our project - do not worry! We also appreciate other means of spreading the word, such as:

    • Talk about it! Instead of asking how the weather is, try something like:
       "Oh boy, did you hear about that new cat cafe opening up?"
      "I did not! Tell me more!" -  Instant conversation starter!
    • Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram - the sky is the limit!

    We are so eager to get this show on the road, which means no cat naps for us! We'd like to thank you all so much again for all your support, and we can't wait to serve your purrfect cup!

story:
About the Founder

     My name is Felicia Barlow, I am 30 years old and have a sweet, but sarcastic (I don't know where he picked up this trait), son who is 9. I spent my early adult life working in the hospitality and medical industries while raising my son. I have talked about opening a Bed & Breakfast for many years and it dawned on me one day that I needed to stop talking about it and actually do it! I resigned from my career of 9 years and went to school full time. I crammed 6-8 classes into each semester, even the summers, to get done as quickly as possible. I am heading into my last semester of the Business Entrepreneurship program with a minor in Sustainability. In addition to maintaining a spot on the Dean's List, I have held the position of Sustainability Club President which has allowed me the opportunity to serve my local community and build strong relationships with local sustainable businesses.

     During my studies, I pivoted from a bed & breakfast to a hostel because of an experience I had last summer while traveling with my family. I was traveling to Indiana to job shadow a bed & breakfast owner, on the way our flights were delayed and canceled until we ended up stuck in the L.A. airport. It was the middle of the night when we arrived, forcing us to claim our baggage, and leaving us faced with two options, pay for a hotel costing $150 a night which was 45 minutes away, or sleep in the airport. We were exhausted and had about 6 hours before our flight. By the time we would have checked into a hotel we would have only had 4 hours to sleep before  getting back to the airport to check in. We were traveling on a tight budget so we were left with only one option, sleep in the L.A. airport lobby. When we finally arrived in Indiana we had a wonderful experience with the bed & breakfast owner who also happened to own a hostel. By the time I returned I knew I wanted to create a place for other people experiencing unpleasant flying experiences. The solution is a hostel, close to the airport.

 

The Vision

     There is a building available to renovate into a hostel in Boise, Idaho (this location could change if the current desired location sells before we raise the funds to purchase). The location is 2.3 miles from the airport, 2 miles to downtown, and 1 mile from the Boise State campus. This business is closely aligned with my values, beliefs, and dreams. I feel passionately about creating a sustainability focused lodging option for people to stay comfortably while not consuming their entire travel budget.

     By contributing to this campaign you will be helping travelers have a safe, comfortable, and affordable place to sleep. You will be contributing to a business that puts environmental impact at the top of its priority list. Lastly, you will be providing a mother, who has paid her own way through college, a way to start a business which will serve the local community and provide an income for her family.

Sustainability Vision

I take sustainability very seriously so Hostel Ohana will be forever evolving with the most efficient methods available. I have been heavily involved in the sustainability community in Boise, Idaho through volunteering for places such as The Boise EcoVillage Project, Treefort Music Festival Green Team, Fish and Game Fire Restoration, and maintaining the position of President of the Sustainability Club & Community Garden at Boise State. With these experiences and the continuous education I receive on the sustainability front, Hostel Ohana will be able to maintain the highest level of sustainability. There will be cost barriers in the beginning so everything will need to happen in phases but here is a list of what will be incorporated over time:

  • Solar Power
  • Organic non GMO garden for guests to access
  • Bicycles available for guest use
  • Reclaimed materials for all interior furniture
  • Where reclaimed materials are not available, sustainable, fair trade, ethically made, sourcing and materials will be purchased
  • Business cards will be made from up-cycled cardboard using a stamp and eco-friendly ink
  • Natural light will be maximized reducing the need for artificial light
  • LED bulbs throughout
  • Composting, vermicomposting and bokashi methods
  • Recycling
  • Locally made sustainable soaps/lotions/toothpaste will be made available
  • Sustainable fabrics for linens
  • Other local sustainable businesses will be supported through our recommendations, subscriptions, and volunteering.

Where Does the Money Go?

     The available building is completely gutted which oddly works in our favor. With a clean slate we are able to input sustainable sourced and created fixtures, furnishings, and equipment.

$400,000 is the target amount to raise which will go towards:

Purchase of building

Electrical work

Beds and linens

Bathrooms

Security cameras

Privacy fence

Office supplies

Outdoor garden providing fresh food for guests

Kitchen cabinets/appliances/tableware/cookware

Lockers to provide a safe place for belongings

Remodel two garages on property to be male & female bunk rooms.

Locks with individualized codes for entry into property

Coin operated washer and dryer

And much more!

What's In It For You?

     When you contribute you will receive passes for nightly stays at the hostel based on your contribution amount. These passes are transferable, meaning if you wish to give them away to friends, family, or employees feel free! We welcome all new and returning guests!

     When you stay with us you will experience an upscale hostel experience. What does "upscale hostel experience" mean? It means you will not be sleeping on a bunk bed where you can feel the movements of strangers in their bed, instead you will have an individual bunk that is mounted directly to the wall. You will have privacy curtains for sleeping or personal space. You will have a locker for all your belongings to be safely stored.

     Ohana is the Hawaiian word for family. I chose this as the name of the hostel because Ohana is an all-encompassing word for family. It does not mean merely your blood related family, but also those people who enter your life and are considered family. Hostel Ohana will foster a comfortable, friendly environment where you will meet people who will forever be a part of who you are, they will become your Hostel Ohana. 

How to use your Perks:

  • Perks cannot be redeemed for cash.
  • Nights do not need to be consecutive.
  • All perks are subject to space availability. Limitations on number of Perk redemption's per day/month may apply because we still have to be able to pay our monthly overhead.
  • Perks do not expire.
  • All perks are transferable to other persons. You may give them away or sell them.

If we do not reach our goal:

You will receive your money back if we do not meet the minimum threshold of $100,000.

The Impact

     In short, this project was born through the suffering I experienced during air travels. With the location of this Hostel so close to the airport you will be providing travelers and airline staff alike with an affordable, comfortable, safe place to stay. In addition to this, you will be able to rest easy knowing the impact on the environment will be continuously evaluated and modified to create the smallest negative impact possible. The goal will be not only to avoid harming the environment, but to ultimately better the environment through sustainable business practices, sustainable materials, and sustainable landscaping.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

     If you have made it to this point but do not have the ability to contribute financially, I want you to know how much I appreciate you taking the time to learn about Hostel Ohana. People who care about the vision and are excited about the vision are just as important to the cause as those who can contribute financially. I have not had money to contribute to many visions I believe in over the last two years, but I have volunteered my time and network connections to helping raise up the visions I believe in. If you believe in this vision, please pass this along to those who may be interested in contributing. Thank you in advance.

     In short, this project was born through the suffering I experienced during air travels. With the location of this Hostel so close to the airport you will be providing travelers and airline staff alike with an affordable, comfortable, safe place to stay. In addition to this, you will be able to rest easy knowing the impact on the environment will be continuously evaluated and modified to create the smallest negative impact possible. The goal will be not only to avoid harming the environment, but to ultimately better the environment through sustainable business practices, sustainable materials, and sustainable landscaping.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
     If you have made it to this point but do not have the ability to contribute financially, I want you to know how much I appreciate you taking the time to learn about Hostel Ohana. People who care about the vision and are excited about the vision are just as important to the cause as those who can contribute financially. I have not had money to contribute to many visions I believe in over the last two years, but I have volunteered my time and network connections to helping raise up the visions I believe in. If you believe in this vision, please pass this along to those who may be interested in contributing. Thank you in advance.

story:
Versión en español abajo/spanish version below

--------------------------------0-----------------------------------


Who we are:

In 2012, we, Edi, Areli and Elvia, formed our own cooperative (C.A.C.A.O.) in search for dignified work. We decided to create our own way of living and at the same time recuperate our customs and traditions. Why did we decided to do this by making chocolate? Because in our land, Oaxaca, Mexico, chocolate carries with it a lively memory, is a symbol of resistance, and is a strong part of our ancestral roots. Together we learned how to make chocolate through the teachings of our elders, recuperating and elaborating traditional recipes. We make semi-bitter chocolate with ingredients such as honey, brown sugar, mezcal (traditional liquor), cane sugar and amaranth.

C.A.C.A.O. stands for Autonomous Cooperative of Learning and Sharing in Oaxaca and our goal is to recover the ancestral way of making chocolate. We don’t want a chocolate that makes people sick; we want a chocolate that makes us strong in order to reach a state of autonomy. Because of this, what we aim for is to create an alternative to exploitive work and to regain the autonomous capacity to live and eat.


You can be part of this dream


The cooperative is in a moment in which we need to take the next step towards reaching our dreams. For this reason, we are asking for your support in acquiring new tools. With your support, we hope to collect the amount necessary to buy a grinder and two bike-machines that allow us to improve our production. Furthermore, with the bike-machines we will be able to carry out more workshops to those that we will we will be able to invite with this new level of capacity. If we achieve our goal, we will be capable of truly making a living from our chocolate, and additionally strengthening our relations with local farmers and with our community.

We believe in solidarity, mutual support and reciprocity. For your support in this campaign you will receive a special reward/prize/gift made with affection specially for you:

Don’t worry if it’s not possible to support us economically. If you would like to collaborate in any other way you can help us with translations, graphic and industrial design, photography and filming and editing videos. Get in contact with us as cooperativa.cacao@gmail.com!

Rebelious chocolate

Nowadays, West African countries produce 70% of the cacao that is commercialized around the world. In these plantations they endure conditions of slavery and exploitive child labor. A few corporations control the global market of chocolate while the farmers make a miserable amount for the cacao that they produce. For this reason, as a cooperative, we are cultivating direct and fair relationships with our farmer families, removing the middlemen (known as "coyotes"), that pay so little to the growers and mess with our people.

Cacao is a native plant to the Mexican South and Southeast. The Mayans were the first to grow cacao approximately 2,000 years ago. The fruit of the cacao tree was considered a sacred seed, which was used for the Mayans as an offering to the gods and as a sacred drink: XOCOLALT (chocolate in the original language "nahuatl"). Also, it was used as a form of currency, to provide energy during the workday and to heal

What we hope for is to make a healthy chocolate in which there is NO EXPLOITATION OF ANYONE IN PRODUCING IT, recovering the artisanal way of chocolate making using traditional recipes from our communities, and ultimately, selling it at fair prices. With these goals in mind, in order to make our chocolate we toast the cacao in the “comal” (traditional stove made of clay) and we use natural, organic and local ingredients: honey from la Sierra Sur and from the coast, cane sugar or brown sugar from the Mixe region and amaranth from a network of family-farmers from the central valleys. Thanks to all of them, we generate A SPECIAL CHOCOLATE WITH UNIQUE QUALITIES.

The cacao trees from which it is grown coexists with other plants, such as coffee or “guanábana” (soursop). All of this effort and energy from the people transforms the grain into a tablet of chocolate.

As a cooperative, we have three basic principles:

  • Autogestión (Self-sufficiency): we generate and struggle for a dignified income for ourselves

  • Autonomy: we make our own decisions and collectively decide the course of our cooperative

  • Food sovereignty: we recuperate our local-traditional food and our native roots

As our name states, we do not think we will change the world just by making chocolate. We also give great importance to sharing ideas and to the process of learning as tools for liberation. Sharing is important because it allows us to find ourselves and build ourselves back up again. By “learning”, we mean that we are recuperating the ancestral knowledge of our people. This process is important because it permits us to continue on our journey towards autonomy. In the context of sharing, learning, and above all organizing, we are able to create a new world, for our families, for our communities and for all those who will come.

Thanks for taking the time to read this and support us!


---------------------------------0----------------------------------


¿Quiénes somos?

Somos tres jóvenes oaxaqueños, Edgardo, Areli y Elvia, que en 2012 formamos nuestra Cooperativa (C.A.C.A.O.) en busca de un trabajo digno. Decidimos crear nuestra propia manera de vivir y al mismo tiempo rescatar nuestras costumbres y tradiciones ¿porqué hacerlo a través del chocolate? porque en nuestra tierra, Oaxaca, México, el chocolate mantiene una memoria muy viva, es un símbolo de resistencia y está muy fuerte en nuestras raíces originarias. Juntos aprendimos a hacer chocolate a través de las enseñanzas de nuestras abuelas, rescatamos recetas tradicionales e innovamos otras, elaboramos chocolate semiamargo con ingredientes como miel, azúcar mascabado, mezcal, piloncillo y amaranto.

C.A.C.A.O. significa Cooperativa Autónoma de Convivencia y Aprendizaje de Oaxaca y nuestro objetivo es rescatar la manera ancestral de hacer el chocolate. Nosotros no queremos un chocolate que enferme ni un trabajo que nos explote, queremos un chocolate que nos de fuerzas para alcanzar la autonomía y crear una alternativa al empleo explotador recuperando así la capacidad autónoma de vivir y de comer.

Tú puedes ser parte de este sueño

Estamos en un momento de la cooperativa en el que necesitamos dar un paso más para alcanzar nuestros sueños, por eso estamos pidiendo tu apoyo para tener mejores herramientas de trabajo. Con tu apoyo esperamos recaudar lo necesario para la compra de un molino y dos bicimáquinas que nos permitan mejorar nuestra producción. Además, con las bicimáquinas seremos capaces de realizar más talleres a los que invitaremos a más personas.

Si logramos nuestro objetivo seremos capaces de vivir realmente de la producción de nuestro chocolate además que esto nos permitirá ampliar nuestras relaciones con los productores locales y nuestras comunidades.

Nosotros creemos en la solidaridad, el apoyo mutuo y la reciprocidad por lo que al apoyar esta campaña podrás recibir una recompensa especial hecha con cariño para ti:

Si no te es posible apoyarnos económicamente, no te preocupes, existen otras formas de colaboración que podemos llevar a cabo como: traducciones, diseño gráfico e industrial, fotografía, grabación y edición de videos. ¡Ponte en contacto con nosotros! cooperativa.cacao@gmail.com

Un chocolate rebelde

Actualmente, los países de África Occidental producen el 70% del cacao que se comercializa en el mundo, en estas plantaciones se viven condiciones de esclavitud y explotación infantil, unas cuantas empresas controlan el mercado mundial de chocolate mientras los campesinos ganan una miseria por el cacao que producen, por eso como cooperativa tejemos una relación directa y justa con nuestras familias campesinas quitando del camino a los intermediarios y coyotes que pagan precios de miseria y chingan a nuestra gente. 

El cacao es una planta nativa del sur y sureste mexicano, los mayas fueron los primeros en sembrar cacao hace aproximadamente más de 2000 años. El fruto del árbol de cacao era considerada una semilla sagrada, la cual fue utilizada por los mayas como ofrenda para los dioses, “moneda” de cambio, para preparar bebidas sagradas como el XOCOLALT (chocolate), para dar fuerza en el trabajo y para curar. 

Lo que nosotros buscamos es ELABORAR UN CHOCOLATE SANO EN EL QUE NO HAYA EXPLOTACIÓN DE NADIE PARA PRODUCIRLO, rescatando la manera artesanal de elaborarlo y las recetas tradicionales de nuestras comunidades, además de precios justos. Por eso para elaborar nuestro chocolate tostamos en comal de barro y usamos ingredientes naturales, orgánicos, de productores locales: la miel que utilizamos viene de la Sierra Sur y de la Costa, la panela o piloncillo nos llega de la Región Mixe, el amaranto que usamos proviene de una red de productoras de los Valles Centrales; gracias a todo esto generamos UN CHOCOLATE ESPECIAL CON CUALIDADES ÚNICAS.

El chocolate desde que está sembrado convive con otras plantas como el café, la guanabana y con el campesino, luego con quienes lo tostamos, molemos y entablillamos y al final con quien lo bebe o lo come. Toda esta fuerza y energia de la gente transforma el grano en una tablilla de chocolate.

Como cooperativa tenemos tres principios básicos:

  • AUTOGESTIÓN: generar y buscar por nuestra cuenta ingresos dignos

    AUTONOMÍA: tomar nuestras propias decisiones y decidir colectivamente el rumbo de nuestra cooperativa

  • SOBERANÍA ALIMENTARIA: recuperar nuestra comida local-tradicional y nuestras semillas nativas

Como lo dice nuestro nombre, no pensamos que sólo haciendo chocolate vamos a cambiar el mundo, tenemos que dar mucha importancia a la convivencia y el aprendizaje como herramientas de liberación; la convivencia porque tenemos que retejernos de nuevo, encontrarnos, compartirnos y organizarnos; aprendizaje, en el sentido de recuperar los conocimientos ancestrales de nuestros pueblos que nos permitan caminar hacia la autonomía. Con convivencia, aprendizaje y sobre todo organización podemos rehacer de nuevo el mundo, para nosotros, nuestras familias, nuestras comunidades y para los que apenas vienen.

¡Gracias por tomarte el tiempo de leer esto y de apoyarnos!

story:
Through my diverse travels and life experience I have become aware of the immense levels of starvation, malnutrition, and the lack of clean drinking water that predominates the planet.  Both globally and locally I have observed major disparities in clean drinking water and truly nourishing food options available.  I feel compassion for all who suffer on Earth, and believe every act of loving generosity changes the world.  This is an overwhelmingly large situation to remedy for one individual so your help is needed. I am determined to assist as best I can, fueled by my love and hope for humanity, gratitude for my God given gifts, and passion for nourishing and healing those in need!  Your financial help and prayers are needed to get this project going!  This is the first phase of my efforts to nourish and heal those in need, and I thank you for being here for birth of something great! Follow the progress afterward on ReikiChef.com !

Locally I will be making simple probiotic and nutritious organic foods to lovingly nourish and fuel friends and members of the community.

Globally I will be donating 11% of profits to feed and nourish the needy through the organization WorldVision, an organization that I trust to truly care for the millions of starving and malnourished children around the world.

The money raised will go towards purchasing the initial supplies and tools to start feeding and healing the world, one tamale, one bowl of soup, one burrito, one generous donation at a time.

Here is an after-tax and shipping, linked list of the supplies:

(Generally Listed by priority)

-Tamale Steamer/Stock pot ($65)

-Outdoor Burner ($65)

-Large Mixing Bowl ($45)

-Vacuum Sealer ($230)

-Vacuum Bags 1 & 2  ($80)

-Reusable Freezable Soup Containers ($40)

-Compact Freezer ($260)

-Food Scale ($55)

-Steam Tray for Soups and Tamales ($220)

-Compostable Sample Cups and Spoons ($80)

-Compostable Plates, Bowls, Lids, Napkins, Forks, and Spoons ($160)

-Fermentation Containers ($110)

-Product Labels ($80)

-Label Printer and Toner ($310)

-Organic and Non-GMO Food Supplies ($700)

-Farmers Market Setup (Fire Extinguisher, Tent, Tables 1 & 2, and Cooler) ($700)

-Delivery Vehicle Fund ($1200)

story:
SHORT DESCRIPTION

This is the first step towards building a sustainable agricultural revolution in a small village in the Western Region of Nepal.  We are asking for your support to help us start the first stage of this project.  As the first farmer owned cooperative in this region, the cooperative will face the highest start-up costs which is why we need your support in order to make this a reality.  The funds will be used to build 10,000 ltrs of water reservoir, buy agricultural tools and organise training to the farmers. 


According to the World Bank, investing in agriculture is twice as effective at eliminating poverty than investing in any other sector.  We believe that by taking a small step at a time and helping each other, we can create a revolution to develop an innovative agricultural approach that seeks to empower the future youths.

Through Indigogo, we hope to raise part of our start up cost to ensure we have a solid foundation and tools we need to begin a successful journey of boosting agricultural system, create job and generate incomes.

  

STORY - WHY I CHOSE THIS PROJECT!

A brief visit in 2015 to my village (where I was born) after 15 long years made me fall in love instantly.  The heavenly pristine nature and the innocent people attracted me to come back with a social cause and giving back to the community.  Since I always wanted to do something for my village I thought what better time than this to give back to your community as we are now in the era of historic challenge.  


The population of the community still largely depend on land and agriculture, however, they produce only for home consumption or are not aware of commercial farming and market demands.  They have no way to learn best practices of farm management that would let them double their yields and also not aware of the products available to them or how they work. Therefore, we came up with the project based on agriculture and agro-industrialization for a sustainable . 

At the time when the government is stressing to boost the economy of Nepal through agriculture by bringing different packages, the people in the village are still not aware of government grants and other opportunities.  The project will also work as a linkage between government, producers, traders and other stakeholders.  


WHAT WE NEED 

We now need your support to make this project come live and make it a reality!!! 

THE IMPACT

By empowering the locals with these basics like water supply, agricultural skills and tools, the project aims to bring the village under some agri-business activities such as organic farming, vegetable seed production, honey production, livestock production,etc.   Through awareness raising and training we plan to generate several agribusiness jobs and uplift the livelihood of farmers.

Once we have created the model for this first project, our plan is to replicate it and build more community owned agricultural trade in the surrounding villages.  We believe that this is just the start of new door that will lead to thousands of other opportunities!! 


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The first of its kind in this village,  the project will be a big challenge creating awareness among people towards commercial farming.


THE NEXT CHAPTER

So far, 12 farmers signed up to become part of our movement. That is great! - but we want to make it possible for hundreds and thousands of them!!!

With this project, we’re trying to further build this community to not only reach more farmers and help them uplift their livelihood but also want to show them how many people believe in the idea already so they have the courage to join in.  Lets work together for a  power to achieve anything so nothing can hold them!!


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Thank you! Your contributions and support are the driving force behind this project. Even if you can't make a financial donation, there’s more that you can do than just donate.  Spread the word and increase the chances of reaching our goals together!!
story_txt:
SHORT DESCRIPTION


This is the first step towards building a
sustainable agricultural revolution in a small village in the Western Region of
Nepal.  We are asking for your support to
help us start the first stage of this project. 
As the first farmer owned cooperative in this region, the cooperative
will face the highest start-up costs which is why we need your support in order
to make this a reality.  The funds will be used to build 10,000 ltrs of water reservoir, buy agricultural tools and organise training to the farmers. 






According to the World Bank, investing in
agriculture is twice as effective at eliminating poverty than investing in any
other sector.  We believe that by taking a small step at a time and helping each other, we can create a revolution to develop an innovative agricultural approach that seeks to empower the future youths.
Through Indigogo, we hope
to raise part of our start up cost to ensure we have a solid foundation and
tools we need to begin a successful journey of boosting agricultural system,
create job and generate incomes.
  

STORY - WHY I CHOSE THIS PROJECT!
A brief visit in 2015 to my village (where I
was born) after 15 long years made me fall in love instantly.  The heavenly pristine nature and the innocent people attracted me to come back with a social cause and giving back to the community.  Since I always wanted to do something for my village I thought what better time than this to give back to your community as we are now in the era of historic challenge.  






The
population of the community still largely depend on land and agriculture, however, they
produce only for home consumption or are not aware of commercial farming and
market demands.  They have no way to learn best practices of farm management
that would let them double their yields and also not aware of the products
available to them or how they work. Therefore, we came up with the project
based on agriculture and agro-industrialization for a sustainable .  
At the time when the government is stressing to
boost the economy of Nepal through agriculture by bringing different packages,
the people in the village are still not aware of government grants and other
opportunities.  The project will also work as
a linkage between government, producers, traders and other stakeholders.  
   

WHAT WE NEED 
We now need your support to make this project come live and make it a reality!!! 
 






THE IMPACT
 

By empowering the locals with these basics like water supply, agricultural skills and tools, the project aims to bring the village under some agri-business activities such as organic farming, vegetable seed production, honey production, livestock production,etc.   Through awareness raising and training we plan to generate several agribusiness jobs and uplift the livelihood of farmers.
Once we have created the model for this first project, our plan is to replicate it and build more community owned agricultural trade in the surrounding villages.  We believe that this is just the start of new door that will lead to thousands of other opportunities!! 



 RISKS AND CHALLENGES
The first of its kind in this village,  the project will be a big challenge creating awareness among people towards commercial farming.


THE NEXT CHAPTER
So far, 12 farmers signed up to become part of our movement. That is great! - but we want to make it possible for hundreds and thousands of them!!!
With this project, we’re trying to further build this community to not only reach more farmers and help them uplift their livelihood but also want to show them how many people believe in the idea already so they have the courage to join in.  Lets work together for a  power to achieve anything so nothing can hold them!!



 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPThank you! Your
contributions and support are the driving force behind this
project. Even if you can't make
a financial donation, there’s more that you can do than just donate.  Spread the word and increase the chances of
reaching our goals together!!

story:
WHO ARE WE & WHAT IS THIS?

  • My name is Chris Seaver and for the last 25 years I have been making low budget comedy horror films. I have decided to tackle a new adventure by opening up my own 80s inspired Entertainment store and lounge.
  •  
  • Chris Seaver-Born in 1977 and growing up in the 80s I was able to absorb the pop culture like a sponge and to this day I am obsessed with the decade. I am a guy that is very passionate and driven and loves to hold on to the things that made me who I am as a person. I want to bring back that feeling of stepping into a video store and seeing all the posters and cover art and having the thoughts of what the movies could be race through ones mind. I want to provide not only a place for old fans to get all nostalgic but also a place for NEW fans to experience what it was like being a genre geek in the 1980's. Imagine a place where you can not only rent and BUY VHS, DVD and Blu Rays of the best 1980's genre faire, but also a place to hang out with your friends and play old school Nintendo, Sega and Atari, To get involved in special geeky trivia nights, Karaoke nights AND enjoy special screenings of some of the best movies, Tv, and cartoons from the 80s and early 90s, not to mention Indie films from local and western NY filmmakers! I wanna LIVE in that place and I welcome you to join in the excellent party! 
  • What you're doing by donating is helping me bring my dream to life. Your contributions will help us launch and establish ourselves as the PREMIERE Retro 80's video and entertainment location. Will also be a dedicated home for Fright Rags kick ass Horror T-shirts! You will also be helping bring back the human to human in store contact and communication of like minded geeks and pop culture lovers who long to re live the times of spandex, big hair and radical media. Something that is real and tangible and a place that can be your home away from home. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

  • We need to raise 8,000 Dollars to get us up and running. This is to pay for up front fees for our location, to acquire our products and inventory such as videos, dvd and blu rays, posters, t-shirts, vintage movie and child hood memorabilia, toys, magazines, comics, etc...to furnish and decorate the establishment and to bring that old school feel. We plan to have an old school game area PLUS a screening area as well. We will need signs, Paint, carpets, all to help bring the 80's to life. 
  • Our perks are geared towards Indie horror film, 1980's swag and unique Merch for the store itself as well as becoming a member of the Creeping 80's Army! From Local Filmmakers to Fright Rags kick ass Horror Shirts! 
  •  
  • Everything raised will go towards the launch of this store and making sure it is the best and most unique place you have been to. If our goal is not met, all donations will go towards the most immediate  issues at hand, be it our store location and or gathering the decor and we will re-campaign and or find new avenues to ensure an epic opening! 

The Impact

This store has the potential to truly be a one stop shop for your nostalgic needs AND bring people together in a very fun and unique way. Grow a community of not only 80's fans but pop culture and genre fans as well. In the world we live in, a little more fun and unity is MUCH needed, and appreciated, wouldn't you agree? 

I can't do this without you. If you love the 80's, if you love your child hood and are as nostalgic about the things you held dear while growing up and want to express yourself in an environment that welcomes and champions the geek in us all, than PLEASE help make " It Crept From The 80's" a reality. 

Risks & Challenges

in a world that is moving fast and furious in so many ways, most of all tech and information, I personally think you need to step back and take a look at what helped make growing up so much fun. It was a simpler time and people trusted each other and enjoyed more for the pure fact of...ENJOYING something. Is it a risk to open up a video rental store in 2017, HELL YES IT IS, but sometimes you need to take a risk in life to make a dream a reality. This is also why Crept from the 80's won't simply be a video rental store. It will also be a place to buy 1980s and early 90's classics and obscure films on VHS, DVD and BLU RAY, a place for you to buy bits of your childhood through vintage toys, posters, t-shirts, etc...A place to interact with friends and fellow fans of genre in all aspects. A place to see films you may have never heard of or even knew existed that were made right in your home town and to experience movie, tv and cartoon marathons that will bring groups together and could create bonding and lasting friendships. Believe me, the risk is there but why be afraid to take the leap? You will never know until you try and remember what Doc Brown always said " if you put your mind to it, you can accomplish anything." or take what the little green Jedi said to Luke, to heart-" Do or do not, there is no try." I agree. Help me DO, won't you? 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's alright too. Help us spread the word. Post our campaign, Facebook page, Twitter, Instagram, what have you ALL over the place. Flyer around your area and let people know there is something very cool and wicked awesome on the horizon that they should be on top of. Everything helps.

story:
Galway Rock at Ballston Lake

Galway Rock Vineyard and Winery is a family owned and operated farm winery located in Galway, NY.  After growing grapes, making wine, and managing wineries for other folks, Kate and Ryan Taylor decided it was high time to move home and start their own winery.  With the generosity of our family, we were able to borrow land and a garage to start a pilot vineyard and small production area.  Having outgrown the garage winery that we started in three years ago, we are ready to spread out and set down roots.  After searching high and low we have found a property that we believe will yield great wines in a unique setting. 

The Project

We aim to open a tasting room at 998 Saratoga Rd in the Town of Ballston Lake.   The 1800 square foot building will be home to our tasting room and part of our winery while we grow.  This warehouse has an open floor plan that will give customers an opportunity to come in and enjoy a guided tasting with us while looking on at the production floor just beyond the tasting room.  We’ll be able to hold small parties and events in our tasting room, patio, and winery.  In the spring we will begin planting vines on the farm adjacent to the winery and tasting room.  With your generosity, we can turn this tired warehouse into a wonderful place where our customers can gather to experience the entire winegrowing process from grape to glass. 

The Site

The farm is situated on the slopes of Ballston Lake on its western shore and has a special significance to us because it is located in the heart of our community.  The property has recently been placed in the American Farmland Trust.  This means from this point forward the sole purpose of this land shall be farming.  Sloped lands within proximity to large bodies of water are wonderful places to grow grapes.  The lake will act as an air conditioner for our grapes on hot summer days and a heater for them on cool nights as they make their way from bud to berry.  The slope of the land will focus the sun's rays on our grapes so that they achieve maximum ripeness from all points in the vineyard. 

The Dream

Our dream is to plant a vineyard where over a lifetime the vines will mature from small twiggy cuttings into old gnarly vines that yield sweet aromatic grapes each fall.  This maturity along with the vineyard situation on Ballston Lake will translate into a sense of place, or terroir in our wine.  We want to be able to share this endeavor with our customers, whom we regard as friends and family.  We dream of tending to the vines through the seasons and years, holding harvest dinners, and barrel tastings.  This new property will open the door to our dreams and we hope you are there with us. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $10,000 over the next 30 days in order to fully transform this property.  We aren’t looking for free money, but rather want our friends and family to be the first to experience our dream with some entertaining events and packages.   Your contribution right now will help us stock up on the essentials so that we can create a unique experience right here in Ballston Lake.  We are truly grateful for the support you have shown us over the years and especially for your contribution.  As a way to say thanks, all the rewards we are offering are priced below our planned retail value.

How we will use the funds

  1. Purchase stemware and dining supplies so we all have something to eat and drink from
  2. Obtain a 20c license (food service license) so we can serve those awesome apps to pair our wine with
  3. Landscape the patio and plant a vegetable garden on the edge of the vineyard for fresh local treats in the summer time
  4. Paint the warehouse and build a welcoming front entrance, because we want everyone to feel welcome when visiting our family
  5. Hire key staff and get them trained before we open our doors
  6. Develop the winery space

Any additional money we raise will be put to use in the winery developing the space on the production floor and adding to our existing equipment.

What if we fall short of our goal?

If we fail to reach our $10,000 goal we won’t be deterred.  It may mean scaling back on our plans a bit and tackling some of our projects after we open.  You will just get to see the magic happen in slow motion.  Because we are offering a pre-sale on our events, tastings, and membership any perks you purchase will be delivered as promised. 

Risks & Challenges

The wine industry can be a risky business.  There are oodles of permits and licenses, wine to be made and grapes to be grown, and a huge number of other brands out there vying for shelf space.  Our approach to develop the brand first and focus on farmers markets and wholesale has put us in a unique position to hit the ground running.  We have the permits, our wines have won plenty of medals, and we are very grateful that our wine can be found on the shelves of over 40 wine stores in the capital region.  The most often asked question we get after “Galway, Galway?” is “When can I visit your tasting room?”   Sure, this is a huge step for us, but one that we are eager to take.  Over the years we have seen new wine businesses succeeded and fail.  We firmly believe that our one step at a time approach will win out over all the obstacles that my stand in our way. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You’ve made it this far, so you’re an awesome person!  We understand that some people cannot contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. 

  • Help us get the word out and tell your friends about our campaign.
  • Use the Indegogo share tools.
  • Share our page with your friends on Facebook and Instagram.
  • Find us at the farmers market, your local wine shop, or purchase our wines online to keep the momentum going! www.galwayrockwines.com, www.saratogasparkling.com, www.allpeptea.com.
  • Please come visit us when we open. We would love to meet you!

Help us get the word out and tell your friends about our campaign.

Share our page with your friends on Facebook and Instagram.
