story:
Cliquez ici pour la version française

About Wholistic Aroma 

Did you know that a woman is putting 515 toxic substances on her skin each day by using the average cosmetic? 

Thanks to Wholistic Aroma botanical ingredients and recipe online store, you can find everything you need to DIY your own 100% natural skincare. With NO DANGER for your skin & NO DANGER for your family, have a pure, safe and pleasant skincare experience.

But Wholistic Aroma is not just about cosmetic, it is also about having a whole positive impact thanks to your natural beauty!!!!

  • We provide pure natural ingredients for a safe beauty, From naturally rich vegetal oil, plants extracts to essential oils.
  • We commit to share our FREE recipes, FREE video tutorials and a PROFESSIONAL expertise.
  • We help the small and sustainable farmers around the world to produce quality ingredients and preserve the environment.
  • We give job and social integration opportunity to the invisible handicapped.
  • The user have a positive impact on the planet by using pure ingredients, chemical free, safe for our rivers, animals, and of course our future generations to come... 
See after the perks for more details on the project. 

How can you help us? 

By Pre-ordering with perks, you are enabling us to get Wholistic Aroma on the move. Here is the detailed list of the perks, please note these are non-contractual photos. 









What is www.wholisticaroma.com?

  • Select the cosmetic you want in our free recipes' book
  • Purchase all the ingredients and equipment listed in the selected recipe
  • Receive your personalized package in your cozy home. 
  • "DIY" your amazing skincare product following the free tutorials shared by our experts. 
  • Enjoy your 100% natural beauty products. 
  • Share your experience, questions and tips in our customers forum and be part of an amazing caring community for change. 

What can you DIY? 

Hand cream, soap, moisturizer, exfoliating scrub...you can do pretty much any skincare products with natural ingredients. 

What can you buy? 

Wholisticaroma.com will have a large variety of essential oils, botanical ingredients, tools & equipments, packaging & empty containers in order for you to custom make your own cosmetic.


BOTANICAL INGREDIENTS



TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT 


PACKAGING AND EMPTY CONTAINERS



Why is it Easy & Fun to DIY your natural cosmetic?

Because we believe that natural skincare should be easy and affordable for everyone, our experts will share with you a large variety of FREE recipes & FREE video tutorials to guide you through the process of DIY your own skincare beauty product. In addition, you will benefit from the Wholistic Aroma forum access to share your experience, questions and tips and to be part of an amazing caring community for change.

FREE RECIPES


FREE VIDEO TUTORIALS


CUSTOMER FORUM

Now have fun in your kitchen and be naturally beautiful 

               



Why buying with Wholistic Aroma? 


Economic opportunity for sustainable farmers 

By buying with Wholistic Aroma you give priority to small producers and sustainable farmers. Indeed, at Wholistic Aroma, we do the sourcing  by choosing the best quality ingredients with small sustainable farmers. 

  • It is better for the environment because their agriculture is sustainable
  • It helps them stay competitive on the market and earn a fair income. 
  • It helps keep the ancestral traditions and knowledge of their agriculture. 
        France in New Caledonia visiting a Vanilla plantation

Because France knows that we should have the best quality, she is committed to source the ingredients in the countries from which it is a specialty. For example, for the Cocoa, Tamanu and Vanilla, France has been sourcing in Vanuatu & New Caledonia while she lived in the South Pacific. For Lavender, France has been sourcing in Provence, South of France, her home country. She is such a passionate that she knows all the insights of lavender production, such as the differences an essential oil will have whether it is cultivated on the North or South versant of the mountain, etc. 

Anaïs & Anthony (happy) sourcing lavender in Provence


Helping a chemical free planet for:

YOUR HEALTH 

When you think about the number 515 it is quiet alarming. Do you remember, it is the quantity of toxic chemicals in the average cosmetic that a woman is using every day? 

When you know that all those products penetrate the skin all day long, circulates via the bloodstream and stays in your body for years...well, obviously, for your health and that of your children, you should use 100% natural skincare. 

And we do insist on 100% natural!!! 


THE ENVIRONMENT

By using only natural ingredients in your skincare, this means that all the water that goes out of your shower, in the streams, passing through the rivers and ending in the oceans will be harmless for the animals and the quality of the water. For example, with the micro beads, nobody suspected they were endangering many wildlife marine species until recently. What a shock, when the technologies and surveys revealed the truth about these small micro beads that could have been simply and easily replaced with natural ingredients. How long should we wait before discovering the next truth about toxic chemicals in our skincare? 

    


For an affordable and qualitative skincare

By purchasing natural ingredients and DIY your own skincare, you are paying 100% of the price for quality ingredients. 

By purchasing an average personal care product (even some "natural cosmetic") you are paying roughly 15% for the ingredients (to be large) and the remaining 85%  is going to marketing, R&D, etc. 

Would you rather nourish your skin with quality ingredients or marketing? 


Giving employment opportunity for invisibly handiccaped

Did you know that 19 million of the people who were defined as severely disabled are suffering from invisible illness in USA?

These people do not use a cane or any assistive device and may look perfectly healthy. What they need is to have flexible work hours and conditions because at some point they might not be able to go to work one day, but could totally be better the next day and totally operational.  


As France Engels, the founder, is what we call a Trigeminal Neuralgia Warrior, she is totally aware of the problem that many invisibly handicapped might encounter. Therefore the idea is to open positions to others with invisible illnesses thanks to a flexible work hours plan. 

By purchasing with us, you are also helping the community of invisible illnesses to keep a social and employment integration. 


Meet with Wholistic Aroma Team 

At Wholistic Aroma, it is a mother and daughter story. 

     France Engels, Founder and Master of Aromatherapy

France is PA-SSIO-NA-TE about aromatherapy, skincare and wellbeing. She started her career as an osteopath, taking care of humans and animals. She has always lived in the countryside and grew up in Provence in the South of France and has been using plants and aromatherapy for her wellbeing and that of her family. 

A few years ago she had a nerve injured in a surgery and since then is suffering from an invisible handicap. Because she is a warrior, she wants to combine her passion, her job, and bring hope and awareness to those in the same situation, therefore helping all the invisibly handicapped community. 

Her boost for inspiration is chocolate and... she has a lot of inspiration!!! 

     Anaïs Defort, Co-Founder and Product Manager 

Anaïs is the eldest of France's daughters, she is all about nature, well just like the rest of the family. She has a master in Business administration and a Diploma in Personal Care Development and Promotion so she is all about strategy and planning. 

She is definitely an overthinker. When we say think twice, Anaïs will think at least...hmm...ten times.

     Marc Rohr, Strategy Consultant

Marc is presently managing his dental clinic. He is a workaholic as much as an aromaholic… He cannot wait to get retired from his clinic to get involved in Wholistic Aroma. 

His first mission as a team’s member will be to be the chocolate provider (remember…our team’s inspiration)…but we all know he will do much more than that...

     Anthony Dupuis, Operation Specialist and Problem Solver

Anthony is the one who thinks outside the box. He worked for five years in supply chain management and is therefore the expert for all operations and workflow matters. 

He likes to work in the rush, so let's give him what he wants: orders, orders and orders 


Why we need your help? 

The money we are asking for would help us acquire our first inventory and get the online boutique going. 


Our timeline 


Let's make it whole 

Let's stand for Fair Natural Care 

Every bit of help means the world to us.

Spreading the word is key to helping us realize our goal:

Getting Wholistic Aroma off the ground and having a whole positive impact 

thanks to a 100% natural beauty. 




francais

A propos de Wholistic Aroma 

Saviez vous qu'une femme met 515 produits toxiques sur sa peau tous les jours en utilisant une cosmétique moyenne? 

Grâce à la boutique d'ingrédients botaniques naturels et recettes Wholistic Aroma, vous pourrez trouver tout ce dont vous avez besoin pour faire votre propre cosmétique maison 100% naturelle. Sans danger pour votre peau & sans danger pour votre famille, offrez-vous une agréable expérience cosmétique pure & et sûre. 

Mais ce n'est pas tout, Wholistic Aroma ne s'arrête pas simplement à la cosmétique, mais se veut avoir un impact positif global grâce à votre beauté naturelle!!!


  • Nous proposons des ingrédients naturels purs pour une beauté sûre. Des huiles végétales riches aux huiles essentielles et extraits de plantes. 
  • Nous partageons gratuitement nos recettes, tutoriels vidéo et notre expertise professionnelle. 
  • Nous aidons les petits producteurs et fermiers durables à travers le monde à produire des ingredients de qualité et à préserver l'environnement. 
  • Nous donnons l'opportunité à des personnes atteintes de handicap invisible de garder un emploi et une intégration sociale.  
  • L'utilisateur a un impact positif sur la planète en utilisant des ingredients purs, sans produits chimiques, sûrs pour nos rivières, animaux et bien sûr les futures générations à venir... 

Comment pouvez vous nous aider?

Grâce à vos pré commandes, nous pourrons lancer Wholistic Aroma. 

Merci de noter que les photos sont non contractuelles. 











Qu'est www.wholisticaroma.com?

  • Choisissez la cosmétique que vous voulez dans notre livre eRecettes gratuit. 
  • Achetez tous les ingrédients et équipements listés dans la recette sélectionnée. 
  • Recevez votre colis personnalisé dans le confort de votre maison. 
  • "Do It Yourself" vos produits et soins du corps en suivant les tutoriels fournis par nos experts. 
  • Profitez de vos produits de beauté 100% naturels. 
  • Partagez vos expériences, questions et astuces dans notre forum et faites partie d'une communauté du changement attentionnée. 

Que pouvez vous faire maison? 

Crème de main, savon, soin hydratant, soins gommants... vous pouvez quasiment faire tous les produits des soins du corps avec des ingrédients naturels.  

Que pouvez-vous y achetez? 

Wholisticaroma.com aura une très grande variété d'huiles essentielles, ingrédients botaniques, outils et équipements, emballage et contenants vides pour que vous puissiez faire votre propre cosmétique maison sur mesure. 

INGREDIENTS BOTANIQUES 

             

              

              

              

              


OUTILS ET EQUIPEMENTS 

 

EMBALLAGES ET CONTENANTS VIDES 


Pourquoi est-ce Facile et Ludique de faire vos propres cosmétiques? 

Parce que nous sommes convaincus que les soins du corps 100% naturels devraient être abordables pour tous, nos experts partageront avec vous une grande variété de recettes et vidéo tutoriels pour vous guider pendant toutes les étapes de réalisation de vos produits de beauté. De plus, vous pourrez partager votre expérience sur le forum et ainsi échanger sur vos trucs et astuces, questions et faire partie d'une communauté soucieuse de l'environnement. 

 eRECETTES GRATUITES  


FREE VIDEO TUTORIALS


CUSTOMER FORUM

Amusez vous dans votre cuisine et soyez naturellement belle. 

               


Pourquoi acheter avec Wholistic Aroma? 


Opportunité économique pour les fermiers en développement durables. 

En achetant avec Wholistic Aroma vous donnez la priorité à des petits producteurs et fermiers en développement durable. En effet, chez Wholistic Aroma, nous faisons le sourcing en choisissant les meilleurs ingrédients produits en développement durable et agriculture raisonnée. 

  • C'est meilleur pour l'environnement grâce à leur agriculture durable. 
  • Cela leur permet de rester compétitif sur le marché et de gagner un revenu juste. 
  • Cela aide à garder la connaissance et les traditions ancestrales de leur agriculture. 

France en Nouvelle Calédonie visitant des vanilleraies

Parce que France sait pertinemment que nous ne devrions utiliser que des produits de grande qualité, elle s'engage à sourcer les ingrédients dans les pays dans lesquels c'est la spécialité. Par exemple, pour l'huile de Coco, Tamanu et Vanille, France a trouvé des fournisseurs au Vanuatu et en Nouvelle Calédonie pendant qu'elle habitait dans le Pacifique sud. Pour la lavande, France a pris contact avec des producteurs Provençaux, dans son pays d'origine. Elle est tellement passionnée qu'elle connait toutes les déclinaisons et variétés de lavandes en fonction du lieu de la culture, du versant sud ou du versant nord de la montagne, etc. 

 Anaïs & Anthony faisant du sourcing (heureux) de lavande en Provence

Aider une planète sans produits chimiques pour :

VOTRE SANTE

Il est assez alarmant de penser au nombre 515. Vous rappelez-vous c'est la quantité de produits toxiques dans les cosmétiques moyennes qu'une femme utilise tous les jours sur sa peau? 

Quand on sait que ces produits pénètrent la peau durant toute la journée, voyagent dans la circulation sanguine et restent dans nos corps pendant des années...il est évident que pour notre santé et celle de nos enfants, nous devrions utiliser des soins du corps 100% naturels!!! 

                                          


L'ENVIRONNEMENT 

En utilisant uniquement des ingrédients naturels, cela signifie que l'eau qui sort de votre douche, passe par les cours d'eau, les rivières et finit dans les océans sera sans danger pour les animaux et la qualité de l'eau. Par exemple, avec les microbilles utilisées dans la cosmétique, personne ne soupçonnait à quel point elles étaient dangereuses pour de nombreuses espèces animales marines jusqu'à récemment. Quel choc, quand les techniques et études de marché ont permis de démontrer l'impact dangereux de ces microbilles qui auraient pu simplement et facilement être remplacées par des ingrédients naturels. 

Combien de temps devons nous attendre avant de découvrir la prochaine vérité sur les produits chimiques utilisés dans nos cosmétiques?  

                                          


Pour une cosmétique abordable ET qualitative 

En achetant des ingrédients naturels et en faisant votre cosmétique maison, vous payez 100% du prix pour la qualité des ingrédients. 

En achetant des produits de cosmétiques classiques, (même certains "naturels") vous payez environ 15% pour les ingrédients (en restant large) et le reste des 85% est dédié au marketing, R&D, etc. 
Préférez vous nourrir votre peau avec des ingrédients de qualité ou du marketing? 

Participer à des opportunités d'emploi pour des personnes atteintes de handicap invisibles. 

Saviez vous que 19 millions de personnes parmi celles à qui l'on a reconnu un handicap lourd souffrent d'handicap invisible aux Etas-Unis? 

Ces personnes n'utilisent pas de canne ou quoi que ce soit comme dispositif d'aide et peuvent paraitre parfaitement en bonne santé. 

Ce dont elles ont besoin ce sont des conditions et heures de travail flexibles car il peut leur arriver de ne pouvoir se rendre au travail un jour, mais pourraient totalement être mieux le jour suivant et opérationnelles pour aller au travail. 

                                                                

Comme France Engels, la fondatrice, est atteinte de névralgie du trijumeau, elle est totalement consciente du problème que beaucoup de personnes atteintes de handicap invisible peuvent rencontrer. Son idée est donc d'ouvrir des postes à d'autres personnes atteintes de handicap invisible grâce à un plan d'horaires de travail modulables. 

En achetant avec nous, vous aidez donc aussi la communauté de personnes avec handicap invisible à garder une intégration sociale et des opportunités de travail. 


Rencontrez l'équipe Wholistic Aroma  

Chez Wholistic Aroma, c'est une histoire Mère et Fille.

                                       


     France Engels, Fondatrice et Master en Aromatherapy

France est PA-SSIO-NNEE d'aromathérapie, bien-être et soins du corps. Elle a commencé sa carrière en tant qu'ostéopathe, s'occupant d'humains et d'animaux. Elle a toujours vécu à la campagne et a grandi en Provence, dans le sud de la France, où elle a toujours utilisé les plantes et l'aromathérapie pour son bien-être et celui de sa famille. 

Il y a quelques années, elle a eu un nerf endommagé pendant une intervention chirurgicale et souffre depuis d'handicap invisible. Comme c'est une battante, elle souhaite combiner sa passion, son travail et donner de l'espoir à ceux dans la même situation, aidant ainsi toute la communauté d'handicapés invisibles. 

Son boost pour l'inspiration est le chocolat...et elle a beaucoup d'inspiration!!! 


     Anaïs Defort, Co-Fondatrice et Chef de Produit

Anaïs est la fille aînée de France et elle est pro nature, en fait, tout comme le reste de la famille. Elle a un master en Business Administration et un diplôme Australien  de Chef de Produits en cosmétique et soins du corps. Elle est donc orientée stratégie et planification. 

Diriez vous qu'elle est très réfléchie? Hmmm...disons que certains la surnomme  "Calcul en Cours" de temps à autre!    


     Marc Rohr, Consultant Stratégie

Marc gère actuellement sa clinique dentaire. Il est un "workaholic" autant qu'un "aromaholic". Il a hâte de prendre la retraite de sa clinique pour s'impliquer chez Wholistic Aroma. 

Sa première mission comme membre de l'équipe sera de fournir le chocolat (souvenez vous...l'inspiration de l'équipe), mais nous savons tous qu'il fera bien plus que ça.  


     Anthony Dupuis, Spécialiste Opération et logistique 

Anthony est celui qui pense hors des sentiers battus. Il a travaillé pendant cinq ans en gestion logistique, il est donc l'expert en ce qui concerne les flux de marchandises.  

Il aime travailler dans l'urgence, donc donnons lui ce qu'il attend : des commandes, des commandes et des commandes.  

Pourquoi avons nous besoin de vous? 

Vos pré-commandes nous permettront d'acquérir notre premier inventaire et de lancer notre boutique en ligne. 


Chronologie  

Aidez nous à faire passer le mot

Nous chérissons chaque aide, petite ou grande. 

Faire passer le mot est cruciale pour nous aider à réaliser notre objectif : 

Lancer Wholistic Aroma et avoir un impact positif global grâce à une beauté 100% naturelle.

About Wholistic Aroma 

Did you know that a woman is putting 515 toxic substances on her skin each day by using the average cosmetic? 
Thanks to Wholistic Aroma botanical ingredients and recipe online store, you can find everything you need to DIY your own 100% natural skincare. With NO DANGER for your skin & NO DANGER for your family, have a pure, safe and pleasant skincare experience.

But Wholistic Aroma is not just about
cosmetic, it is also about having a whole positive impact thanks to your natural beauty!!!!





We provide pure natural ingredients for a safe beauty, From naturally rich vegetal oil, plants extracts to essential oils.
We commit to share our FREE recipes, FREE video tutorials and a PROFESSIONAL expertise.
We help the small and sustainable farmers around the world to produce quality ingredients and preserve the environment.
We give job and social integration opportunity to the invisible handicapped.
The user have a positive impact on the planet by using pure ingredients, chemical free, safe for our rivers, animals, and of course our future generations to come... 
See after the perks for more details on the project. 


How can you help us? 
By Pre-ordering with perks, you are enabling us to get Wholistic Aroma on the move. Here is the detailed list of the perks, please note these are non-contractual photos. 






















What is www.wholisticaroma.com?




Select the cosmetic you want in our free recipes' book
Purchase all the ingredients and equipment
listed in the selected recipe
Receive your personalized package in your cozy home. 
"DIY" your amazing skincare
product following the free tutorials shared by our experts. 
Enjoy your 100% natural beauty products. 

Share your experience,
questions and tips in our customers forum and be part of an amazing caring
community for change. 

What can you DIY? Hand cream, soap, moisturizer, exfoliating scrub...you can do pretty much any skincare products with natural ingredients. What can you buy? Wholisticaroma.com will have a large variety of essential oils, botanical ingredients, tools & equipments, packaging & empty containers in order for you to custom make your own cosmetic.
BOTANICAL INGREDIENTS












TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT 



PACKAGING AND EMPTY CONTAINERS



Why is it Easy & Fun to DIY your natural cosmetic?Because we believe that natural skincare should be easy and affordable for everyone, our experts will share with you a large variety of FREE recipes & FREE video tutorials to guide you through the process of DIY your own skincare beauty product. In addition, you will benefit from the Wholistic Aroma forum access to share your experience, questions and tips and to be part of an amazing caring community for change.

FREE RECIPES






FREE VIDEO TUTORIALS


CUSTOMER FORUM


Now have fun in your kitchen and be naturally beautiful 
               


Why buying with Wholistic Aroma? 



Economic opportunity for sustainable farmers 
By buying with Wholistic Aroma you give priority to small producers and sustainable farmers. Indeed, at Wholistic Aroma, we do the sourcing  by choosing the best quality ingredients with small sustainable farmers. 


It is better for the environment because their agriculture is sustainable
It helps them stay competitive on the market and earn a fair income. 
It helps keep the ancestral traditions and knowledge of their agriculture. 

        France in New Caledonia visiting a Vanilla plantation


Because France knows that we should have the best quality, she is committed to source the ingredients in the countries from which it is a specialty. For example, for the Cocoa, Tamanu and Vanilla, France has been sourcing in Vanuatu & New Caledonia while she lived in the South Pacific. For Lavender, France has been sourcing in Provence, South of France, her home country. She is such a passionate that she knows all the insights of lavender production, such as the differences an essential oil will have whether it is cultivated on the North or South versant of the mountain, etc. 

Anaïs & Anthony (happy) sourcing lavender in Provence


Helping a chemical free planet for:
YOUR HEALTH 
When you think about the number 515 it is quiet alarming. Do you remember, it is the quantity of toxic chemicals in the average cosmetic that a woman is using every day? 
When you know that all those products penetrate the skin all day long, circulates via the bloodstream and stays in your body for years...well, obviously, for your health and that of your children, you should use 100% natural skincare. 
And we do insist on 100% natural!!! 




THE ENVIRONMENT
By using only natural ingredients in your skincare, this means that all the water that goes out of your shower, in the streams, passing through the rivers and ending in the oceans will be harmless for the animals and the quality of the water. For example, with the micro beads, nobody suspected they were endangering many wildlife marine species until recently. What a shock, when the technologies and surveys revealed the truth about these small micro beads that could have been simply and easily replaced with natural ingredients. How long should we wait before discovering the next truth about toxic chemicals in our skincare? 



    


For an affordable and qualitative skincare
By purchasing natural ingredients and DIY your own skincare, you are paying 100% of the price for quality ingredients. 
By purchasing an average personal care product (even some "natural cosmetic") you are paying roughly 15% for the ingredients (to be large) and the remaining 85%  is going to marketing, R&D, etc. 
Would you rather nourish your skin with quality ingredients or marketing? 

Giving employment opportunity for invisibly handiccaped
Did you know that 19 million of the people
who were defined as severely disabled are suffering from invisible illness in
USA?
These people do not use a cane or any
assistive device and may look perfectly healthy. What they need is to have flexible work hours and conditions because at some point they might not be able to go to work one day, but could totally be better the next day and totally operational.  



As France Engels, the founder, is what we call a Trigeminal Neuralgia Warrior, she is totally aware of the problem that many invisibly handicapped might encounter. Therefore the idea is to open positions to others with invisible illnesses thanks to a flexible work hours plan. 
By purchasing with us, you are also helping the community of invisible illnesses to keep a social and employment integration. 


Meet with Wholistic Aroma Team At Wholistic Aroma, it is a mother and daughter story. 


     France Engels, Founder and Master of Aromatherapy
France is PA-SSIO-NA-TE about
aromatherapy, skincare and wellbeing. She started her career as an osteopath,
taking care of humans and animals. She has always lived in the countryside and
grew up in Provence in the South of France and has been using plants and

injured in a surgery and since then is suffering from an invisible handicap.
Because she is a warrior, she wants to combine her passion, her job, and bring
hope and awareness to those in the same situation, therefore helping all the
invisibly handicapped community. Her boost for inspiration is
chocolate and... she has a lot of inspiration!!!      Anaïs Defort, Co-Founder and Product Manager Anaïs is the eldest of France's daughters, she is all about nature, well just like the rest of the family. She has a master in Business administration and a Diploma in Personal Care Development and Promotion so she is all about strategy and planning. She is definitely an overthinker. When we say think twice, Anaïs will think at least...hmm...ten times.
     Marc Rohr, Strategy Consultant

Pour une cosmétique abordable ET qualitative 
En achetant des ingrédients naturels et en faisant votre cosmétique maison, vous payez 100% du prix pour la qualité des ingrédients. 
En achetant des produits de cosmétiques classiques, (même certains "naturels") vous payez environ 15% pour les ingrédients (en restant large) et le reste des 85% est dédié au marketing, R&D, etc. Préférez vous nourrir votre peau avec des ingrédients de qualité ou du marketing? 
Participer à des opportunités d'emploi pour des personnes atteintes de handicap invisibles. 
Saviez vous que 19 millions de personnes parmi celles à qui l'on a reconnu un handicap lourd souffrent d'handicap invisible aux Etas-Unis? 
Ces personnes n'utilisent pas de canne ou quoi que ce soit comme dispositif d'aide et peuvent paraitre parfaitement en bonne santé. 
Ce dont elles ont besoin ce sont des conditions et heures de travail flexibles car il peut leur arriver de ne pouvoir se rendre au travail un jour, mais pourraient totalement être mieux le jour suivant et opérationnelles pour aller au travail. 
                                                                
Comme France Engels, la fondatrice, est atteinte de névralgie du trijumeau, elle est totalement consciente du problème que beaucoup de personnes atteintes de handicap invisible peuvent rencontrer. Son idée est donc d'ouvrir des postes à d'autres personnes atteintes de handicap invisible grâce à un plan d'horaires de travail modulables. 
En achetant avec nous, vous aidez donc aussi la communauté de personnes avec handicap invisible à garder une intégration sociale et des opportunités de travail. 

Rencontrez l'équipe Wholistic Aroma  
Chez Wholistic Aroma, c'est une histoire Mère et Fille.

                                       

     France Engels, Fondatrice et Master en Aromatherapy
France est PA-SSIO-NNEE d'aromathérapie, bien-être et soins du corps. Elle a commencé sa carrière en tant qu'ostéopathe, s'occupant d'humains et d'animaux. Elle a toujours vécu à la campagne et a grandi en Provence, dans le sud de la France, où elle a toujours utilisé les plantes et l'aromathérapie pour son bien-être et celui de sa famille. 
Il y a quelques années, elle a eu un nerf endommagé pendant une intervention chirurgicale et souffre depuis d'handicap invisible. Comme c'est une battante, elle souhaite combiner sa passion, son travail et donner de l'espoir à ceux dans la même situation, aidant ainsi toute la communauté d'handicapés invisibles. 
Son boost pour l'inspiration est le chocolat...et elle a beaucoup d'inspiration!!! 

     Anaïs Defort, Co-Fondatrice et Chef de Produit
Anaïs est la fille aînée de France et elle est pro nature, en fait, tout comme le reste de la famille. Elle a un master en Business Administration et un diplôme Australien  de Chef de Produits en cosmétique et soins du corps. Elle est donc orientée stratégie et planification. 
Diriez vous qu'elle est très réfléchie? Hmmm...disons que certains la surnomme  "Calcul en Cours" de temps à autre!    

     Marc Rohr, Consultant Stratégie
Marc gère actuellement sa clinique dentaire. Il est un "workaholic" autant qu'un "aromaholic". Il a hâte de prendre la retraite de sa clinique pour s'impliquer chez Wholistic Aroma. 
Sa première mission comme membre de l'équipe sera de fournir le chocolat (souvenez vous...l'inspiration de l'équipe), mais nous savons tous qu'il fera bien plus que ça.  

     Anthony Dupuis, Spécialiste Opération et logistique 
Anthony est celui qui pense hors des sentiers battus. Il a travaillé pendant cinq ans en gestion logistique, il est donc l'expert en ce qui concerne les flux de marchandises.  
Il aime travailler dans l'urgence, donc donnons lui ce qu'il attend : des commandes, des commandes et des commandes.  


Pourquoi avons nous besoin de vous? 
Vos pré-commandes nous permettront d'acquérir notre premier inventaire et de lancer notre boutique en ligne. 



Chronologie  



Aidez nous à faire passer le mot

Nous chérissons chaque aide, petite ou grande. 
Faire passer le mot est cruciale pour nous aider à réaliser notre objectif : 
Lancer Wholistic Aroma et avoir un impact positif global grâce à une beauté 100% naturelle.

story:
Voluntarios en África, un sueño.

Somos Mónica,  Cecilia y Paco.  Cursando nuestro ultimo semestre de la carrera en la Universidad de Monterrey, México.




Un sueño nos une: Irnos de misiones a África.       

Viajar, conocer otras culturas y servir a los demás son las cosas que nos apasionan.

En el pasado hemos realizado misiones rurales y nacionales, sin embargo  ahora es uno de nuestros sueños poder ir mas allá en el servicio, realizando una misión internacional. 

Somos estudiantes y nuestros recursos son limitados. Es por esto que acudimos a las redes sociales, como medio para conseguir fondos y poder sustentar esta experiencia de vida.

El financiamiento que estamos pidiendo es de 15,000 m.x.n. (por integrante), que servirá para cubrir la mitad del vuelo a Zambia, África.

Por otro lado, estaremos realizando campañas en nuestra Universidad y comunidad para conseguir fondos,  vendiendo productos, como lo son camisetas, snacks y vinos de la región de Parras, Coahuila.

El que no vive para servir, no sirve para vivir. 


¡GRACIAS POR SU APOYO!


Volunteer in Africa, one dream.

Hi, we are Monica,  Cecilia, and Paco;  three mexican students, united for one cause, one dream: Volunteers in Africa!   

To service, to travel and meet other cultures are the things we are passion for.

In the past, we have made national and rural missions. Nevertheless,  this time we want to go farther, traveling to Africa in an international mission, combining all of our passions.

As students, our resources are limited. That is the reason we find in social medias a way to achieve our goal and be able to live this experience. The finance we  asking is $850 USD (per student), in order to pay half of the trip Monterrey-Zambia.

In other hand, we are making social campaigns in our University and community to get funds, selling t-shirts, snacks, and red wines from the community of Parras, Coahuila. 


Whoever doesn't live to serve, does not serve to live.


THANK YOU!

story:
Our Story

Hi Friends! We're Jeremy and Christy Lile and we're the founders of City Hope Akron - a community based mission in Highland Square. We have over 15 years of experience in community development and church work.  For the last three years, we've been on a really exciting journey with our friends and neighbors and we want to invite you to join us on the next path we are starting down through City Hope as we open The Grand Exchange: a place for the common good.

 The vision for The Grand Exchange is to create a third space for our community to come together to collaborate, create and (ex)change. It can best be described as an extension of our living room, kitchen, and backyard.  It is a place where the community can gather to live life together and enjoy a sense of belonging.

The Grand Exchange will host activities such as: tutoring, art classes, women's groups, dance classes,  summer kids programs, recovery groups, book groups, worship services, exercise classes, birthday parties, community meals, and more! 

Through your contributions, you will help us finish renovations to make the community center safe and useful.  We can't do this without you!   We're already touching hundreds of lives and we're excited about seeing things grow so that more people and places can be changed for the better! 


What We Need 

Here's where you come in! We need $30,000.00 to help get the space ready so that we can open it up to the community as quickly as possible.

We've already invested well over $30,000.00 into the building. However, we need to raise an additional $30,000 to get things ready for the grand opening this fall. 

Your support will help City Hope accomplish the following projects:

Floor Support - $1,000.00

New flooring downstairs and upstairs kitchen - $4,000.00

Lighting - $3,000.00

Heating and Air - $3,500.00

Furnishings and decor - $7,000.00

Cafe Counter and kitchenette - $4,000.00

Bathroom - $5,000.00

Stairs - $500.00

Paint (interior and exterior) - $2,000.00

And more! 

If we go over the $30,000 mark, we have plenty of other projects to work on too!


What you get

Check out the "Perks" for more details. 

$5 - a high five of gratitude from us next time we see you :-) 

$10 - Handmade thank you card from one of the City Hope Kids.

$20 - Handmade Jewelry from Rebka 

$50 - Deans Beans Coffee Exclusive City Hope Roast

$75 - Specially designed City Hope T-shirt 

$100 - Your name featured in the Grand Exchange Building and a City Hope T-shirt 

$150 - HOPE Pack: Coffee, T-shirt, jewelry, and featured name

$500 - Dinner (of your choice) with the Lile's and a take home gift  

$1,000 - Vocational Stewardship seminar  or individual consultation with Jeremy 

$1,500 - The Grand Exchange Event Rental  

$2,000 - Get Organized and Simplified 

 $3,000 - photo shoot session with Amy and Christy from Amy Lyn Photography (www.amylynphotography.com)  

$5,000 - Strategic Planning Event with top notch consultants. 

 

The Impact

Our cities need places for people to come together and find ways forward to see people and places flourish. 

We are already experiencing tremendous impact with everything operating out of a few peoples' homes. We are confident that a more permanent space will allow for greater growth and for more lives to be touched by the message that they are unique and have unique gifts to offer our world. Will you offer your financial gifts to help make this vision a reality? 


Risks & Challenges

We took a risk by stepping out on this journey, but the risk continues to bring fulfillment as the impact of City Hope and the people involved continues to grow throughout our neighborhood and city. 

Regardless of what challenges we face as individuals and a community, we will continue to face them together. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about The Grand Exchange: a Place for the Common Good by telling your friends on social media. It's easy! Just use the "share" tools on this campaign. 

We are always looking for volunteers and visionaries to help us with current programs or to envision new ways of using the space for the common good. Let us know how you would like to help: cityhopeakron@gmail.com  For example, we currently have nearly 40 kids involved in Kids Club each week. We could use some extra help :-)

story:
Short Summary

Who we Are

Pauline Williams (Artist) and Mitchell Goddin (Teacher) are lovers of sharing great food and fine wines.

Together we will build and operate the Treehouse Tapas and Wine Bar (in Pemberton, Western Australia) a social, ambient small bar venue set among the Karri forest, drawing on the  nature of sharing food and good times typical of the Spanish Tapas Bar culture.

Our Floor plan!

This is a 3D render of the floor plan.

While we are new to the small bar scene we are passionate about the quality local produce of our Southern Forest region. We are also eager to provide local residents with a friendly environment where they can pop in for a Tapa or two, a  chat and a drink. 

There is a growing buzz in the town and we feel that this is the perfect place and time to open a small bar for both locals and visitors alike.

Your assistance is crucial to helping us bring our dream venue to fruition. With your support we will open our place and seal the bar as the  community based venue it wants to be.

What We Need & What You Get

We are almost there!
We have an ideal venue in an ideal location, all we need a little help to fund the fit out of the amenities and plumbing and electrical works. After all when you visit we want you to feel as comfortable as possible!

Where do the funds go:

While work is well under way we need your help to finish off and open, so that we can show you the best that Pemberton has on offer. We aim the raise $13,000 to cover the construction of the amenities and venue plumbing. Your contributions will go towards the  costs related to the final stages of the fit out; predominantly building the amenities, plumbing and electrics.

Breakdown:

Construction                $1,300

Plumbing materials     $5,850

Electrical materials     $2,600

Plumbing Labour        $3250

Total                                $13,000

Mitch is completing the fit out and as you can see progress has been made (see video for more shots).

Mitch is also modeling the beanie we have on offer as Perk.

To show our appreciation we also have an apron available embroidered with our Treehouse logo. We also have a limited addition print!

A new perk, an amazing stirling silver and rhodolite pendant, kindly donated by Barbara Cotter, Western Australian Jeweller. See the featured perk for details. 

A successful campaign will complete our start-up. With your help we'll get there!

We thank you in advance for your help  and appreciate the confidence you have placed in us.  

 

Risks & Challenges

It’s no secret that opening a new business anywhere is risky and perhaps not for the faint-hearted. It would be easy to get lost in the challenges that such an endeavor might present – or it would if we did not have many years of experience and the support of business mentors behind us.  Having managed and built other people's businesses over the years, we have acquired the tools to meet any challenges.  Our management skills, enthusiasm, creativity, and passion, combined with our artistic sensibilities, will help us create a unique gathering place to enhance the recreational experience for residents and visitors.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to make a financial contribution but are still excited about making the Treehouse a reality, you can still have a huge impact! Please share this link in your social media pages:

Alternatively you can use the Indiegogo share tools.

Thank you very much for your support. Your contributions and interest in helping us make the Treehouse Tapas and Wine Bar a reality means a lot to us!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Bill Anthony, founder of Consumer Travel Seminars. But this story is not about travel. And it's not about me. It is about helping a Ugandan orphanage, which my friend Anja Tumert brought to my attention. In a country ravaged by AIDS, thousands of children have lost both parents and, too often, key members of their extended family. Although Mother’s Nest Orphanage was founded to help, and it certainly has, it is struggling. Its struggle is both to survive and to become self-sustaining.

Gerald Tugume answered the orphans’ cries for help by founding Mother’s Nest Orphanage. Having himself been orphaned as a young child, Gerald knows firsthand the profound sadness and horror of that condition. Chances are, it is a plight beyond your experience. Certainly, it is not within my experience. We can only imagine it. And the very thought is horrific.

Fortunately, a brighter picture can be painted and a happier, hopeful reality achieved. You and I can help clear the sky for the 130 orphans currently housed and educated by Mother’s Nest Orphanage in Uganda.

They have land. Friends of the orphanage are helping with the creation of a small farm.. Soon Mother’s Nest will be able to raise its own food. Some of the children have noteworthy crafts skills. Therein lies a source of income. Other ideas are being explored.

At this point, however, they struggle to have enough food and frequently fall short. Sanitation, also, is an issue. There is no plumbing, as we know it. Housing is grossly inadequate. Malnutrition and inadequate sanitation write a recipe for illness.  Medical care is frequently either unavailable or inadequate.

Nevertheless, all is not bleak. A dollar in Uganda buys much more in that country than in the USA or Western Europe. 130 children can be fed adequately for only $1500 per month. Mother’s Nest simply needs a little help from its friends. I am their friend. Perhaps you are too. If not yet a friend, please join me in extending a hand of friendship. If you have previously donated, please give a bit more. No donation is too small or too big. You may donate anonymously, if you wish. Let’s help our friends become self-sustaining.

What We Need & What You Get

Why $5,000 is our campaign goal:

  • $5000 US dollars is the monthly cost of adequate operation - just adequate, not optimum. Currently, funding is substantially inadequate.
  • $1500 is the cost of feeding the 130 children.
  • $2500 is needed for medical care.
  • $1000 covers educational materials and teacher salaries.
  • Donations of any size are welcome and truly help. In using PayPal, PLEASE DO NOT SELECT "SALE or PAYMENT." Choose "GIFT" or "FRIENDS AND FAMILY." This is to avoid having your donation treated as a commercial transaction, for which PayPal charges a fee.
  • You get the enduring gratitude of the orphans, staff and friends of Mother's Nest. There is also the priceless satisfaction of knowing you helped.

The Impact

Given adequate funding, stable progress can be made toward becoming self-sustaining:

  • Single-handedly, neither you nor I can save the world, but our collective contributions can make a tangible difference. 
  • Money from donations will be wired to Mother's Nest on a weekly or bi-weekly schedule. Given the urgency of the organization's needs, the bulk of funding raised will not be held until the end of this campaign.
  • Documentation of transmission and receipt of funds will be posted on this site after each transaction is completed.
  • At the completion of the campaign a full accounting of all funds raised and funds sent to Mother's Nest will be posted. 
  • This campaign's fundraising team is composed entirely of unpaid volunteers. 

Risks & Challenges

I see very little or no risk for us, the donors. It is the orphans who are at risk. The institution founded to help them cannot fulfill its mission without outside help.

  • Gerald Tugume, founder and director of Mother's Nest has proven his commitment. He has sold personal possessions and sacrificed in other ways for the sake of the orphanage, for the children who are so in need of help.
  • Gerald and his Board of Directors are as focused on having Mother's Nest become self-sustaining as they are on handling immediate needs. Balancing both aims is quite the balancing act. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is very much needed, but there are other ways you can help. Keep in mind, however, that even small donations of $10, $5, $2 and $1 are valuable. Probably, more valuable than you realize. Just a reminder: your donation can be anonymous. If you wish to remain anonymous, simply make that selection when donating.

Other ways you may contribute:

  • Help get the word out. Share this campaign with others - as many as possible.
  • Make good use of the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Donate needed products and services. Just ask what is needed.

So there you have it: everyone can contribute in some way. Please do so.

extending a hand of friendship. If you have previously donated, please give a bit more. No donation is too small or too big. You may donate anonymously, if you wish. Let’s help
our friends become self-sustaining.

What We Need & What You Get Why $5,000 is our campaign goal:  $5000 US dollars is the monthly cost of adequate operation - just adequate, not optimum. Currently, funding is substantially inadequate. $1500 is the cost of feeding the 130 children. $2500 is needed for medical care.
$1000 covers educational materials and teacher salaries.
Donations of any size are welcome and truly help. In using PayPal, PLEASE DO NOT SELECT "SALE or PAYMENT." Choose "GIFT" or "FRIENDS AND FAMILY." This is to avoid having your donation treated as a commercial transaction, for which PayPal charges a fee.
You get the enduring gratitude of the orphans, staff and friends of Mother's Nest. There is also the priceless satisfaction of knowing you helped.    The Impact Given adequate funding, stable progress can be made toward becoming self-sustaining:  Single-handedly, neither you nor I can save the world, but our collective contributions can make a tangible difference.  Money from donations will be wired to Mother's Nest on a weekly or bi-weekly schedule. Given the urgency of the organization's needs, the bulk of funding raised will not be held until the end of this campaign. Documentation of transmission and receipt of funds will be posted on this site after each transaction is completed.
At the completion of the campaign a full accounting of all funds raised and funds sent to Mother's Nest will be posted. 
This campaign's fundraising team is composed entirely of unpaid volunteers.     Risks & Challenges  I see very little or no risk for us, the donors. It is the orphans who are at risk. The institution founded to help them cannot fulfill its mission without outside help.  Gerald Tugume, founder and director of Mother's Nest has proven his commitment. He has sold personal possessions and sacrificed in other ways for the sake of the orphanage, for the children who are so in need of help. Gerald and his Board of Directors are as focused on having Mother's Nest become self-sustaining as they are on handling immediate needs. Balancing both aims is quite the balancing act.     Other Ways You Can Help Money is very much needed, but there are other ways you can help. Keep in mind, however, that even small donations of $10, $5, $2 and $1 are valuable. Probably, more valuable than you realize. Just a reminder: your donation can be anonymous. If you wish to remain anonymous, simply make that selection when donating.
Other ways you may contribute:  Help get the word out. Share this campaign with others - as many as possible. Make good use of the Indiegogo share tools!
Donate needed products and services. Just ask what is needed.   So there you have it: everyone can contribute in some way. Please do so.

story:
My Name is Jake Kleber, my wife and I started a comic book store three years ago out of a love of comic books and what comic books bring to people, joy. Comic books are one of the best tools available to parents and teachers to get children interested in reading and when your child is reading they are learning.

In this day and age books stores are becoming obsolete, closing on a daily basis and an important tool is being taken away from everyone, reading skills. There have been many tests and all results from these test, show that children when introduced to reading at a young age excel later on in life; comic books have the ability to draw in children and get them excited about reading! Help White Dragon Comics bring reading and fun to everyone!

Mom and Pop stores built this economy and it will be these same mom and pop stores that rebuild the economy. Join White Dragon Comics as they move forward bolstering the economy!

Any donation would be helpful; a purchase would also be helpful, you can purchase a comic book from our web-site at http://www.superherocomicbooks.com Comics start at only $2.99 if we could sell our back-stock of comic books this would enable White Dragon Comics to move into a store-front and bring joy to many, many readers.

White Dragon Comics will not stop fighting to get into that bigger location!! As a co-owner, with my husband, we have struggled with many issues, health and financial, and we have survived!! Throughout are difficulties we have never given up on that dream! We have kept our business going and thriving while facing astronomical difficulties; Mrs Dragon has beat cancer and depression, was fired from her job (due to missing to much time fighting said cancer), lost our home and buried very close family members. We are fighters! We will have the best Comic Book Store in History!! White Dragon Comics will be a destination! Fans will seek out our location! Come and be a part of this historical venture!

The money donated will go for rent (first, last and down payment) to get us in the store. The rest of the money is to bump up our inventory. If White Dragon can get into the store for one month we are confident we will be successful! Please help us keep reading and our dream alive!

Any money raised will be put in an account set-up specifiably for our all-important expansion and it will stay there until we have what we need! 

Thank you for any donation or purchase! Please share and help literacy stay alive!!

story:
Help Create Lasting Change!  Be part of transforming youth, families, and communities through Social Circus.

(Para Leer en Español Pincha en el Siguiente Enlace: )

http://www.performinglifebolivia.org/es/recaudar-fondas-indeigogo/

We need your help to raise $12,000 USD to expand our Social Circus programs and reach 50 new youth in 2015. From its outreach centers in 2015, Performing Life builds skills with youth and communities to overcome extreme poverty.

Each child in this program represents an average of 6 family members. Your contribution helps over 300 individuals to create a vibrant present and hope for the future! Please support this campaign to help youth help themselves and their families.

SHARE THE CAUSE! Join our IndieGoGo Campaign Event on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/1397178520604636/

Check out some of our Awesome Perks and take a look at the photos to see what we are offering for each contribution!

Help us reach more people by sharing our campaign on your Social Media accounts and make some noise for a good cause! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools! 

WHO WE ARE

Performing Life International, Inc. (Fundación enseñARTE) is a grassroots, nonprofit organization that empowers youth from some of the most impoverished areas in Bolivia by teaching them performance and visual arts as productive skills for avoiding drugs and delinquency while ensuring participants remain in school and have a stable place to live.  Since 2006, when the first class of six kids practiced juggling in a central plaza, PL has implemented free programs in social circus, music, educational enrichment, health, human rights, and microenterprise, helping over 3,000 youth and families create better futures through the arts.

Some of the kids we work with don’t even have the money to eat each day. One of the participants recently told us that the only time she eats a decent meal is at Performing Life. We also celebrate each child’s birthday since most of them, upon entering the project, didn’t even know their own age, let alone their birthday. These are just some of the ways in which we seek to improve the futures of kids in Cochabamba. Today,  the need for this lifeline out of poverty has never been greater.

The Story Behind the Organization:

Performing Life and Social Circus with Bolivian Street Kids

Performing Life was founded as so many nonprofits have been: by one individual recognizing a pressing need in the community and choosing to act.  For John Connell, Performing Life´s founder, this moment came soon after he first arrived in Bolivia in 2003.

“Hi, I’m John and I am the founder of Performing Life. I came to Bolivia after graduating high school at 16 and ended up deciding to stay. As would most naïve 16 year olds, I didn’t think about the long-term consequences of not getting on the plane home. I eventually ran out of money and had no place to live. With no money, no job, no return ticket home and a minimal knowledge of the Spanish language, I had to make ends meet however possible.  After a few weeks of living on the streets and sleeping on friends’ floors, I saw a kid juggling at a stoplight and thought, ‘Hey, I can do that!’

“Since the first day I started juggling I began to see my economic situation improving.  I rented a small room and got off the streets. Working on the streets, I experienced first hand many of the problems that affect child workers: hunger, drug abuse, violence, social exclusion, exploitation, and, in some cases, death.

“During that time, I got to know a lot of kids on a personal level, some of whom I am still in contact with, like Adalid and Escarlet (who you can see in the video). So I thought, ‘If some gringo who doesn’t even speak Spanish can make it in Bolivia, why can’t kids already living here do the same thing?’

“So in 2005 we started Performing Life to empower youth who live and/or work on the streets of Cochabamba, Bolivia by teaching circus skills to help them earn more money in less time, have more time to go to school, and, through our work with their families,  ensure that they have the chance to stop working and lead the life that every child deserves.”


WHAT WE OFFER

Performing Life is a haven from the street’s dangers and abuse, a safe, supportive environment where children and adolescents can be creative, develop self-confidence, enjoy a healthy meal, improve educational and social skills, and realize their full potential as valuable human beings.

Any youth between 6 and 18 years old may attend Performing Life’s free classes.  After one month, they can ask to join the program.  Following home visits, we sign contracts with youth and parents or guardians, outlining mutual responsibilities:

·  Circus arts training in a safe, supportive environment with quality equipment;

·  Respect for others, regular school attendance, and living in a stable situation;

·  Healthy meals after each class, prepared in our cafeteria;

·  Academic support, computer literacy, and scholarships to be the first family member to attend college;

·  Preventative dental care and access to health and social programs;

·  A Microenterprise Program that supports land purchases, home construction, education, and small business development; and

·  What every child deserves – opportunities for discovery, play, and growth in a creative, positive environment.

WHAT WE WANT

While helping 50 kids is great, we want to help MORE! But we need your help to make this project happen. In order for us to effectively help more kids and families, we need to establish two satellite offices in outlying areas of Cochabamba because so many of the most needy families can’t even afford the 25 cents it costs to get to the PL offices.  With this new project, we will serve over 10 different communities full of kids who want to experience the joy of circus.

In 2014, we completed a pilot project in outlying areas where over 100 new kids participated. By operating on a small budget and keeping staff to a minimum, we assure that the majority of funding goes directly to benefit the kids and their families.

Funding from this campaign supports creative activities four days per week reaching over 50 youth in two satellite locations:

· Schedule:  2:00 – 6:00 p.m. Tuesday through Friday.

· Activities:  Social Circus Classes, Educational Enrichment, and a Meal at the end of class.

·  Free monthly performances for communities and schools.

Youth learn performing skills such as juggling, diabolo, poi, aerial acrobatics, hand-to-hand acrobatics, improvisational theater, clowning, and more.  Check out some of their amazing circus acts in this video!

Basic costs for the two outreach centers are:

·  Stipends for Social Circus interns 16 and older who have at least four years training with PL;

·  Quality circus arts equipment for classes and performances;

·  Healthy meals from food purchased locally;

·  Part-time salaries for mothers to prepare meals in the cafeteria, providing them with stable employment;

·  Setting up two spaces for classes, cafeteria, outreach, educational enrichment, and parent meetings.

FUNDING FOR THIS CAMPAIGN WILL BE SPENT IN THE FOLLOWING MANNER:

DONATE NOW

We need your help to raise $12,000 USD to expand our programs to include over 50 new youth in our Social Circus programs.  All donations are Tax Deductible!

Your donation today makes a difference in the lives of disadvantaged youth inspired by Performing Life to create dignified lives and bright futures for themselves and their families.  The proceeds of this campaign build a framework for some of the poorest communities in the Americas to bring about dynamic change through solidarity and collective action.

BY DONATING, YOU NOT ONLY HELP BOLIVIAN YOUTH BUT ALSO RECEIVE SOME OF OUR AWESOME PERKS! CLICK HERE FOR MORE INFORMATION

All Donors Receive: A heartfelt thank you letter and performance photo e-mailed from PL/FE.  Any questions regarding these perks can be sent to info@performinglifebolivia.org.

WHY IS IT SO IMPORTANT?

The Streets of Bolivia

Bolivia has the highest poverty rate in South America, with two-thirds of its 10 million people living in poverty.  Nationally, almost 900,000 children live and/or work on the streets in dangerous, degrading conditions.  The population of homeless, abandoned, and extremely poor children is exploding as hundreds of thousands of indigenous families migrate from the countryside into illegal settlements surrounding urban areas.  Extreme economic difficulties lead to children as young as 4 working long hours to support themselves or contribute to supporting their families.

Social Circus is a transformative tool, a lifeline for street kids to create solidarity, mutual support, and collective action for success.  Studies have documented that regular participation in circus arts improves educational attainment and enhances social skills such as self-confidence and group cooperation.  Social Circus engages youth with analyzing their present realities; communicating with parents, local governments, schools, and leaders; connecting with resources; being responsible participants in their own education; and creating positive futures.

Just take a look at our results so far!

Performing Life outcomes since 2006:

·  All participating youth are living with their families or in youth homes.

·  All are attending school regularly and have improved their grades. 

·  At least 90 percent are no longer working on the streets or in dangerous jobs.

·  Youth have strong social ties, helping each other and forming positive peer groups.

·  Youth are leaders in communities and Bolivian youth movements.

·  Youth are awarded scholarships to study English at the Bolivian-American Center. 

·  Youth are graduating from high school and entering university. 

·  Older youth are employed as instructors, training the next group of leaders.

·  20 youth instructors and performers participated in a series of Social Circus development programs with internationally renowned organizations such as Cirque du Monde and the Incandescence Circus Theater Company. 

·  22 songs written and composed by youth in the Music Program were signed by Heavy Hitters Music, international agents for media productions. 

·  Youth in the microenterprise program have savings to use for educational expenses, small businesses, and building safe, decent homes.

·  Several mothers have dignified jobs with PL, earning much-needed income.

·  Three PL instructors were contracted for a week-long Artist Residency in an Idaho public school, sharing youth accomplishments and Bolivian culture with an entire community.

·  Over 200 free performances, concerts and events have been presented throughout the Cochabamba area.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • SHARE THE CAUSE! Help us reach more people by sharing our campaign on your Social Media accounts and make some noise for a good cause! Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
    • Join our IndieGoGo Campaign Event on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/events/1397178520604636/
    • Visit our Website: www.performinglifebolivia.org
  • Sign up for our Monthly Newsletters by visiting our Facebook Page and entering your email here: https://www.facebook.com/PerformingLifeBolivia/app_100265896690345
  • Read our Latest Annual Report: http://www.performinglifebolivia.org/news/read-the-2014-annual-report/
  • Volunteer with Performing Life and experience our projects first hand.
  • Stay in touch! Contact us about other ways you can help.
    • John Connell – Info@performinglifebolivia.org
    • Marye Dijkstra – Marye@performinglifebolivia.org

story:
Our kitchen to your plate!

We spend half of our weekends in the kitchen, making breakfast and dinner. We've made recipes healthier and tastier, and want to fully commit to our Food Truck.

  • Tracy owned and operated her own Bakery for the last five years. It's grown to year-round orders on top of special-order holiday cakes and treats.
  • Angelo creates full-flavored chili, pasta, chicken and other crowd pleasing entrees. He's worked in food service for eight years. 

  • We've always wanted to open a restaurant, but felt the commitment too high. A Food Truck would give us the opportunity to fulfill that goal and better balance (suit our) our lifestyle.

  • we want to share with a larger crowd to share our tastes and improve our recipes. Through potlucks and family holidays, family and co-workers feedback we've realized it's time to start sharing.

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • $75,000 for used Food Truck (all equipment and HVAC)
  • $3,000 for inspections, registration and permits
  • $2,500 POS system
  • $800 for a basic paint job
  • We have all kinds of perks for every level of donation.
  • If full funding is not reached, it will delay our start, but not stop it.

The Impact

Have you ever found that you've forgotten to bring lunch to work? Our truck will come to you with a daily standard menu and additional new items daily. Gluten-free and sugar-free entrees with some healthy options, as well. We will be using fresh local veggies to cook with and will give all unsold items to local shelters.

We both have worked in the food service industry and always enjoyed cooking and baking. This is our first campaign and our chance to share our wonderful creations!

Risks & Challenges

There is a lot to do yet. We have to secure funding, file paperwork, purchase, paint and customized our truck.We don't give up; we adapt and move forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can donate, but you can help us by getting the word out and sharing our link

Our kitchen to your plate! We spend half of our weekends in the kitchen, making breakfast and dinner. We've made recipes healthier and tastier, and want to fully commit to our Food Truck.  Tracy owned and operated her own Bakery for the last five years. It's grown to year-round orders on top of special-order holiday cakes and treats.
Angelo creates full-flavored chili, pasta, chicken and other crowd pleasing entrees. He's worked in food service for eight years.  We've always wanted to open a restaurant, but felt the commitment too high.
A Food Truck would give us the opportunity to fulfill that goal and better
balance (suit our) our lifestyle.
we want to share with a larger crowd to share our tastes and improve our
recipes. Through potlucks and family holidays, family and co-workers feedback we've realized it's time to start sharing.
   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  $75,000 for used Food Truck (all equipment and HVAC)
$3,000 for inspections, registration and permits
$2,500 POS system
$800 for a basic paint job We have all kinds of perks for every level of donation. If full funding is not reached, it will delay our start, but not stop it.    The Impact

Have you ever found that you've forgotten to bring lunch to work? Our truck will come to you with a daily standard menu and additional new items daily. Gluten-free and sugar-free entrees with some healthy options, as well. We will be using fresh local veggies to cook with and will give all unsold items to local shelters.

We both have worked in the food service industry and always enjoyed cooking and baking. This is our first campaign and our chance to share our wonderful creations!   Risks & Challenges
There is a lot to do yet. We have to secure funding, file paperwork, purchase, paint and customized our truck.We don't give up; we adapt and move forward.   Other Ways You Can Help
We know not everyone can donate, but you can help us by getting the word out and sharing our link

story:
The Little Shop of Vintage Pictures - Pic your costume! Be all you can be!

Hello, Dear Reader!

I am a late starter, 52 years old Hungarian woman who lives in the most beautiful part of the planet: Dingle Peninsula, County Kerry, IRELAND. I moved here less than a year ago, because of my longing to the sea and the mountains. I am a professional Orthopaedic massage therapist (www.achebusters.ie), but to build a clientele takes years. On the verge of being homeless, I had an entrepreneurial idea. 

I would like to bring the playfulness out of the tourists of Dingle town, and let them pretend they are Irish. Traditional Irish clothes and mythical costumes are needed and with my borrowed Nikon D80 good photographs will be taken. The pictures can be owned on the original SD card, copied on a disk and/or printed, of course. 

It is fun and it works very well in America: just check out Paul Gunn's Studio in Canada, or Oldtimephotos.org!

Dingle is very interesting place and a world class destination; but it does not hurt to have another attraction, for the rainy days...:-)

So simple, isn't it?

Well, in March I have taken out a loan of 1600 Euro, leased a small commercial unit on an excellent location, have it painted, have a mural painted for a backdrop, new lights, curtains, borrowed a camera and tripod, rented theatrical and party costumes for two months, printed 5000 flyers and spreading. I know, this business does not rely on returning customers: continuous advertising is vital.......

 But by now I have run out of money. And the tourists are still not coming....

The hardship of finding costumes, quality, usable costumes, fitting at least 3 or more sizes, male and female, and not to mention the children sizes, dawned on me after one month intensive looking and searching. 

It turns out, the costumes must be custom made, with open back, fit over the street clothes, approximately USD 300 for a piece.

So, the life of this enterprise now in your hands (emotional blackmail warning!), because the tourist season will start in June and without costumes all my efforts will be useless. 

6000 USD buys 20 costumes: 

2 Leprechaun, 2 Leprechauness, 

2 St. Patricks, 2 Goddesses,

2 Irish dancer girl, 2 boy, 

2 Leprechaun boy, 2 girl, 

2 Victorian female, 2 male.

The traditional Irish clothes can be found in charity shops.

These are the minimum requirements to make it work. And I still will be in trouble, if a Hen party wants to dress up as Leprechaunesses...:-)

If some money left, it goes on props (musical instruments, spin, hats, decoration), backgrounds (150 a piece, custom printed), and a real good photo printer (starts at 1000). (Right now I have a Lexmark 4650 :-)

Also I would like to print a leaflet: "About Leprechauns and Fairies". I have found very interesting, hardly known facts about them on the internet and in local bookstores. (Just for a taste: There is no such thing as a female Leprechaun.) Thus lightly educate the visitors from other countries.

It will be a great adventure! 

Please, help me to prepare properly until the tourist season kicks in in June-July-August.

Every contribution is appreciated and deserves a special Irish perk. If you don't find anything you like, you may ask!

If you can't afford any money, your help with forwarding this page to all your contacts would be priceless...

https://www.facebook.com/PaddyPortrait?ref=profile
