story:
WHAT IT'S ALL ABOUT: 

How far has your food traveled to get on your plate? How many people have handled it before it got there? What is the nutritional value by the time it enters your body? The answers to these questions are probably a lot worse then you thought, but we have found a solution! Revolution United and Utah Eats have united local businesses, farmers, governments and chefs together with you, the people, to create the People's Choice Food Hub here in Salt Lake where affordable organic food can be purchased, prepared, learned about and eaten.

Here is what will be included in the Food Hub:

  • Food and Food Business Education
  • Community Supported Commissary Kitchen
  • Organic Cafe
  • Locally Sourced Market with Urban Gardening Resources
  • Aquaponic and Rooftop Gardens
  • Special Events

Why We Need a Food Hub in Salt Lake City

There are several reasons why a Food Hub is needed in our city, including:

  • Limited access to affordable local food.
  • Community interest about how to properly and in a timely manner learn to grow, cook, prepare and store healthy food.
  • Lack of a central hub for urban and aquaponic gardening education and resources.
  • Large quantities of waste produced by local food businesses who are unaware of the savings that could be implemented by going green.
  • An absence of socio-ecominic investment into local businesses.
  • Local farmers and artisans with no yearly access to a secure outlet for their products and produce.

The Details

The Commissary Kitchen "the heart":

  • Specifically designed areas of the kitchen can be rented out to cater to different food entrepreneurs needs such as gluten free, vegan, kosher, baking, etc.
  • A large area will be dedicated to the various educational classes which will be taught throughout the year including urban gardening start up, aquaponic systems and how they work, how to prepare food within limited time frames, the importance of a healthy diet, etc.
  • It will be a perfect spot for food trucks to prep, be stored, and handle waste.
  • Classes and local chefs will produce weekly meals and products to be sold and picked up at the market and cafe.

The Market "the mind":
  • Every single item in the market will be local, organic, and full of the nutrition they are meant to have! 
  • Kombucha, ice cream, mushrooms, fermented veggies, etc will be made in our kitchen and sold in the market. No longer will your processed food have traveled thousands of miles and lost nutritional value to get to your plate!
  • You will be given the education to learn how to grow your own urban gardens and then be able to walk over to our market and buy all of the resources you have been taught to use.
  • It will supply affordable ingredients for the food entrepreneurs to help them move to a more sustainable and organic direction.

The Cafe "the soul":
  • The cafe will be the forefront and introduction to the operation where you will be able to sample some of our foods, buy pre prepared non processed meals, and speak with knowledgeable employees who can briefly answer any of your questions.
  • The modern industrial design will be crucial in providing a laid back and peaceful environment for our patrons to hang out and meet other like minded people, enjoy our organic food and beverages, and just have a place to relax.

      

About the Organization

Revolution United is a human centered 501(c) 3 nonprofit organization inciting a fundamental change in the way humans engage their communities in all sectors of life. Our mission is to develop open source projects utilizing inclusion, innovation, collective impact, and the desire for holistic well-being. We unify the individuals, non-profits and businesses to make it happen.  

How it works:
1. Citizens propose a project that benefits the community.
2. The public collectively votes on which project to develop.
3. We create the network of people, organizations, and businesses to make it happen.

Where the Money Goes

We have diversified our fundraising strategy by seeking $350,000 in grants from the city, $250,000 in small business loans, and lastly $50,000 utilizing crowd funding and crowd sourced micro lending.

The $50,000 we receive from this campaign will be utilized for the market and the cafe specifically.

Profits will be divided evenly three ways:

Perks and Crowd Sourced Micro-Loans

We want to develop win win win situations with the food hub. You win, the community wins, and the food hub wins. This will be done through perks given through this campaign and our profit distributions.

Project Timeline

Every Sunday starting now, June 28th - August 22nd, a pot luck will be hosted by a member of the team at 7 pm, at a few given locations.

· Wednesday, July 22nd: Idea Silo/ Community Feedback

·  Friday July 24th: Art Auction Fundraiser

· Wednesday July 29th: Movie Night Fundraiser at Brewvies

· Wednesday, August 12th: Block Party BBQ/Pop up Market

· Sunday, August 16th: End of 1stpublic fundraising campaign

· Monday August 31st: Specific date and location for kitchen solidified

· Month of September: Remodel design phase

· October - December: Construction

· August - December: Micro Loan phase

· January 2016: Open the incubator kitchen and café

·  May 2016: Open the market

Partners

We have accumulated several local food businesses, farmers, and artisans so far who are very interested in contributing to our food hub. These include Biocentric Brothers, Local First, Bug Farms, Wasatch Community Gardens, Squatters, Artists for Local Agriculture, Onsen Farms, Herb’n Organics, and Salacia Farms.

This list is quite extensive thus far and will hopefully continue to grow with your support.

                                            

FAQ's

Going Green: How will that work?

In general, the idea behind having the kitchen, market, cafe and gardens as a whole entity will be the key in keeping things green all around. For example, food items that are about to be unusable in the cafe or market will be used for the cooking classes, while wasted food from the cafe can be composted for use in the gardens. The market will also use limited to no packaging, as that is a key item that ends up in your trash. Recycling will also be used whenever possible and classes will provide insight on waste management for food entrepreneurs looking to keep their businesses green while saving money at the same time.

The Kitchen:

What will the hours of the kitchen be?

Our commissary kitchen we be accessible 24/7 as long as prior notice is given so we can make sure you have a key card and someone there to help out in case you need it. 

How can I make sure no one else uses the food I store at the commissary kitchen?

Our walk-in refrigerator and freezer will have caged shelf dividors to make sure each food vendor has their own locked area for storage. This not only ensures no one else uses your food but also makes sure there is no cross contamination.

Can pre existing businesses also use the commissary kitchen?

Yes, absolutely! Anyone who needs to rent the space they need can do so.

Will I be responsible for cleaning the kitchen after I use it?

Yes you will be required to do so. We will provide the cleaning supplies but since it is a community kitchen we will require everyone to be responsible for their own mess. Failure to do so could result in suspension of use for the kitchen.

Will I need to provide my own food items for the food I intend to cook in the kitchen?

Yes you will, but as soon as the market opens you will be able to purchase anything you run out of or may have forgotten right next door! At your convenience.

Can I bring my child/children to the community education classes?

For the classes where engaging your kids is part of the curriculum they are very welcome, and age specifications will be posted with each course. There will also be classes specifically for other age groups including adolescents, teens, adults, etc.

The Cafe:

What will the hours of the cafe be?

For now the hours will be a regular morning to mid evening shift, so roughly 6 am to 6 pm depending on the day of the week. As business grows so will our hours.

Will all food and drinks in the cafe be local organic?

Yes, and that will never waiver. The transparency of our market and business model will give you the ability to see for yourself as well because these days you can never be too careful. In fact, we encourage you to be thorough, not just with us, but with any other food business.

Can I purchase ingredients from the market that are used in food items for the cafe?

Yes, and you can also learn how to cook them in one of our community classes! That is part of the beauty of having them all linked together.

The Market:

Why is the market opening later then the cafe and kitchen?

The kitchen and cafe will be launched in January, and because the market will be selling mostly produce and foods from local farmers, it is more sound to open it during their harvest season. The market will have a soft opening with the kitchen and cafe, selling a few items here and there but will be fully open in May of 2016. We are aiming to keep it open year round afterwards with the use of our vertical gardens and aquaponic systems.

If I find an item I love to use in the kitchen, can I purchase it in the market?

Yes, with a few small exceptions here and there when it comes to very large items, which we will sell smaller versions of instead. 

Will you be selling recipes used in classes in case I don't want to take them or miss one?

Yes, the market will be stocked with local updated cook books from chefs around Salt Lake City.

Also, wtf is a mycologist?

Someone who deals with fungus. So, grows mushrooms really. Yum :)

                                       

If you have any other questions or concerns, please email Tara Danneman, the project director, at tara@revolutionunited.org, subject FAQs.

story:
Ollie has just turned 1. He has Down Syndrome and a poorly heart.

Ollie was taken into Birmingham Children's Hospital Sunday afternoon to prepare him for his heart operation on Monday 18th May, but unfortunately Ollie suffered a collapsed lung on Sunday night. He is now on a ventilator, which is breathing for him.

His mommy and daddy would like his name engraved on a silver star that will be on the wall of the intensive care unit. The stars cost £200.

Any extra money we raise will be donated to a charity chosen by Ollie's parents.

Any extra money we raise will be donated to a charity chosen by Ollie's parents.

story:
There is an important goal of Karmakhameleon -- to generate good karma and positive change for global kindness; a major necessity in our current time, for the betterment of our collective future. 

KarmaKhameleon; sustainable music & lifestyle events for positive change is a new event platform crafted to serve as a catalyst opportunity to awaken and elevate positive social behavior.

As we look around, we are all seeing firsthand, a great need for kindness toward our fellow humankind; a major necessity in our current time, for the betterment of our collective future. 

Staying true to the mission to stimulate a worldwide cultural shift, cultivating positive social behavior through collective social consciousness, music and education, Karmakhameleon has been built on a non-profit platform to keep our vision on serving others and supporting key partners. 

As a startup organization fiscally sponsored by a non-profit arts service organization, Fracture Atlas, allows the opportunity to raise tax deductible donations to realize our mission, under 501(c)(3) status.

In research, planning and development for close to 9 months, we are now at a significant turning point to execute our mission and we ask with earnest, that you visit our website www.karmakhameleon.info for more information and all available donor perks when consider making a tax deductible donation. Note: only select perks are featured here through IndieGoGo and all donor packages are featured at www.karmakhameleon.info/donate.

With over twenty-five years of my own professional experience in marketing and concert promotion, I have carefully assembled an executive team with significant live event experience, corporate knowledge, and high levels of social consciousness. Together we will successfully produce long-term, professionally run, high-quality Karmakhameleon music and lifestyle events aimed at helping to make our planet a more peaceful and kind and supporting place, for all to live.

Karmakhameleon's launch event will be our signature and inaugural music, lifestyle and camping festival, expected to take place in summer 2016 upon full funding, at a beautiful, upstate New York, serene setting within close proximity of the metropolitan area and each donation will support these production, operation, talent and required event expenses.

Our mission has been created as a community based event, for the community and we kindly ask the global community to help Karmakhameleon realize its mission and reach its launch budget goals, by considering a donation today.

Your generous support is greatly appreciated at this crucial time, and we thank you in advance for your time and interest in Karmakhameleon.

Other Ways You Can Help:

·  Share our campaign through conversation plus your social media networks and email using the indiegogo share tools at the top left-hand side of the screen.

·  Let us know if your company has a donor matching program that can be considered.

·  Sign up to receive our e-newsletter at www.karmakhameleon.info/contact

·  Get involved as an Ambassador by emailing us at contact@karmakhameleon.info (be sure to include Ambassador in the subject line)

·  Email us at any time with questions at contact@karmakhameleon.info 

·  Spread and encourage good Karma everyday!

                                             ----------------------------------------
story_txt: There is an important goal of Karmakhameleon -- to generate good karma and positive change for global kindness; a major necessity in our current time, for the betterment of our collective future. KarmaKhameleon; sustainable music & lifestyle events for positive change is a new event platform crafted to serve as a catalyst opportunity to awaken and elevate positive social behavior.As we look around, we are all seeing firsthand, a great need for kindness toward our fellow humankind; a major necessity in our current time, for the betterment of our collective future. Staying true to the mission to stimulate a worldwide cultural shift, cultivating positive social behavior through collective social consciousness, music and education, Karmakhameleon has been built on a non-profit platform to keep our vision on serving others and supporting key partners. As a startup organization fiscally sponsored by a non-profit arts service organization, Fracture Atlas, allows the opportunity to raise tax deductible donations to realize our mission, under 501(c)(3) status.In research, planning and development for close to 9 months, we are now at a significant turning point to execute our mission and we ask with earnest, that you visit our website www.karmakhameleon.info for more information and all available donor perks when consider making a tax deductible donation. Note: only select perks are featured here through IndieGoGo and all donor packages are featured at www.karmakhameleon.info/donate.With over twenty-five years of my own professional experience in marketing and concert promotion, I have carefully assembled an executive team with significant live event experience, corporate knowledge, and high levels of social consciousness. Together we will successfully produce long-term, professionally run, high-quality Karmakhameleon music and lifestyle events aimed at helping to make our planet a more peaceful and kind and supporting place, for all to live.Karmakhameleon's launch event will be our signature and inaugural music, lifestyle and camping festival, expected to take place in summer 2016 upon full funding, at a beautiful, upstate New York, serene setting within close proximity of the metropolitan area and each donation will support these production, operation, talent and required event expenses.Our mission has been created as a community based event, for the community and we kindly ask the global community to help Karmakhameleon realize its mission and reach its launch budget goals, by considering a donation today.Your generous support is greatly appreciated at this crucial time, and we thank you in advance for your time and interest in Karmakhameleon.Other Ways You Can Help:·  Share our campaign through conversation plus your social media networks and email using the indiegogo share tools at the top left-hand side of the screen.·  Let us know if your company has a donor matching program that can be considered.·  Sign up to receive our e-newsletter at www.karmakhameleon.info/contact·  Get involved as an Ambassador by emailing us at contact@karmakhameleon.info (be sure to include Ambassador in the subject line)·  Email us at any time with questions at contact@karmakhameleon.info ·  Spread and encourage good Karma everyday!                                             ----------------------------------------

story:
Deepin is from the one of the remotest part Darjeeling in north east India. He is the sole bread winner in his family.  He moved to Bangalore (about 2500 kms away from home) about five years ago and was doing odd jobs from then on.

It was by change that his friends tasted the MOMO he had prepared at his single room home. All of them exclaimed with joy and strongly suggested that he open up a shop and sell these lovely lip smacking MOMOs.

From then on it was no looking back, for the last 3 years Deepin has sets his shop every morning on the pavements of Koramangala in Bangalore.

Life is not smooth in these pavements, after preparing MOMOs all morning and carrying all the wares to his 4 feet by 4 feet spot he has to deal with issues like goons, cops and other natural elements. From his earnings he has to share and bribe the local tugs and cops so that he can be allowed to do business the next day.

Deepin knows what he is doing is no according to the law and would love to move over to a brick and mortar shop in the vicinity. Lead a life by obeying the law and get rid of the daily hassles.

Deepin has identified the shop and how he would like to go about it. He is short of about 5,00,000 Indian rupees or roughly 9000 dollars.  Deepin seeks your support to make one of his dream come true and make people love him more.

story:
Beagard activity service

Beagard activity collar creates a deeper connection between you and your best friend. It helps you to understand your friends' real needs and even prevent future injuries.

Today, dogs suffer from similar lifestyle related illnesses as we humans do. Some dogs suffer from inactivity while others spend most of their time in agility training. Both can be harmful if the dogs welfare is not correctly understood – so ensure your friends wellbeing day and night. With the Beagard activity collar and mobile application you can balance your friends' activity and calorie intake, set short and long-term goals and share activity & achievements with friends, and when needed, with a vet.

The activity collar

We focus on design and usability of both: the collar and mobile application. Our service fits both companion dogs and highly active sport dogs. Both appreciate the iconic design and easy usability of the collar. The collar is water and dust proof, and naturally, easy to keep clean. Beagard activity collar runs for months with one coin battery, so you can forget the daily/weekly charging of the activity meter.

Beagard on media

• Beagard featured on Digital Trends

• Beagard featured on Gray Cut



Currently we are running a beta version of the service and activity collar. It takes approximately two months to finalize the service and technology and few months to ramp up the production. Our aim is to ship first activity collars during second half of 2015. Tooling required in collar production, parts purchase and other manufacturing-related costs form the biggest need for funding.

Beagard application is available for iOS and Android (pics above are from beta version).

Our team is an excellent mix of technology developers, service designers, industrial designers and sourcing specialists as well as brand and marketing professionals. Naturally, our team members have vast experience on dog breeding, training, nutrition and activity related topics.


What do you get with your support?

With Beagard T-shirt ($39) you can show that you are connected with your dog and you want to understand each other better.

Activity collar for early birds for $99. Note, it is not just a separate activity meter, but works perfectly as a proper collar on your dog.

High value combo for $129 includes both T-shirt and activity collar.

Double the action pack with two activity collars for multi-dog families for $179

For real enthusiasts we can offer the Golden Pass for $250. It includes the T-shirt, activity collar and 30% discount on all our future launches. Get your name on the VIP list.

We are design and fashion geeks, and we want to offer you something unique. As our first annual special edition you can now reserve one of truly exclusive black leather edition activity collars for $499. Only 500 pieces available.

By supporting our Indiegogo campaign you won’t only help us launch our service, but you will also enable the future development of more precise activity tracking and understanding the needs of various niche dog-groups, such as pregnant dogs or dogs with injuries.


Manufacturing the collar

Our team has extensive experience on sourcing and manufacturing wearables and bluetooth devices. We have offers from leading OEM manufacturers from Europe and China. All we need to do, is to finalize the SW and choose the production partner. 


Possible Risks & Challenges

We have worked for two years developing and perfecting our technology. However, there might be some needs for adjustments and development based on user feedback and the availability of a large amount of dog-activity information, once our service is available. We can update the embedded software of the collar online, so there is no need to buy a new collar when new updates are available.

By pledging to support this innovation you are doing so with the understanding that this is a new service that you are making possible. In case we don’t reach our funding goal, we do have other funding sources available to us. Naturally, the more support we get from Indiegogo, the faster we are able to launch the service. 

Please spread the word and help us to improve the wellbeing of our loved ones, the dogs.

story:
Dear all, 

Dreamers, idealists, free-thinkers, artists!

Please join our movement to build a marvelous self-supplying healing community! 

We are Bianka and Dennis, a young couple from Hungary who decided to establish a place that people can visit from all over the world to relax, sit back, think, learn and get to know themselves better in peace and quiet. Also we offer help to fix mental/physical problems with the contribution of the surrounding nature, love and medicine plants.

Our direct neighbor is an aborigene Peruvian family, who have been using plant medicines for generations. The head is Luis Ernesto Rimachi Vilchez (Don Lucho), a native Peruvian shaman with lots of experience in curing serious diseases like cancer, hepatitis or malaria among others. He is the expert in plant medicines and our dear friend, the most humble, honest, loving wise man and is there to help anyone, anytime.

The place is based near Iquitos, the capital of the Amazon jungle in Peru. The farm, our land is within an hour from the city by boat next to Padre Cocha, a sweet little village by the Nanay river.

We only accept money in donations, that's why we are asking for your help. 

We would spend the money on building accommodation (nails, hammer, shaw, rope etc.) and things we need to improve the community; a common kitchen, vegetable garden, shower.

We would like a place where people can break away from their difficulties, the constant rush and the limits of today’s society and find the way back to themselves and nature. We would like it to be a playground for humans who learn together/teach each other to develop the capability of making themselves and their life better. 

Thank you for helping to make it come true.

story:
Hola from Barcelona! We are Pasteleria Celeste, a cake shop that set to open in early summer 2015

Sun, beach, sea, seafood, blue sky and beer...wait, there's something missing--delicious cakes! Everyone deserves a heavenly (Celeste) piece of cake. Pasteleria Celeste is a cake shop in Barcelona centre that will serve you both traditional and modern creative cakes, pastries and sandwiches. 



If you are thinking, why the hell is a Cantonese movie clip doing here?? Well, because this is a legendary quote that we want to share:

(The other guy was trying to convince him to take up a toilet cleaner job for the time being. This was the response)

If you don't have any dreams, what's the difference between you and a dry salted fish?

                 做人如果無夢想，同條鹹魚有咩分別呀？

Besides having dreams, we should all live our dreams. That's why we create this campaign. Let us start chasing dreams.

We got some comment from a friend about Rita's baking skills, in order to prove she's not a fluke and Pasteleria Celeste's products in the future are all edible, we launch a #bakeanotherday challenge that we will bake something new every other day at least until the indiegogo campaign is over (we can keep on baking afterwards depend on the funding situation). Today 4 March will be Day 3- You wanna know what we will be baking? Like & Follow our Facebook page all our latest update will be there! click here Leave us comment & suggestion xxxx  


The City


A gem on the Mediterranean coast, Barcelona has become the forth most visited city in Europe. The city is energetic, stylish and cultural. All year long sunny and mild climate, a perfect combination of cultural city trip and relaxing beach holiday. There were more than 7 millions visitors last year. Besides tourists we also have our 1.5 million strong trendy locals, who love to try new flavours.

If you have visited Barcelona you would know the city itself is not big at all. Both the tourists and locals tend to hang around in a few neighbourhoods. For example the old city/ ciutat vella, where the city centre located, is less than 5 km sq. large. It is a labyrinth of narrow streets, gothic buildings, full of bars, restaurants and shops. The tourists season is from April to October where the city is bursting with life and movement.                                                                                                                                                                                                

The Shop



Surely we are not the only one in town who sees this golden opportunity to open a new business. Recent years we have seen a surge of hipsters bar, cafe and bakeries. There are the traditional bakeries, serving Spanish bread, pastries, very few choices of cakes and not so creative. There are cafes with good cakes, but they have like 3 cakes sitting on the counter for customers to eat in.  There are the hipsters cup cake shops that it seems the cup cakes look better then the taste. We see a gap in the market that hasn't been filled in yet: a takeaway cake shop serving fresh cakes made from fresh ingredients, we are offering choices, qualities and taste. We will have set the prices competitive to keep the products turnover rate high. (Fresh cakes are always better!) We know we are newbies on the field, we are open for competitions but at the same time we are not competing with hundreds years old patisserie in Paris or Vienna. Barcelona is a market with great potential. Our qualities will help us succeed.

The shop will be beautifully designed. (we will post the design and artworks on facebook--check it for updates!) We will have a most welcoming shop front and stylish interior. Due to cost control we will rent a small-medium space as long as it is large enough for a bakery. We will make the best use of the space available.  

Fresh and seasonal 

We are lucky enough to live in Spain where fruits and vegetables are fresh, affordable and have a great variety. We promise to make the best use of that to bring you fresh and seasonal cakes. We will try to use as little processed ingredients as possible and buy products from local farmers' markets. Besides classic cakes and pastries we will be creative and bring you bold new flavours that makes you keep coming back!

We are committed to be environmentally friendly. All waste will be separated and recycled. Packaging will be made with recycled material if possible. We will encourage the customers to bring their own boxes. We want to reduce food waste to a minimal level.

We will be nice to our staff

Happy staff make customers happy. We are happy to see our staff happy and customers happy. When we are happy we will make better cakes and make our customers happier. (Ok that can goes on forever) the point is everybody will be happy. We are saying this because Barcelona is full of narrow-minded stingy bosses that want to squeeze the last penny out of their staff while wasting money on stupid purchases or inefficient policies. That is not the way to run a successful business.  We know good staff is hard to come by. We promised we will treat our staff with respect and fairness, and keep up good communication. Pasteleria Celeste not only makes great cakes, it's also a great place to work!



Rewards

Lets say, shit happens, we gets enough money to open the cake shop but then it fails (or we didn't get enough funding to open)--you still gonna get your rewards! (the delivery date will be postponed) !  Baking in the bakery won't be available but everything else will!  And YES! You will get that 1 week accommodation in Barcelona no matter what happens to the cake shop! Donate now! 

*If you are interested in over $1000 equity investment please email us. 



Where will the money goes?

At the beginning Pasteleria Celeste is raising $20 000 USD for the initial cost (which is a bit less than 20000 Euros, but as Euros is dropping its value like crazy, god knows by the end of this campaign how much will a euro cost!!)

  • Administrative fee for Paypal and Indiegogo (Thx Indiegogo)
  • Equity for a bank loan
  • Rent and deposit
  • Build-out and construction fee
  • Permits and company set up
  • Equipment and appliances

If we can raise more than $20 000 (Gosh, we will be so SO grateful!!!!!), the extra money will go into:

  • Ingredients in bulk
  • Boxes and packaging
  • Rent for the first few months
  • Hiring staff and their salaries
  • Less (or no) bank loan will be needed so we can sleep better at night!

Schedule




About the creator

Rita started baking relatively late, in her uni senior exchange study year. She had an amazing baker friend and she was addicted to baking ever since. She had been feeding all her previous colleagues in Barcelona various cakes in a regular basis and she volunteered to bring cake whenever there was a birthday. She was born in Hong Kong and moved to Europe after finishing uni. She has Hong Konger's super competitiveness  (to have a shop in Hong Kong is a cut-throat business!) and knows Barcelona long enough to get her way around. Barcelona was (and still is) full of dead end jobs. She had several of them and she was fed up. Now she is determined to make a new start. When she is not baking Rita is probably painting Barcelona's street scene and going to gigs.

Spread the words around!

Your supports mean EVERYTHING to us! Each dollar (or cent) counts. If you just don't have cash to spare, no worries--share it with your friends and family!

Risks & Challenges

Any business start-up carries risks, and we are prepared to encounter many obstacles on the way. The first (and the biggest) challenge will be to find a good location, affordable and with loads of foot traffic (doesn't have to be in the most touristy strip of the city, like Las Ramblas tends to be full of tacky shops and restaurants while the rent has rocketed). After locating the shop we would need the city counsel to approve us opening a cake shop there. We hope to identify several possible shop locations in case the city counsel rejects our first application. Once we obtain the approval we will start the construction and things go from there.

We always keep in mind that this is Spain and basically anything you think it is unimaginable can happen. Almost all construction finishes late. Very late. All sorts of fraudsters ready to lure you with scams. We already mentally prepared for all the things that can go wrong. (Fingers crossed the city counsel doesn't give us a hard time for the permits) We will keep our heads and deal with any obstacles with our determination, ingenuity and resourcefulness. Nothing will stop us until we achieve our goal!      


Ask us if you have any questions. Like our Facebook page! Be part of Pasteleria Celeste growth :D Don't forget to come say hi to us at the store when you visit Barcelona. We look forward to meeting you in person!

Your supports mean EVERYTHING to us! Each dollar (or cent) counts. If you just don't have cash to spare, no worries--share it with your friends and family!

 Risks & Challenges Any business start-up carries risks, and we are prepared to encounter many obstacles on the way. The first (and the biggest) challenge will be to find a good location, affordable and with loads of foot traffic (doesn't have to be in the most touristy strip of the city, like Las Ramblas tends to be full of tacky shops and restaurants while the rent has rocketed). After locating the shop we would need the city counsel to approve us opening a cake shop there. We hope to identify several possible shop locations in case the city counsel rejects our first application. Once we obtain the approval we will start the construction and things go from there.
We always keep in mind that this is Spain and basically anything you think it is unimaginable can happen. Almost all construction finishes late. Very late. All sorts of fraudsters ready to lure you with scams. We already mentally prepared for all the things that can go wrong. (Fingers crossed the city counsel doesn't give us a hard time for the permits) We will keep our heads and deal with any obstacles with our determination, ingenuity and resourcefulness. Nothing will stop us until we achieve our goal!        

Ask us if you have any questions. Like our Facebook page! Be part of Pasteleria Celeste growth :D Don't forget to come say hi to us at the store when you visit Barcelona. We look forward to meeting you in person!

story:
My daughter has a contact allergy to Multiple Foods.

I am raising money to start a business that will sell Allergy T-shirts. I started this business because my daughter attended childcare for a short time when she was a baby and the centre, and I, wanted to have her in a shirt that would easily make her recognisable to staff and parents. There was nothing small enough or with the right words on it for her specific allergies.
You can read the story of Lacey's first allergic reaction here and read about contact allergies here.
Once again my daughter will be starting childcare soon and upon looking for a suitable shirt i found nothing. 

Funding will help speed the process up

Currently i am working part time which in itself is very difficult as a single mum with 4 kids and a child with allergies, however, this is funding the start up costs of my business. It is very slow. Right now I am paying my graphic designer each fortnight with what spare money I have.
With donations I will be able to:
  • Buy the shirts and have them printed (wholesale shirts and printing are cheap but when buying in bulk quantities it is not so cheap especially with $0 budget)
  • Pay the graphic designer and have the designs ready for printing sooner than my budget allows
  • Pay someone to finish building the website (I am currently doing this and learning along the way which is making for a very slow website design process)
  • Pay for and implement a marketing strategy 

Get free website advertising for your business 

I am especially looking for donations from businesses and companies. I will give you free advertising (terms to be negotiated) see the perks page! 

This is one way i can give back and show my appreciation for your support. 

If your child happens to have an allergy I will also give donors 1 free shirt (minimum donation $25 for a shirt) once the business is up and running (i.e. it may be after this campaign if I do not raise enough) See the perks page!

What does this mean for my daughter and other children with allergies?

It means that you will have helped them be recognisable and safe in a crowd be it childcare or a birthday party. Contact allergies and anaphylaxis are no fun when food is around and since food is everywhere our little people with allergies need to stand out but more importantly for people to understand not to feed them or come into contact with them without at least washing their hands.

Contacting me about this campaign or allergies

There are a number of ways to contact me if you have any questions or queries about this campaign or just want to have a chat about your own child with allergies

  • Email kailie@mumkayles.com
  • Blog mumkayles.com
  • Facebook www.facebook.com/mumkayles
  • Twitter @MumKayles

Thank you so much for reading this far down and in advance for your donation. If you cannot donate but think the cause is worthy please share this around the world, or just with your contacts is fine ;-)

story:
If you are going to Nepal or giving things for helping the people of Nepal,

There will be a scarcity of foods and medicine and clean drinking water in this time so if possible you can get these things ready:

So, send these  

  1. energy rich foods with high calories like Energy biscuits,  Protein bars, canned foods like tuna fish, Muesli, canned soups, meat paste
  2. can opener
  3. Dry foods like nuts, cereals, peanut butter, dried meat, dried fruits , instant noodles, dried breads , crackers
  4. multi-vitamins in tablet forms
  5. paracetamols, antibiotics, Painkillers, arm bandages, thermometer, inhalers for asthmatic patients and  emergency medical supplies
  6. Water filter - Stuff or tablets that can purify water like chlorine tablets.
  7. Masks
  8. Personal hygiene items, such as sanitary napkins, diapers, hand sanitizer
  9. Rubber Gloves
  1. Thick rubber gloves for handling debris
  2. latex gloves for handling surgical/medical cases
  1. Sanitizers
  2. Torch Lights with batteries
  3. External batteries
  4. First Aid Kits
  5. Disinfectant Wipes
  6. Matches in a waterproof pouch or other fire starter such as a flint rod
  7. Sleeping bag
  8. Large Plastic Sheets/Trash Bag
  9. Insect Repellants
  10. Diarrhea pills

    29. Toilet Papers, hand sanitizers

    31. Glucose

    32. Chocolates

    33. TENTS!

story:
Where we're at-

Marianne Christy, the owner/baker of Local Foods Bakery, started envisioning the American dream quite a few years ago.  For the past seven years, she has been involved with food--whether growing it herself or working with others to help them start their dreams.  Just over two years ago, she opened the doors to her dream: baking artisanal food with old school methods, focusing on small batch baking and utilizing local, organic, non-gmo ingredients. 

Marianne has spent over a year developing recipes, locating local and regional raw ingredients, testing her confectionery treats on local customers. Now she is ready to roar into the surrounding communities.   Local Foods Bakery would like to be a brand in the Michiana area, this is where we need your help!

Branding the Bakery is about creating a cohesive look a "brand awareness" of what we are developing at Local Foods Bakery.   We want the community, the neighbors to be part of something awesome; the mountain is big - with your help we can climb it together & you get a Perk for helping - how cool is that?

What We Need  

The project needs $20,000, $10,000 of the funds we will start the Branding part by purchasing Labels, Banners, Street signs, Advertising- TV, Radio, Magazines (local). 
Once we start the marketing campaign we are expecting business to triple in volume so we are using $10,000 to purchase Bakery display cases, 2 work tables, 20 quart mixer, misc small kitchen tools. We need to remove a couple of walls to increase the flow of customers, us and future employees.  
A packaging space will be sharing the room with the Bakery display cases this is the yellow room with a Window.  

What You Get

Our perks are AWESOME: $250 will get you a year of pies once a month you can have all of your favorites. $50 will get you free coffee for a year along with an awesome coffee mug ; and for just $25 you will get our #1 rated cinnamon rolls. Good food, Great coffee, Birthday cakes, Cookies.... What more could a local / regional foodie want??   How about a $75 perk for Bread of the month- sample the white, the Oatmeal, the Sourdough... My mouth is watering just thinking about these Fantastic offers!

 When we reach certain dollar amount goals we will be using the monies as follows-

The first $5000 raised will go towards signage, labels, banners, paper ads etc. . 

The second $5000 will finish our Branding with TV & radio ads purchased.  

The third $5000 will be used to knock down some walls, buy our Bakery display units and tables.  All remaining funds will be used to purchase small kitchen appliances, with the 20 qt. Mixer at the top of our list!

The Impact

Starting a Bakery to change the way people see food created and to see the food they eat in a different light is valuable for this world.  We need regular portions of nutrient dense food to fulfill our hunger.  We use NON-GMO flour, local eggs, Organic dairy, Fair Trade Organic Cocoa from Peru, Fruit from the Southwest portion of Michigan, local meats & cheeses.

This project is a stair step in the evolution of building a better bakery for the community.  A place where people know your name, you run into your neighbors or a long lost friend.  Have you ever ran late and still needed to pick up a dessert- we accommodate our customers by staying late, letting them shop the cooler, etc. (ps. when we hit the target we will have food in our new bakery display case).  We know that sometimes you just need to go the extra mile, because good food needs to be on family tables...

I have been involved with every aspect of the building of the bakery we re- purposed an old worn out office space. The tear down, the build up, the finding professional tradesmen  to learning about the banking, how to secure funding,  the insurance, the advertising, etc..   Over the past year,  the one thing I knew the bakery would need help from the community, neighbors, professionals was the BRANDING of the bakery.  Customers have encouraged me to use the Crowdfunding platform to take this next critical step in the journey.  

Together we can create the Bakery of Tomorrow.

Baking & cooking is in my DNA; has been for over 50 years at the skirts of Grandmothers, Mom & Dad and watching Julie Child.  I am living the American dream, it is hard work and lots of hours and worth everything to hear that "MMM" after the first bite.

Risks & Challenges

Owning your own business you encounter challenges & risks monthly which in turn make you a better business owner; for a small Food business to stay open for over a year is a huge accomplishment.  Over the past year I have learned to listen, analyze and wait a bit before making decisions, big or small.   Our biggest challenge to date was no room to pack up the orders during the Fall/Winter Holidays.   

Some challenges that I see  will be the amount of the funding and I have addressed those above with the breakdowns.  This is a project and with all projects the risk are big and the rewards are bigger when we stay focused, grow steady.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Hey you can also help us out by making some noise about our campaign - make a shout out to your lists on - Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, your co-workers, neighbors, etc.
  • Don''t forget to use the fantastic tools that Indiegogo gives us to share the word.And that's all there is to it.

story:
On behalf of Project RBD.

There will be a program opening soon in Cleveland, Ohio that will help address many needs & issues.

Project RBD will be a dynamic, diverse community connector in Ohio, that will work as a bridge between cultures, community, and individuals. We don’t only want to help rebuild hope, but also contribute to the positive development of our communities in Ohio and nationwide. We will stress on getting drug addicts and the homeless off the street and into a job, racial reconciliation, helping immigrants, assisting veterans, uniting families & communities, addressing violence, stopping gang activity, and much more.

What happens once we start helping those in need of our services?

We will have started to reduce the cost of law enforcement, jails, hospital & mental health visits, the dependency off of welfare & food stamps, and reduction in crime.

Then what happens is that these families or individuals start to spend money in their communities, they support local business, they pay taxes, and help make the bonds of community stronger.

I want you to imagine the ripple effect this will have out in many of our communities here in Ohio and nationwide.

So, what I am proposing to all of you out there is that we are not asking for charity, a hand out, or donations but an investment in all of our futures.


The Center will operate to address their needs: from finding a home, to provide them with legal assistance gaining green cards, citizenship, and work authorizations.
Immigration in Ohio.
Ohio boast a blend of national origins and cultural identifications. Our region’s economic growth is related to the influx of new Americans who are here to find stable employment, reunite with their families, or to escape violence or persecution. Ohio is better off because of recent arrivals and new citizens, as immigrants play a significant role in our communities and add value in considerable ways. Immigrants:

    •  Revitalize our urban and rural communities that previously struggled with population decline;

    •  Increase the number of new residents, taxpayers, consumers, homeowners, and entrepreneurs, all of which boost our economic stability;

    •  Expose our youth to cultural diversity and add to classroom learning opportunities;

    •  Fill essential positions in STEM professions and the agriculture, service, food processing, and meatpacking industries that are almost entirely dependent on their labor.

We will add capacity to add enough multi-lingual resources to make sure we, too, are responsive to the needs of people who are not just Hispanic but are from all parts of the world as well who seek legal assistance gaining green cards, citizenship, and work authorizations which enable them to contribute to the positive development of our communities. These are our new neighbors and future leaders and they need our help navigating barriers in our complex and imperfect immigration system.

As a future coalition of workforce development and adult education service providers,Project Rebuild volunteers & staff members will work together on behalf of Ohio & US residents facing the highest barriers to obtain employment.These good jobs then lead to economic self-sufficiency and off of the dependency of the welfare system thus creating a societal,economic, and community impact. We will work to make sure that every Ohio & US resident has the chance to prepare for, find, and keep a good job.




The horizons program will be a special developmental program that will incorporate the input of our community and organizations to partner with each other. If we do not work together and start outreach to help each other curb violence of any kind, we will just see each others family and friends in body bags.


Your investment will create a better community. You will create jobs already with us being able to hire staff within the community center.

We will reduce the cost of law enforcement, jails, hospital & mental health visits, the dependency off of welfare & food stamps, and reduction in crime.

Families or individuals will start to spend money in their communities, they will support local businesses, pay taxes, and help make the bonds of our communities stronger.

Again lets imagine the ripple effect this will have out in many of our communities here in Ohio and nationwide.

Project RBD will uphold its integrity by committing to financial transparency. Which means we will have two town hall meetings a year that is open to everyone from local communities and we will discuss how funds are being used.

We need to raise at least $350,000 in contributions but if we can raise more that means their is more that we can do. We need to pay bills, furniture, office supplies, remodeling, salaries for staff, liability insurance, and any other expenses for at least the next couple of years. We also want to pay for the 501c3 application fee. We are entirely funded through private donations currently: we can not receive no government funding or tax deductible donations until we obtain our 501c3 charitable determination letter.

We have added a bunch of perks to thank you for your contribution.


Contribute: We would love to have you on board! This is a project we can’t do without the support of the community. Your contribution will be highly appreciated.

Spread the word: You can also share the campaign with your friends and family. Post on Facebook, Tweet us, and tell everyone you know about our mission and our journey!

Volunteer: If you can't contribute, but are interested in getting involved with Project Rebuild Hope to help in another way, we would love to hear from you. We are always looking for capable volunteers. If you want to help out, please write us at lvizcarrondo@gmail.com.

Together, let’s address this disparity!

story:
The problem at hand: 300 million women in India defecate in the open. 7 out of 10 rapes occur when women step out to defecate. Women in slums are verbally abused and stalked while accessing toilets. The shame and indignity of open defecation brings with it the fear of being raped & stalked.

HELP WOMEN GET THEIR RIGHT TO TOILET. A $250 DONATION PROVIDES MORE THAT A TOILET. IT PROTECTS A WOMAN'S LIFE. DONATE AND YOU WILL GIVE HER MORE THAN A TOILET. YOU WILL GIVE HER SAFETY, DIGNITY & EDUCATION.

"It is a shame that our women have to wait for darkness to go out in the open to defecate" - Mr. Narendra Modi, Prime Minister of India

300 million women and girls in India defecate in the open - BBC

7 out of 10 rapes occur when women step out to defecate - The Times of India


Share this page with your friends. The more people donate, the more toilets we can build.


The people behind this initiative:

 


All charitable donations will be collected 

and will be used to construct & maintain the toilets by

story:
In support of National Minority Mental Health Awareness Month, NAMI New Orleans, an affiliate of the National Alliance for Mental Illness and I, Idella Johnson will be producing Riding Halley’s Comet by Ann McQueen at The Mid-City Theatre, 3540 Toulouse St., New Orleans, La 70119, July 10th - 19th, with a special opening night talk-back on July 10th with NAMI New Orleans, Ann McQueen, and cast.

Riding Halley’s Comet is a play based on true events that tell the story of what life is really like living with a parent who suffers from mental illness.

Mental illness is a disease that not only affects the individual, it affects everyone. We are asking for your support in bringing Riding Halley's Comet to life and help us break the silence, end the shame and erase the stigma of mental illness by donating to our production. 

McQueen and myself are both daughters of mothers who were diagnosed with a mental illness. As young girls, we thought our lives were as normal as our peers, but as we approached adolescence we both discovered that our lives were very different. The reality of our existence in the "normal" world was something we have kept a secret nearly our entire lives. A secret that she and I also kept from each other the first year of our friendship. Now we have decided to use our gifts to inspire and give a voice to the many people that feel isolated and challenged by the profound effects of mental illness. 

Contributions of $100, $250, $500 and $1000 will go towards production cost, which also includes venue rental and salaries for our actors and staff. 

NAMI New Orleans, founded in 1978 as Friends Alliance for the Mentally Ill, offers hope, help and healing to people with mental illness and to those who share their lives through family support, education and advocacy, and quality psychosocial services. Our work helps individuals live with dignity and independence within the community, enriching all of our lives.

story:
With your support, we'll launch a dance club called Neuro Vexx – playing sci-fi inspired techno, psytrance and breaks all night in a trippy environment where you can dress up and escape reality. It will start in Los Angeles, CA and grow to become an event that happens in cities around the world. In each location, we'll rent an existing nightclub venue and transform it into a totally new experience for an evening.

A lot of us grew up watching futuristic clubs in sci-fi movies. We dreamed of actually going to places filled with such interesting music and people. But by the time we were old enough to be granted IDs that unlocked the golden doors of the nightclub, we walked through to discover disappointment. Corporate music. Creepy people. Not enough art or imagination. Clubs started to feel more like work parties or high school dances. We went to escape what’s wrong with the world but ended up being reminded of it. It's time to fix this problem.


Clubs should be a place where we feel safe to meet new people and strengthen our bonds with friends. Fellow club goers are our extended families – sometimes offering more love and support in critical times than our parents or siblings. A feeling of community happens when people are brought together by a passion – like at comic and sci-fi conventions. We want to bring this sense of togetherness to the club scene. Neuro Vexx will be a place where you can dress up in your favorite outfits – the ones that express who you really are – meet people who share your views and hear the latest sounds in dance music from true artists.

This crowdfunding campaign is to get our first event off the ground, which will take place on Saturday July 11 in Hollywood, CA. We’ll then build on this success and create more nights around the world. Some of the things you'll experience: 
  • The latest in dark, trippy techno, psytrance and breaks - the kind of music you usually have to trek to festivals or undergrounds to hear.
  • Theme nights where you can dress in a costume inspired by a movie, game, graphic novel and more.
  • An open, accepting atmosphere – you can even ignore the theme and wear whatever you want.
  • A place where you can be a single female (or married) and know you won’t have to deal with relentless advances from creepy guys while the security guards ignore you. We all know where the line is. Anyone steps over it- game over.
  • Interesting new music – not the corporate stuff or the retro songs you’ve heard over and over again.
  • Lots of fun stuff to do if you don’t dance but just want to come, hang out and be part of a scene.
  • The chance to experience your favorite video games and films during the night.
  • A live action sci-fi gaming experience you can play at the club. LARP meets ARG. Find other players and game characters during the night to solve challenges and earn EXP. Level up for perks and prizes. 

We'll also be DJing and performing live at Neuro Vexx. Our act is called Spanking Machine. Our DJ sets combine original music featuring live vocals with sci-fi inspired tracks from like-minded artists. We play techno, breaks, psy-trance and other underground styles. Our sound is like the music in a game, with a mix of styles and energy that takes you on a journey throughout the evening. You may have seen us during one of our hometown Los Angeles shows or on the road in places like Chicago, Miami, Atlanta and Tokyo. We can't wait to bring our latest show to you.


So how did we get the idea to do this? As musicians and DJs, the change in the club scene has hit us pretty hard. We realized something new was needed as we were planning a recent tour. Many alternative clubs we had played in the past had closed. The reason: Venues wanted to give the space to corporate EDM clubs. To compete, some clubs were forced to stop playing new music and cater to the retro audience. After weeks of scouring the web, we couldn’t find one place that we were excited about playing. We got bummed for a while. We tried to fulfill our creative needs by doing online shows. But we came back to the conclusion that dance music can’t be fully appreciated without the energy of a room full of people experiencing an amazing journey together. We noticed a lot of comments on our Soundcloud sets saying our mixes reminded people of sci-fi movie soundtracks or the music in games. Those are two of our favorite things too. So this is a great opportunity to listen to our audience and give them something they really want.




Perks including admission to opening night show a blue ticket in upper right corner.


 


 


 


 


  


 


 


1. Click on the pink CONTRIBUTE NOW button in the upper right side of this page if you’d like to donate money without receiving a perk.

Or select the perk you want from the right side column and click the box.

If you want to come to the first night of the club on Saturday July 11 in Los Angeles, choose one of the following perks:

MISSION OBJECTIVE: YOUR TICKET
5,000 NEURO VEXX EXP
POWER ELIXIR
5,000 NEURO VEXX EXP
EXTENDED PLAY
TOTAL IMMERSION

If you can’t be in Los Angeles for the opening night but you’d like to help us get this club started and possibly take it to your city in the future, you can get a t-shirt, music and Neuro Vexx gear. Select one of these perks:

ALIEN TRANSMISSION
NEURO VEXX DLC
NEURO VEXX LANYARD
NEURO VEXX T-SHIRT
PLAYER SKIN LEVEL 1
BLACK VINYL

 2. Add an additional gift (optional) to help us even more.

 3. Click the CONTINUE TO PAYMENT button

 4. Choose your payment option.

 5. Spread the word about our campaign and help make Neuro Vexx happen.

 For more help on how to contribute, visit: https://support.indiegogo.com/hc/en-us/categories/200250848-Contributing


Why Neuro Vexx?
Neuro is another way of saying brain. Vexx is to tease or, according to Urban Dictionary, “to make a gregarious friend.” Sounds great to us.

How do you say Neuro Vexx??
It is pronounced Nyer-OH Vexx

Is this a Brick and Mortar club?
No. We’re renting an existing nightclub venue and putting on an event. Neuro Vexx will be happening in different venues, in different parts of the US, and eventually in different countries.

Do I have to dress up?
No. But it does add to your experience and can start conversations.

What happens if I decide to play the LARP?
You may already be playing it.

story:
¡Hacer click aquí para ver la versión en ESPAÑOL!


By generating renewable energy with playgrounds we can achieve Queralquichki's sustainable development.


The Problem

Contrary to common belief, the increase of wealth brought by globalization is not the only thing leading to environmental degradation. Poor people depend, in great measure, on natural resources to obtain direct income and as consequence the environment is stressed. Yet, the degradation caused will deepen their poverty.

Queralquichki is a settlement of around 150 inhabitants, located in the outskirts of the city of Huancavelica, Peru. Here, most people have unmet basic needs such as: adequate nutrition, health services, drainage, drinking water or sewage, electricity, latrines, education, access to communications, among others.

In general, a scarce resource population like Queralquichki, has a low level of education as well as a very poor quality of life. Hence, their understanding of the environment around them is almost nonexistent and so is their priority for conserving it.

As a result, the pressure put on fragile natural resources increases and the environment is degraded, forming a vicious circle where a degraded environment worsens the quality of life of the population.

Said population will not preserve the environment if they do not understand what it means, how to do it and the benefits that are brought along; nor will they give it a higher priority because their living conditions barely allows them to survive.

By improving their living conditions and education levels at the same time, greater environmental awareness can be generated, leading to environmental conservation and poverty alleviation.


The Solution

Playing for Development will design and build in Queralquichki an energy generating playground consisting of the following games: a merry-go-round, a swing and a see-saw.

Said games will transform the energy generated by the children while using the games into electrical energy. The energy produced will be stored and transported to a loading center where residents will charge their cellphones and flashlights without having to travel to the city. Thus, they will be able to light their homes at night.

Two lines of action will be addressed: 

  1. The generation of renewable energy to improve the living conditions of the population, 
  2. The provision of educational tools to improve the level of environmental education.

There is an important relationship between education, quality of life and environmental awareness and acting upon all three can accomplish sustainable development. Also the use of renewable energy is the basis for achieving this development; as Ban Ki-Moon, UN secretary general, says: "Sustainable energy is the golden thread that connects economic growth, increased social equity and an environment that allows the world to thrive."


The Impact

The Project will benefit the population of Queralquchki and the physical and biological space they inhabit.

Greater environmental awareness will be generated, especially amongst the children using the games. They will learn to take care of their environment and will reduce the pressure on the natural resources they use. As a result, the degraded environment will improve and so will the living conditions of the population.

The children in Queralquichki will learn hands-on how they can produce clean, renewable energy from playing. They will be also taught about the different sources of energy and their impacts in the environment; about saving; energy efficiency and conservation. Indirectly adults will learn the same.

The Children will have a physical, temporal and emotional space to play. Play is a human right of every child as it contributes to their physical, cognitive, social and emotional wellbeing. Playing allows them to use their creativity, develop their imagination, improve their strengths, interact with their surroundings, conquer fears, learn to work as a team, share, negotiate, resolve conflicts, make decisions, discover areas of personal interest, among others.

Playing for Development will improve the population’s quality of life: The energy produced by the playground will allow them to light up their houses without having to travel to the city to charge their cellphones (used as flashlights). The children that have chores during the day, such as working in the fields, will be able to access artificial light and study during the night. Access to light increases productivity and enhances chances of economic, personal and social success.

It is for said reasons that Playing for Development will bring intellectual development to children, economic progress and improvement in the population’s living conditions and environment.


Additional Information

The following links show similar projects which have already been done in several countries:

  • Goff, H. (18th of March 2008). See-saw to power African Schools. BBC News. Obtained on the 13th of May 2013, from http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/7301354.stm
  • Reichman, M. (01st of June 2010). Nonprofit lights up Ghana one playground at a time. Obtained on the 23rd of April 2013, from the Daily Herald: http://www.heraldextra.com/news/local/article_d44cea66-998f-5366-8152-424a66694cfe.html
  • Birjade M. (2012). Swing Electricity Generation System. Obtained on the 25th of Febuary 2015, from BEP Project Report: http://beprojectreport.com/download/C1-SWING-ELECTRICITY-GENERATION-SYSTEM.pdf


What We Need

Here is a breakdown of how the money raised will be used:


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute it doesn’t mean you can’t still help! Please spread the word about this campaign by sharing it with your friends! You can use the Indiegogo share tools!


ESPAÑOL

Para ver el video en español: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Gr1DVb9cYQ


Por medio de la generación de la energía renovable utilizando juegos comunales, podremos lograr el desarrollo sostenible en Queralquichki.


El Problema

Contrario a lo que la mayoría cree, el aumento de riqueza que acompaña a la mundialización no es el único problema que lleva a la degradación ambiental. Los pobres dependen en gran medida de los recursos naturales para obtener ingresos directos y como consecuencia degradan el ambiente. Asimismo, la degradación del medio ambiente profundizará su pobreza.

Queralquichki, se ubica en los alrededores de la ciudad de Huancavelica, Perú; donde viven alrededor de 30 familias (mayoritariamente agricultores y ganaderos de subsistencia). Aquí, la mayoría de los pobladores tienen insatisfechas las siguientes necesidades básicas como: Nutrición adecuada, servicios de salud, sistemas de drenaje, agua potable o alcantarillado, electricidad, letrinas, educación, acceso a comunicaciones, entre otras.

Por lo general, una población con escasos recursos, como lo es Queralquichki,  posee un nivel bajo de educación y una mala calidad de vida; por tanto, el entendimiento sobre el ambiente que los rodea es pobre y les resulta de baja importancia cuidarlo.

Como consecuencia, la presión que se ejerce sobre los recursos naturales frágiles aumenta y el ambiente se degrada; formando un círculo vicioso donde un ambiente degradado empeora la calidad de vida de la población.

Dicha población no conservará el ambiente si no comprende el significado de conservar el ambiente, cómo hacerlo y los beneficios que trae consigo; así mismo, tampoco le dará una mayor prioridad ya que sus condiciones de vida apenas les permiten sobrevivir.

Se debe abordar esta problemática en conjunto; mejorar las condiciones de vida y el nivel de educación ambiental de la población para generar una mayor conciencia ambiental. Solo así se podrá conservar el medio ambiente y mitigar la pobreza.


La Solución

Jugando por el Desarrollo consiste en diseñar y construir en Queralquichki los siguientes juegos recreativos mecánicos generadores de energía: Un carrusel, un columpio, y un sube y baja.

Dichos juegos permitirán transformar la energía generada con el uso que le darán los niños, en energía eléctrica. La energía producida, se almacenará y llevará a un centro de carga donde los pobladores podrán cargar sus celulares y linternas sin tener que viajar hasta la ciudad.  Así, podrán alumbrar sus hogares por las noches.

Se abordarán dos principales líneas de acción: 

  1. La generación de energía renovable para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la población, 
  2. La provisión de herramientas educacionales para mejorar el nivel de educación ambiental.
Existe una relación importantísima entre la educación, calidad de vida y la conciencia ambiental e incidiendo en los tres se puede llegar al desarrollo sostenible. Asimismo el uso de energías renovables es la base para lograr este desarrollo; como diría Ban Ki-Moon, secretario general de la ONU, “La energía sostenible es el hilo de oro que conecta el crecimiento económico, un medio ambiente sano, la equidad social y la igualdad de oportunidades”.


El Impacto

El Proyecto beneficiará a los pobladores de Queralquichki y al espacio físico y biológico donde habitan.

Se generará una mayor conciencia ambiental, en especial en los niños que utilicen los juegos para obtener energía; aprenderán a cuidar el ambiente que los rodea y se reducirá la presión ejercida sobre los recursos naturales frágiles que utilizan. Como consecuencia el ambiente degradado mejorará y con ello la calidad de vida de los pobladores también.

Los niños de Queralquichki aprenderán de manera directa y activa como pueden producir energía eléctrica limpia y renovable a partir de la que utilizan para jugar. Además, comprenderán las distintas fuentes de energía que existen y cómo varias de ellas inciden en su salud y/o el ambiente; sobre el ahorro; la eficiencia energética y la conservación. Indirectamente los adultos aprenderán lo mismo.

Asimismo, los niños contarán con un espacio físico, temporal y emocional para jugar. El juego es un derecho humano de todo niño pues contribuye a su bienestar físico, cognitivo, social y emocional. Jugar les permite usar su creatividad, desarrollar su imaginación, mejorar sus destrezas, interactuar con sus alrededores, conquistar miedos, aprender a trabajar en equipo, compartir, negociar, resolver conflictos, tomar decisiones, descubrir áreas de interés personales, entre otros beneficios.

Jugando por el Desarrollo, mejorará la calidad de vida de los pobladores, pues la energía producida por los juegos les permitirá alumbrar sus casas por las noches sin la necesidad de tener que viajar hasta la ciudad para cargar sus celulares, los cuales utilizan como linternas. Los jóvenes estudiantes que tienen tareas durante el día, como dedicarse a la agricultura, no tienen ninguna posibilidad de estudiar después de la escuela, ya que no cuentan con luz artificial. Adicionalmente, el acceso a luz por la noche les permitirá ser más productivos y tener mayores posibilidades de triunfo laboral, personal y social.

Es por las razones antes expuestas, Jugando por el Desarrollo, traerá el desarrollo intelectual de los niños, progreso económico y una mejora en la calidad de vida de la población y del  ambiente que los rodea.


Información Adicional

Los siguientes enlaces muestran proyectos similares, ya realizados en diversos países:

  • Goff, H. (18 de Marzo de 2008). See-saw to power African Schools. BBC News. Recuperado el 13 de Mayo de 2013, de http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/7301354.stm
  • Reichman, M. (01 de Junio de 2010). Nonprofit lights up Ghana one playground at a time. Recuperado el 23 de Abril de 2013, de Daily Herald: http://www.heraldextra.com/news/local/article_d44cea66-998f-5366-8152-424a66694cfe.html
  • Birjade M. (2012). Swing Electricity Generation System. Recuperado el 25 de febrero de 2015, de BEP Project Report: http://beprojectreport.com/download/C1-SWING-ELECTRICITY-GENERATION-SYSTEM.pdf


Lo que Necesitamos

Aquí puedes ver a detalle cómo se utilizará el dinero recaudado:


Otras Formas de Ayudar

Si no puedes contribuir no significa que no puedas ayudar. ¡Por favor comenta a tus amigos sobre la campaña! ¡Puedes usar las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo!
