playground consisting of the following games: a merry-go-round, a swing and a
see-saw.Said games will transform
the energy generated by the children while using the games into electrical
energy. The energy produced will be stored and transported to a loading center
where residents will charge their cellphones and flashlights without having to
travel to the city. Thus, they will be able to light their homes at night.
Two lines of action will
be addressed: 

The generation of renewable energy to improve the living
conditions of the population, 


The provision of educational tools to improve
the level of environmental education.

There is an important
relationship between education, quality of life and environmental awareness and
acting upon all three can accomplish sustainable development. Also the use of
renewable energy is the basis for achieving this development; as Ban Ki-Moon,
UN secretary general, says: "Sustainable energy is the golden thread that
connects economic growth, increased social equity and an environment that
allows the world to thrive."
The Impact
The Project will
benefit the population of Queralquchki and the physical and biological space
they inhabit.
Greater environmental
awareness will be generated, especially amongst the children using the games.
They will learn to take care of their environment and will reduce the pressure
on the natural resources they use. As a result, the degraded environment will improve
and so will the living conditions of the population.
The children in
Queralquichki will learn hands-on how they can produce clean, renewable energy
from playing. They will be also taught about the different sources of energy
and their impacts in the environment; about saving; energy efficiency and
conservation. Indirectly adults will learn the same.
The Children will have
a physical, temporal and emotional space to play. Play is a human right of
every child as it contributes to their physical, cognitive, social and
emotional wellbeing. Playing allows them to use their creativity, develop their
imagination, improve their strengths, interact with their surroundings, conquer
fears, learn to work as a team, share, negotiate, resolve conflicts, make decisions,
discover areas of personal interest, among others.
Playing for
Development will improve the population’s quality of life: The energy produced
by the playground will allow them to light up their houses without having to
travel to the city to charge their cellphones (used as flashlights). The
children that have chores during the day, such as working in the fields, will
be able to access artificial light and study during the night. Access to light
increases productivity and enhances chances of economic, personal and social
success. 
It is for said reasons
that Playing for Development will bring intellectual development to children,
economic progress and improvement in the population’s living conditions and
environment.
Additional Information
The following links
show similar projects which have already been done in several countries: 


Goff, H. (18th of March
2008). See-saw to power African Schools. BBC News. Obtained on the 13th of May 2013, from http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/7301354.stm


Reichman, M. (01st of June
2010). Nonprofit lights up Ghana one playground at a time. Obtained on the 23rd
of April 2013, from the Daily Herald: http://www.heraldextra.com/news/local/article_d44cea66-998f-5366-8152-424a66694cfe.html


Birjade M. (2012).
Swing Electricity Generation System. Obtained on the 25th of Febuary 2015, from
BEP Project Report: http://beprojectreport.com/download/C1-SWING-ELECTRICITY-GENERATION-SYSTEM.pdf


What We Need
Here is a breakdown of
how the money raised will be used:Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t
contribute it doesn’t mean you can’t still help! Please spread the word about
this campaign by sharing it with your friends! You can use the Indiegogo share
tools!ESPAÑOLPara ver el video en español: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Gr1DVb9cYQPor medio de la generación de la energía renovable utilizando juegos comunales, podremos lograr el desarrollo sostenible en Queralquichki.
El Problema
Contrario a lo que la mayoría cree, el aumento de riqueza que acompaña a
la mundialización no es el único problema que lleva a la degradación ambiental.
Los pobres dependen en gran medida de los recursos naturales para obtener
ingresos directos y como consecuencia degradan el ambiente. Asimismo, la
degradación del medio ambiente profundizará su pobreza. 
Queralquichki, se ubica en los alrededores de la ciudad de Huancavelica,
Perú; donde viven alrededor de 30 familias (mayoritariamente agricultores y
ganaderos de subsistencia). Aquí, la mayoría de los pobladores tienen
insatisfechas las siguientes necesidades básicas como: Nutrición adecuada,
servicios de salud, sistemas de drenaje, agua potable o alcantarillado,
electricidad, letrinas, educación, acceso a comunicaciones, entre otras.
Por lo general, una población con escasos recursos, como lo es
Queralquichki,  posee un nivel bajo de
educación y una mala calidad de vida; por tanto, el entendimiento sobre el
ambiente que los rodea es pobre y les resulta de baja importancia cuidarlo.
Como consecuencia, la presión que se ejerce sobre los recursos naturales
frágiles aumenta y el ambiente se degrada; formando un círculo vicioso donde un
ambiente degradado empeora la calidad de vida de la población. 
Dicha población no conservará el ambiente si no comprende el significado
de conservar el ambiente, cómo hacerlo y los beneficios que trae consigo; así
mismo, tampoco le dará una mayor prioridad ya que sus condiciones de vida
apenas les permiten sobrevivir. 
Se debe abordar esta problemática en conjunto; mejorar las condiciones de
vida y el nivel de educación ambiental de la población para generar una mayor
conciencia ambiental. Solo así se podrá conservar el medio ambiente y mitigar
la pobreza.
La Solución
Jugando por el Desarrollo consiste en diseñar y construir en Queralquichki
los siguientes juegos recreativos mecánicos generadores de energía: Un
carrusel, un columpio, y un sube y baja.
Dichos juegos permitirán transformar la energía generada con el uso que
le darán los niños, en energía eléctrica. La energía producida, se almacenará y
llevará a un centro de carga donde los pobladores podrán cargar sus celulares y
linternas sin tener que viajar hasta la ciudad.  Así, podrán alumbrar sus hogares por las
noches.
Se abordarán dos principales líneas de acción: 

La generación de
energía renovable para mejorar las condiciones de vida de la población, 


La
provisión de herramientas educacionales para mejorar el nivel de educación
ambiental.


Existe una relación importantísima entre la educación, calidad de vida y
la conciencia ambiental e incidiendo en los tres se puede llegar al desarrollo
sostenible. Asimismo el uso de energías renovables es la base para lograr este
desarrollo; como diría Ban Ki-Moon, secretario general de la ONU, “La energía sostenible
es el hilo de oro que conecta el crecimiento económico, un medio ambiente sano,
la equidad social y la igualdad de oportunidades”.
El Impacto
El Proyecto beneficiará a los pobladores de Queralquichki y al espacio
físico y biológico donde habitan.
Se generará una mayor conciencia ambiental, en especial en los niños que
utilicen los juegos para obtener energía; aprenderán a cuidar el ambiente que
los rodea y se reducirá la presión ejercida sobre los recursos naturales
frágiles que utilizan. Como consecuencia el ambiente degradado mejorará y con
ello la calidad de vida de los pobladores también.
Los niños de Queralquichki aprenderán de manera directa y activa como
pueden producir energía eléctrica limpia y renovable a partir de la que
utilizan para jugar. Además, comprenderán las distintas fuentes de energía que
existen y cómo varias de ellas inciden en su salud y/o el ambiente; sobre el
ahorro; la eficiencia energética y la conservación. Indirectamente los adultos
aprenderán lo mismo. 
Asimismo, los niños contarán con un espacio físico, temporal y emocional
para jugar. El juego es un derecho humano de todo niño pues contribuye a su
bienestar físico, cognitivo, social y emocional. Jugar les permite usar su
creatividad, desarrollar su imaginación, mejorar sus destrezas, interactuar con
sus alrededores, conquistar miedos, aprender a trabajar en equipo, compartir,
negociar, resolver conflictos, tomar decisiones, descubrir áreas de interés
personales, entre otros beneficios.
Jugando por el Desarrollo, mejorará la calidad de vida de los pobladores,
pues la energía producida por los juegos les permitirá alumbrar sus casas por
las noches sin la necesidad de tener que viajar hasta la ciudad para cargar sus
celulares, los cuales utilizan como linternas. Los jóvenes estudiantes que
tienen tareas durante el día, como dedicarse a la agricultura, no tienen
ninguna posibilidad de estudiar después de la escuela, ya que no cuentan con
luz artificial. Adicionalmente, el acceso a luz por la noche les permitirá ser
más productivos y tener mayores posibilidades de triunfo laboral, personal y
social. 
Es por las razones antes expuestas, Jugando por el Desarrollo, traerá el desarrollo intelectual de los niños, progreso económico y una mejora en la
calidad de vida de la población y del 
ambiente que los rodea.
Información Adicional
Los
siguientes enlaces muestran proyectos similares, ya realizados en diversos
países:


Goff, H. (18 de Marzo de 2008). See-saw to power African Schools. BBC News. Recuperado
el 13 de Mayo de 2013, de http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/education/7301354.stm


Reichman, M. (01 de Junio de 2010). Nonprofit lights up Ghana one playground at a
time. Recuperado
el 23 de Abril de 2013, de Daily Herald: http://www.heraldextra.com/news/local/article_d44cea66-998f-5366-8152-424a66694cfe.html


Birjade M. (2012).
Swing Electricity Generation System. Recuperado el 25 de febrero de 2015, de
BEP Project Report: http://beprojectreport.com/download/C1-SWING-ELECTRICITY-GENERATION-SYSTEM.pdf


Lo que Necesitamos
Aquí
puedes ver a detalle cómo se utilizará el dinero recaudado:
Otras Formas de Ayudar
Si
no puedes contribuir no significa que no puedas ayudar. ¡Por favor comenta a
tus amigos sobre la campaña! ¡Puedes usar las herramientas para compartir de
Indiegogo!

story: Rowland's Mill was built during the 18th century by Benjamin Harrison V of Berkeley Plantation. It was visited during the Civil War by General J.E.B. Stuart and during the American Revolutionary War by British troops led by Benedict Arnold. The mill has a wonderful history for not only the county of Charles city but also the country! It is in great shape for a mill of its age, with strong floors and foundation... The roof was even replaced a few years ago. However we are needing help to bring it back to its original glory. Fortunately it still has all of the workable parts with it! Herring creek still even flows through it!! Our ultimate goal is to open the mill up for educational purposes. To get involved with the schools and to teach the children of our community the impact the mill had during the revolutionary and civil wars. Its amazing that it still stands proud to this day and we hope to help it stand for many years to come!

story:
We are here to bring you hot fun in the summertime. Frozen drinks, things in cans, and a magic bus, all at the corner of 6th and Rhode Island NW.

You may be hearing about us for the first time, or maybe you have been hearing about us for over a year. We have gone from being a dream to having building permits and an approval for a liquor license, now we just need to build this beauty.

 

What we need / What you get

We have some money saved up, but need your help to make Electric Cool-Aid all it can be -- how about some needlepoint in the bathrooms? Lasers in the bus? Super-giant umbrellas? We like all those things and want you to have them.

To show our thanks and help you show your love, we have quite a few perks. Some are more lasting than others. But we know some of you treasure an hour of music more than a tank top. And some of you want you cat's likeness forever forged somewhere on the bus.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please follow and tag us on:

Instagram

Twitter

Facebook

Your shares help spread the word better than any other kind of marketing!

story:
WHAT’S IT ALL ABOUT? 

Happy Maki is growing and not just into a new space!

We’re really excited to share with everyone our next adventure. We’re bringing new life to a run down 50-seater restaurant in the heart of Brighton and here our food will be given as a gift.  

It all started with a passion to raise awareness of overfishing issues and how the sushi industry was contributing to this, whilst providing healthy fast food. After 3 long Summers of serving sushi at festivals up and down the country, we opened the doors to our small shop right next to Brighton Pier. 

For each sushi wrap we sell we plant a tree and feed a child, along the way our amazing customers have supported us in planting 226,405 trees and providing 306,301 meals through our charity partners Eden Reforestation Projects and Marys Meals. 

Our next big and exciting project is a new restaurant concept, a fast, healthy vegan menu specialising in sushi “rolls and bowls”, see the photo attached for the full menu.  With toppings from “salmon” sashimi to miso and ginger tempeh, it’s all the amazing flavours you know and love from our rolls with an exciting twist. 

The real pioneering experiment is introducing gift economy using a modern and customer facing, pay as you feel till system.  The big goal is learning how to do business in a kinder and more regenerative way. By offering our sushi as a gift, and removing the demand from the usual transaction process we want to treat our customers more kindly.  We hope this will be felt, and that it will create a very special atmosphere in our restaurants.  This also opens the door to a healthy vegan meal for anyone who wouldn’t usually be able to afford it. 

One of the main drivers of opening the new restaurant is to have a space to use where we can all connect and learn from each other. In the evenings we will be hosting documentary screenings, presentations, workshops and live music events. We’re excited to be able work with the community to create a space where great food and great conversation go hand in hand. 

 

WHAT WE NEED 

We are hoping to raise £40,000 in funding. We are aware it’s a large amount of money but are also proud that we can do some amazing things for an old restaurant at a very reasonable cost for a full renovation.  The total cost of the project is £80,000 we will fund the remaining £40,000 with loans. 

With outdated décor and a tired kitchen, everything needs to be stripped back and refurnished, it needs a lot of love. With truth as a guiding principle for Happy Maki, we feel it is important you understand where any donations are going. So we have created a pie chart below to show you what our budget currently looks like, which might also help anyone else thinking of opening a restaurant. 

 

The The costs can be split into two categories

Acquiring the Lease 33% : Including rent deposit, premium, stamp duty & solicitors fees. 

Creating a Restaurant 66% : Kitchen equipment, bathroom refurbs, redecoration throughout, signage, locally made tables, wiring, plumbing, custom built rolling counter, air conditioning and labour costs. 

We’re looking to bring it to life, where health café meets Japanese zen vibes, a fusion feel just like our food! We want to bring in a beautiful bamboo ceiling and locally made tables and benches, using environmentally friendly materials where possible but also focusing on durability and how easy surfaces are to clean and maintain. 

On the new menu, ensuring we keep our kitchen refurb to essential equipment and costs as low as possible. All of our food is hand prepped, all sauces are homemade and we’re working towards being 100% gluten free.  This all means that the kitchen is simple and inexpensive to kit out. 

 

WHAT DO YOU GET ? 

As a business operating on gift economy, we are not offering set rewards.  As a not for profit company we are not offering equity in the business.  We envisage that the by donation crowdfunding campaign will be supported by people who are:

 

1.  Keen to support the growth of Happy Maki.  

2.  Excited to be part of the gift economy experiment. 

3.  Hungry to make a donation in advance for food at our shops or food trucks.

 

Campaign contributes will also be invited to come and try the food and help us perfect our service process during a 4 day soft launch which will only be open to those who have donated.  A sneak preview of our first of its kind pay as you feel, vegan sushi bar. 

 

We will also be holding live Q and A webinars for contributors, so you can chat to Anna about her plans and progress. 

If you want to donate in advance for food it’s up to you how much you take for your donation, you will be able to let us know this through our till system in stores or by chatting to staff at our events. We really look forward to meeting and thanking you all and hopefully celebrating your contribution to a successful campaign.  We have also added suggested donations such as buying a meal for one or two in advance, for those wanting some price guidelines.

 With your support, we can breathe new life into the amazing space, bring healthy vegan food to those in need and continue to help plant trees and feed children through our great charity partners! 

We will also be creating a full business report on the process of turning a business to pay as you feel.  Explanations behind our decision, our budget and then actual costs, plus of course in-depth analysis of the donation data trends that we collect. This report will be put on our website for anyone to have access to. 

 

THE IMPACT 

This is the first time anyone will have experimented with pay as you feel in a fast food environment, with our new till system we will be collecting not only really insightful data on gifting patterns but we will also be refining a point of sale product that other businesses can use in today's modern and fast paced world. We believe in sharing freely ideas and products that promote positive growth so we can all improve and grow faster and together. 

In supporting us not only are you providing an amazing gift but you become part of the exciting experiment towards positive change.  

The business started with a personal pot of £10,000 and we are very careful with the money we do spend. Up until this point we have grown organically through hard work reinvestment and reasonable director salaries.  We make sure money is being spent in the right places and we are resourceful alongside mindful of the resources we are using.  

As a team we believe passionately in what we are doing.  We want to protect and regenerate the environment and its wildlife whilst creating a kind and non-judgemental space where everyone can connect around a table, eating deliciously colourful fast food.  Most importantly we want to inspire people to drop their guards and open their hearts to the idea of giving gifts to benefit others.  We hope to prove that when you do business with these motives and desires that it is successful, even if we aren’t yet able to define exactly what this “success” might look like. 

 

THE RISKS AND CHALLENGES 

Some people feel going pay as you feel is a risk, we see it as an amazing opportunity become more connected in a world that is largely controlled by money and emotions of greed, scarcity and fear.  The drive behind the business had never been profit but rather serving the community and helping our environment.  This is just the next step in growing that desire and hopefully starting a much-needed conversation about money and our emotions surrounding it. 

When we decided this was a change we wanted to make, we trailed our new Pay As You Feel business model at two festivals at the end of our 2019 season. This was a brilliant chance to gain much needed insight into how people interacted with the servers, how they decided on their donation amount and how we could do our best to make the experience easy and clear.  We focus a lot on the principles of economy and function in all aspects of our business. Especially relating to design of our menu, service processes and customer experience.  From what we have researched and our event trials, we have developed the world’s first business donation “point of sale” software working with web application company Long Live King and Payment provider Square. And as we mentioned in the video this will be made available for people to use and customise. 

Although the vegan food industry is booming, we are seeing trends of smaller vegan business’s having to close, as well as high failure rate in the restaurant industry as a whole. Some people might feel there is a risk to open a second larger store which could cannibalise our existing successful store.  Again, this is something we have given careful consideration to and have never made being vegan our USP, we are more about healthy and delicious food served in a kind environment with responsible business methods.  We feel we have a strong and original position in the market and most importantly, food that everyone loves. The pay as you feel experiment will create a buzz and attract a lot of new customers and we are confident that by getting more people to just try our food our customer base will easily expand and support both of our stores.  

We’ve worked hard to get everything in place to really highlight what we are hoping to achieve. We are also aware that if for whatever reason the experiment doesn’t work, we may have to revert to charging set prices to ensure we can continue providing ethical jobs and doing great work. 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

The beauty of our Pay As You Feel model is that even if you can’t offer monetary contribution, you can still be a part of our movement. We would really appreciate it if you could share our campaign, by the spreading the word, we can make sure that those who could benefit most hear about what we’re doing.  You get in touch if you think you have some skills we could use. 

We really appreciate your time reading and following our progress, we hope to see you in our new restaurant or in a festival field for some sushi and a chat.

 

Website : www.vegansushi.co.uk

Instagram : @thehappymaki

As a team we believe passionately in what we are doing.  We want to protect and regenerate the environment and its wildlife whilst creating a kind and non-judgemental space where everyone can connect around a table, eating deliciously colourful fast food.  Most importantly we want to inspire people to drop their guards and open their hearts to the idea of giving gifts to benefit others.  We hope to prove that when you do business with these motives and desires that it is successful, even if we aren’t yet able to define exactly what this “success” might look like. 
 
THE RISKS AND CHALLENGES 
Some people feel going pay as you feel is a risk, we see it as an amazing opportunity become more connected in a world that is largely controlled by money and emotions of greed, scarcity and fear.  The drive behind the business had never been profit but rather serving the community and helping our environment.  This is just the next step in growing that desire and hopefully starting a much-needed conversation about money and our emotions surrounding it. 
When we decided this was a change we wanted to make, we trailed our new Pay As You Feel business model at two festivals at the end of our 2019 season. This was a brilliant chance to gain much needed insight into how people interacted with the servers, how they decided on their donation amount and how we could do our best to make the experience easy and clear.  We focus a lot on the principles of economy and function in all aspects of our business. Especially relating to design of our menu, service processes and customer experience.  From what we have researched and our event trials, we have developed the world’s first business donation “point of sale” software working with web application company Long Live King and Payment provider Square. And as we mentioned in the video this will be made available for people to use and customise. 
Although the vegan food industry is booming, we are seeing trends of smaller vegan business’s having to close, as well as high failure rate in the restaurant industry as a whole. Some people might feel there is a risk to open a second larger store which could cannibalise our existing successful store.  Again, this is something we have given careful consideration to and have never made being vegan our USP, we are more about healthy and delicious food served in a kind environment with responsible business methods.  We feel we have a strong and original position in the market and most importantly, food that everyone loves. The pay as you feel experiment will create a buzz and attract a lot of new customers and we are confident that by getting more people to just try our food our customer base will easily expand and support both of our stores.  
We’ve worked hard to get everything in place to really highlight what we are hoping to achieve. We are also aware that if for whatever reason the experiment doesn’t work, we may have to revert to charging set prices to ensure we can continue providing ethical jobs and doing great work. 
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 
The beauty of our Pay As You Feel model is that even if you can’t offer monetary contribution, you can still be a part of our movement. We would really appreciate it if you could share our campaign, by the spreading the word, we can make sure that those who could benefit most hear about what we’re doing.  You get in touch if you think you have some skills we could use. 
We really appreciate your time reading and following our progress, we hope to see you in our new restaurant or in a festival field for some sushi and a chat.
